original: de lta bu'i 'du shes rags pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'du shes med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'du shes rags pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'du shes med ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “without ideation” because it does not take as its object such gross ideation.

original: 'gog pa'i snyom par 'jug pa ltar 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyom par 'jug pa ltar 'du shes rnam pa thams cad du bkag pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that ideation is completely blocked, as in the attainment of cessation.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes phra mo 'byung ba'i phyir 'du shes med min zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes phra mo 'byung ba'i phyir 'du shes med min zhes bya ste ;
translated: It is called “neither ideation nor non-ideation” because a subtle ideation of signlessness occurs.

original: de lta bu'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bsgom zhing gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bsgom zhing gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one cultivates and abides in such an attainment.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang kun rdzob tu sems sbyang ba'i phyir sgom pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang kun rdzob tu sems sbyang ba'i phyir sgom pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: “In a manner of non-apprehension” means that such an attainment is merely cultivated in order to purify the mind conventionally.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la dngos por dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la dngos por dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, unlike the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, one does not apprehend those attainments as real entities.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di snyoms par 'jug pa gong ma dag la ma smos kyang kun gyi mjug tu smos pas thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di snyoms par 'jug pa gong ma dag la ma smos kyang kun gyi mjug tu smos pas thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Although the words “in a manner of non-apprehension” are not mentioned in the above absorptions, they should be applied to all of them because they are mentioned at the end.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa'i zla la /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa'i zla la /
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s meditation, etc. is the conclusion of the teaching on accomplishing the perfection of generosity,

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: the cultivation of the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions in a manner of non-apprehension.

original: nam mkha'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan mas mnyam par 'jog cing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma med pa de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan mas mnyam par 'jog cing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma med pa de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
translated: “In the aspect, manner, and sign of space” means just as space is without aspect, manner, and sign such as color and shape, in the same way, the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions are also without aspect, manner, and sign.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la yang don dam par rnam pa dang tshul dang / mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa mnyam par 'jog go zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rnam par ldang ba'i tshe yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i tshe kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas te /🔽bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la yang don dam par rnam pa dang tshul dang / mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa mnyam par 'jog go zhes bya ba'i don to // rnam par ldang ba'i tshe yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i tshe kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnas te / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bsgom pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya ste /
translated: The meaning is that he enters them without apprehending them as forms, as aspects, as modes, or as signs.🔽And when he rises from them, he dedicates them to omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de nyid thabs @162a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de nyid thabs @162a * //
translated: The meaning is that when he rises from the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions, he remains in conventional truth and dedicates the wholesome roots of his cultivation of the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions to the omniscience of all sentient beings.

original: dang shes rab zung du 'brel cing /
analyzed: dang shes rab zung du 'brel cing /
translated: That very dedication is the method and wisdom combined.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And because the three spheres are completely purified, the perfection of generosity is complete.

original: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He practices the perfection of morality, and so on, up to

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva great being.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, thus a bodhisattva great being is said to have set out in the Great Vehicle.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang /
translated: Thus, in the context of the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance,

original: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bsgrub pa'i zhar la bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bsgrub pa'i zhar la bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
translated: meditative concentration, and wisdom, the cultivation of the meditative concentrations, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions is taught as a supplement to the practice of perfecting the perfections.

original: de dag gi don ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi don ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of these is the same as explained in the section on the perfection of generosity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems rgya chen po shin tu yangs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems rgya chen po shin tu yangs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, a bodhisattva great being’s mind endowed with love is vast, very vast, and so on up to

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this is the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.”

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bsgom pa'i zhar la pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bsgom pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi bsgom pa'i zhar la pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bsgom pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: This passage teaches that those who practice the four immeasurables, the four concentrations, and the four formless absorptions are practicing the six perfections in an ancillary way and are practicing them perfectly in the Great Vehicle. This is the second chapter.

original: de la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems rgya chen po shin tu yangs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems rgya chen po shin tu yangs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Venerable Śāradvatīputra said, Moreover, Venerable Subhūti, when a bodhisattva great being's mind endowed with love is vast, extensive,🔽 and so on.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la @162b bdag kyang bsgom zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la @162b bdag kyang bsgom zhing /
translated: The passage from Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, a bodhisattva great being's mind endowed with love is vast and extremely expansive up to This is the perfection of generosity of a bodhisattva great being explains how, while cultivating the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions,

original: de dag gi rang bzhin dang yon tan la sogs pa gzhan la yang ston pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin dang yon tan la sogs pa gzhan la yang ston pa ni /
translated: one teaches others the nature, qualities, and so forth of those meditative stabilizations,🔽immeasurables, and formless absorptions.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa yin pas bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa'i zhar la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa yin pas bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa'i zhar la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the generosity of Dharma. Thus it teaches how, in the context of cultivating the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions, the perfection of generosity is accomplished as a byproduct.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi don ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions is as explained above.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom pa de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro bas nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom pa de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes bstan pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro bas nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
translated: “This is the bodhisattva great beings’ meditative stabilization” shows that the very cultivation of the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions by way of not apprehending anything is the bodhisattva’s meditative stabilization.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gzhan la ston pa'i rgyu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gzhan la ston pa'i rgyu bstan pa ste /
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings, with a thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, preceded by great compassion, in order to completely eliminate the afflictions” shows the cause for teaching those concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions to others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan zhing snying rje chen po'i dbang du gyur pas sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan zhing snying rje chen po'i dbang du gyur pas sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir /
translated: Those bodhisattvas, endowed with the mind that wishes to attain the knowledge of all aspects and governed by great compassion, in order to eliminate the defilements of all sentient beings,🔽

original: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gzhan la ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gzhan la ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva, endowed with the thought that desires to attain the knowledge of all aspects, and having become subject to great compassion, teaches those meditative stabilizations, concentrations, and formless absorptions to others in order to eliminate the afflictions of all sentient beings.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de la de dag gzhan la brjod cing zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag gi ming tsam zhig gzhan la brjod pa'o //🔽'chad pa dang zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig rnams 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la de dag gzhan la brjod cing zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag gi ming tsam zhig gzhan la brjod pa'o // 'chad pa dang zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig rnams 'chad pa'o //
translated: There, he speaks of them to others means that he speaks to others just the names of those meditative stabilizations, etc.🔽 Explains means that he explains the etymologies.

original: ston cing zhes bya ba ni don dang tshig gnyi ga ston pa'o //
analyzed: ston cing zhes bya ba ni don dang tshig gnyi ga ston pa'o //
translated: Teaches means that he teaches both the meaning and the words.

original: 'grel pa la zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i tshig dang don mdor bsdus pa rnams zhib tu 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa la zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i tshig dang don mdor bsdus pa rnams zhib tu 'grel pa'o //
translated: Comments means that he comments in detail on the words and meanings of the meditative stabilizations, etc., which are summarized in brief.

original: rnam par 'byed cing zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams so sor phye ste ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed cing zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams so sor phye ste ston pa'o //
translated: Distinguishing means teaching the branches of the dhyanas, etc. individually.

original: gsal bar byed de zhes bya ba ni slon dpon @163a * //
analyzed: gsal bar byed de zhes bya ba ni slon dpon @163a * //
translated: Clarifying means teaching the masters of the doctrine.

original: 'chab pa med pa'i tshul gyis brda phrad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa med pa'i tshul gyis brda phrad par byed pa'o //
translated: Making understood means making them understand by the method of non-concealment.

original: de dag gi ro dang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ro la chags pa spang ba'i phyir thabs ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ro dang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ro la chags pa spang ba'i phyir thabs ston pa'o //
translated: The taste of those means teaching the method for abandoning attachment to the taste of the dhyanas, etc.

original: de dag gi skyon dang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ro la chags na de dag gi dbang gis gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba'i nyes pa'i dmigs ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi skyon dang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ro la chags na de dag gi dbang gis gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba'i nyes pa'i dmigs ston pa'o //
translated: The faults of those means teaching the faults of being born in the form and formless realms under the influence of attachment to the taste of the dhyanas, etc.

original: 'byung ba yang tshul bzhin du ston pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa 'di dag don dam par mi dmigs par ston pa nyid de dag gi ro la chags pa la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa las thar bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'byung ba tshul
analyzed: 'byung ba yang tshul bzhin du ston pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa 'di dag don dam par mi dmigs par ston pa nyid de dag gi ro la chags pa la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa las thar bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'byung ba tshul
translated: The phrase they also teach emergence properly means that they teach that these meditative stabilities, etc. are not ultimately observable, because they liberate one from the apprehension of signs, such as attachment to their enjoyment.

original: bzhin du ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called they teach emergence properly.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi las skabs 'dir go rims bsnor te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi las skabs 'dir go rims bsnor te /
translated: The four meditative stabilities, the four immeasurables, and the four formless meditative attainments are presented in a different order here than in the Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang por bshad pa ni byams pa dang snying rje'i dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang por bshad pa ni byams pa dang snying rje'i dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four immeasurables are explained first here because they establish one in the perfection of generosity through the power of love and compassion.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba de dag gis bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la mnyam par gzhog cing rnam par ldang yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba de dag gis bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la mnyam par gzhog cing rnam par ldang yang 'di lta ste /
translated: they do not open the way for other thoughts,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yang rung ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa yang rung ste /
translated: even those of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.🔽This is the perfection of morality of bodhisattva great beings that is not deficient.”

original: sems bskyed pa gzhan gyi go mi 'byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa'i zhar la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gzhan gyi go mi 'byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bsgom pa'i zhar la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching on the perfection of morality that is accomplished as a by-product of cultivating the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa bsgom pa'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i yid dam bcas pa las /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa bsgom pa'i tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i yid dam bcas pa las /
translated: When cultivating meditative stabilization and so forth, the bodhisattva does not change his or her mind from the resolve to attain omniscience,🔽and does not turn to the thought of attaining the state of a śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thob par byed pa'i sems mi sgyed pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' yid dam ma nyams pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽@163b de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas zhes bya ba nas /

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshad med pa rnams lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i yid dam bcas pa las ma nyams shing /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma nyams pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshad med pa rnams lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i yid dam bcas pa las ma nyams shing /
translated: Up to “the perfection of morality is not impaired” teaches the perfection of morality that is accomplished as a by-product of cultivating the immeasurables with enthusiasm.🔽It is the perfection of morality that is not impaired because it does not lapse from the vow to attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: nyan thos @165b dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par mi byed pa nyid tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos @165b dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par mi byed pa nyid tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma nyams pa yin no //
translated: and because it does not attain the levels of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: tshad med pa bzhi'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma ni rgya che ba dang / shin tu yangs pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi'i rnam pa dang / tshul dang mtshan ma ni rgya che ba dang / shin tu yangs pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The aspects, modes, and signs of the four immeasurables are as explained above, such as being vast and very extensive.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gis ma 'dres par rnam par spyod cing sa gnyis po nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'dod pa mi skyed kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mos shing dga' ba 'di ni byang chub sems
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gis ma 'dres par rnam par spyod cing sa gnyis po nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar 'dod pa mi skyed kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mos shing dga' ba 'di ni byang chub sems
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice those dhyānas, immeasurables, and formless absorptions without mixing them, and do not give rise to a desire for the two levels, the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level, but are interested in and delight in the knowledge of all aspects, this is the perfection of patience of bodhisattva great beings practicing the immeasurables.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching on the completion of the perfection of patience as a byproduct of cultivating the four immeasurables with enthusiasm.

original: skye ba med pa'i chos zab mos mi skrag cing ma skyes pa'i chos la bzod pa thob pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod pa mi skye bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mos shing dga' ba nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i chos zab mos mi skrag cing ma skyes pa'i chos la bzod pa thob pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'dod pa mi skye bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mos shing dga' ba nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu
translated: The perfection of patience is the delight and interest in the knowledge of all aspects, without generating the desire for the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels, through not being afraid of the profound Dharma of non-arising and attaining patience with respect to unborn dharmas.

original: phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is as follows.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: When bodhisattva mahāsattvas, through generating the mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus mi gtong bas rnam par spyod pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshad med pa rnams la spyod ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshad med
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i don du brtson 'grus mi gtong bas rnam par spyod pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshad med pa rnams la spyod ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshad med
translated: do not give up effort in order to completely abandon non-virtuous dharmas and perfect virtuous dharmas, this is the perfection of effort of bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the immeasurables.

original: pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste //
analyzed: pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste //
translated: The perfection of effort is taught as the result of the practice of the four right efforts.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa las bar ma dor sems zhum par mi byed pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams spang ba dang / gnyen po'i chos rnams goms par bya ba'i brtson 'grus mi gtong ba nyid brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa las bar ma dor sems zhum par mi byed pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams spang ba dang / gnyen po'i chos rnams goms par bya ba'i brtson 'grus mi gtong ba nyid brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is taught as the non-abandonment of the effort which does not allow the mind to become depressed in the generation of the thought of complete knowing, which abandons the dharmas of the side of defilement, and which cultivates the dharmas of the side of purification.

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang / @166a * //
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan dang / @166a * //
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is in meditative concentration,

original: tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la yang mnyam par gzhog la zhes bya ba nas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshad
analyzed: tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la yang mnyam par gzhog la zhes bya ba nas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshad
translated: And he enters these immeasurables and formless absorptions.🔽This is the perfection of meditative stabilization of bodhisattva great beings practicing the immeasurables.

original: med pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: med pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches that by cultivating the four immeasurables with enthusiasm, the perfection of meditative stabilization is accomplished as a byproduct.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi dbang gis skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i bde ba'i ro la myong zhing chags par mi byed pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba las sems gzhan du yengs par ma gyur pa nyid bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi dbang gis skye bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i bde ba'i ro la myong zhing chags par mi byed pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba las sems gzhan du yengs par ma gyur pa nyid bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o ;
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration is not being born under the influence of the concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions; not experiencing and being attached to the taste of the bliss of the concentrations and so on; and not letting the mind be distracted from the mental attentions directed toward omniscience under the influence of the concentrations and so on.

original: / nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the wisdom that is not conjoined with the śrāvaka and solitary buddha levels, from the bodhisattva great beings’ mental attentions associated with the knowledge of all aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshad med pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshad med pa bzhi lhur blangs te bsgom pa'i zhar la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs
translated: This, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva.”

original: par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: par sgrub pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to this point, it has been shown how, by cultivating the four immeasurables with enthusiasm, the perfection of wisdom is accomplished as a byproduct.

original: shes rab kyi dbang gis bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul du mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par yang rtog la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang gis bsam gtan la sogs pa de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'i tshul du mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par yang rtog la /
translated: By the power of wisdom, those concentrations and so forth are contemplated in the manner of the Śrāvaka Vehicle as impermanent, suffering, selfless, peaceful, empty, signless, and wishless.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par yang mi byed pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par yang mi byed pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And by not attaining the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, it is shown that this is the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni nang stong pa nyid shes kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni nang stong pa nyid shes kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva's Mahāyāna is the knowledge of inner emptiness, but not by way of apprehending it, and so on up to:

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid shes kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid shes kyang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma yin pa ste /
translated: the knowledge of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, but not by way of apprehending it.🔽 Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's Mahāyāna.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems @166b dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa nyid bco brgyad kun rdzob tu shes par byas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems @166b dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa nyid bco brgyad kun rdzob tu shes par byas nas /
translated: Up to here, it has been explained that the eighteen emptinesses are to be known conventionally,

original: don dam par mi dmigs pa theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par mi dmigs pa theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste lnga pa'o //
translated: and that the ultimate non-apprehension is the Mahāyāna, and that practicing in that way is being truly engaged in the Mahāyāna. This is the fifth chapter, on the Mahāyāna.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni chos thams cad la sems rnam par mi 'khrug cing mnyam par gzhag par shes pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni chos thams cad la sems rnam par mi 'khrug cing mnyam par gzhag par shes pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is the knowledge that the mind is undisturbed and equipoised with regard to all phenomena.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas sems ma yengs shing mnyam par gzhag pa nyid theg pa chen po yin la
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas sems ma yengs shing mnyam par gzhag pa nyid theg pa chen po yin la
translated: Not apprehending any phenomena as signs, the undistracted mind that is equipoised is the Great Vehicle.

original: / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni drug pa ste /
analyzed: / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni drug pa ste /
translated: The teaching that such practice is the correct engagement with the Great Vehicle is the sixth.

original: 'dir chos thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la bya ste /
translated: Here, “all phenomena” refers to the phenomena of complete purification.

original: sems rnam par mi 'khrug cing zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang mtshan mar me  'dzin cing sems mi g-yeng ba la bya'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par mi 'khrug cing zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang mtshan mar me  'dzin cing sems mi g-yeng ba la bya'o //
translated: “The mind is not disturbed” means that one does not apprehend the marks of the phenomena of purification, and the mind is not distracted.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni rtag ces bya bar shes par mi 'jug ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni rtag ces bya bar shes par mi 'jug ces bya ba nas /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s Mahāyāna is not engaged in the understanding that it is permanent, up to

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s Mahāyāna in the manner of not apprehending anything.”

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su mi 'dzin pa theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su mi 'dzin pa theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste bdun pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the Mahāyāna is not apprehending the two extremes of permanence and impermanence, and that practicing in that way is being truly engaged in the Mahāyāna.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'dod pa'i khams su shes pa 'jug par mi byed /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'dod pa'i khams su shes pa 'jug par mi byed /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva great beings’ Great Vehicle does not engage the mind in the desire realm,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su shes pa 'jug par mi byed la /🔽'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams mi shes @167a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su shes pa 'jug par mi byed la / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams mi shes @167a * //
translated: it does not engage the mind in the form and formless realms,

original: pa yang med pa ste /
analyzed: pa yang med pa ste /
translated: and it is not that the desire, form, and formless realms are not known.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par khams gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu khams gsum gyi mtshan nyid mi shes pa yang ma yin pa nyid theg pa chen po yin la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par khams gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu khams gsum gyi mtshan nyid mi shes pa yang ma yin pa nyid theg pa chen po yin la /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this too is the bodhisattva great beings’ Great Vehicle, in that it is the realization of the sameness of the three realms in the ultimate, and the non-ignorance of the characteristics of the three realms in the conventional.

original: de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth chapter on “The Great Vehicle.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, the Mahāyāna of the bodhisattva mahāsattva up to the Mahāyāna of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is the explanation of the chapter on the Mahāyāna.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The passage from Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, the Mahāyāna of the bodhisattva mahāsattva up to Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this too is the Mahāyāna of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, in the manner of not apprehending anything, explains that the Mahāyāna is the non-engagement of cognition in mundane and supramundane phenomena,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la shes pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams la shes pa mi 'jug la /
translated: defiled and undefiled phenomena, conditioned and unconditioned phenomena,

original: kun rdzob tu chos rnams so so'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa yang ma yin pa /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos rnams so so'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa yang ma yin pa /
translated: and the non-ignorance of the individual and general characteristics of phenomena conventionally.

original: theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste dgu pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yin pa dang / de ltar spyod pa nyid theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth chapter, on the explanation of the Mahāyāna.

original: de ltar theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'phags pa gang pos bstan pa dang / ji tsam gyis na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don 'phags pa gang pos bstan pa dang / ji tsam gyis na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin pa dang /

analyzed: bya ba'i yul rnams mi dmigs pa bstan to /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba ma 'dres par bsgom pa rnam par bsgom pa'i don du de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nang🔽stong pa nyid bsgom mo zhes bya ba nas /

translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, moreover, great bodhisattva beings who are skilled in the transcendent perfection of wisdom should cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena, and so on, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, without apprehending anything.🔽They should cultivate the applications of mindfulness, and so on, up to and including the noble eightfold path, without apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba ma 'dres par bsgom pa rnam par bsgom pa'i don du de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /

translated: They should cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and so on, up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, without apprehending anything.

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad rnam par mi rtog pa bsgom pa'i spyod pa bstan pa ste gnyis pa'o //

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba ma 'dres pas zhes bya ba'i don ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma 'dres pa la bya'o //

translated: The meaning of “with a distinct attention associated with the knowledge of all aspects” is that it is distinct from the attention of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and from the nonconceptual attention.

original: bsgom pa rnam par bsgom pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgom pa nyid don dam par dngos po med par bsgom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: The meaning of “for the sake of cultivating meditation” is that it is cultivated in such a way that ultimately it is cultivated as being devoid of entities.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba ma 'dres par bsgom pa rnam par bsgom pa'i don du de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dran

translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, for the sake of cultivating meditation with a distinct attention associated with the knowledge of all aspects, cultivate the applications of mindfulness without apprehending anything.

original: pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom mo zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji skad du smras pa bzhin te / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is just as you have said.🔽It is so,

original: de bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rab 'byor de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang ma byas /
translated: Subhūti, that is also not the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam par ma byas /
analyzed: rnam par ma byas /
translated: not differentiated,🔽not manifested.

original: mngon par ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go cha med pa'i don rab 'byor gyis bshad pa dang mthun par bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go cha med pa'i don rab 'byor gyis bshad pa dang mthun par bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: The meaning of “armor” is in accord with what Subhūti explained, and the Buddha said,

original: 'jig rten na go cha bgos pa ni dngos po 'ga' zhig bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten na go cha bgos pa ni dngos po 'ga' zhig bya ba'am /
translated: “In the world, those who don the armor do so in order to accomplish,

original: gzhig ba'am bcos pa'i phyir go cha bgo bar byed na /
analyzed: gzhig ba'am bcos pa'i phyir go cha bgo bar byed na /
translated: destroy, or fabricate some thing.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas byar yang med /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas byar yang med /
translated: However, the knowledge of all aspects is ultimately empty of inherent nature, so it is not something to be accomplished,

original: gzhig tu yang med /
analyzed: gzhig tu yang med /
translated: not something to be destroyed,🔽not something to be fabricated.

original: bcos su yang med la sems can gang gi don du go cha bgo bar bya ba'i sems can de dag kyang don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas byar yang med /
analyzed: bcos su yang med la sems can gang gi don du go cha bgo bar bya ba'i sems can de dag kyang don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas byar yang med /
translated: Also, those sentient beings for whose sake one dons the armor are ultimately empty of their own characteristics, so they are not something to be accomplished,

original: gzhig tu yang med bcos su yang med de /
analyzed: gzhig tu yang med bcos su yang med de /
translated: not something to be destroyed, not something to be fabricated.

original: de ltar rtogs pa nyid dngos por mi 'dzin pas go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa nyid dngos por mi 'dzin pas go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, because of not apprehending the realization itself as a thing, one dons the great armor.

original: de la ma byas zhes bya bas ni dngos po med pas byar med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma byas zhes bya bas ni dngos po med pas byar med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: There, “not made” shows that because of non-existence, there is nothing to be made.

original: rnam par ma byas zhes bya bas ni gzhig tu med pa bstan par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma byas zhes bya bas ni gzhig tu med pa bstan par blta'o //
translated: “Not formed” shows that it cannot be destroyed.

original: mngon par ma byas zhes bya bas ni bcos su med pa bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par ma byas zhes bya bas ni bcos su med pa bstan to //
translated: “Not produced” shows that it cannot be fabricated.

original: rab 'byor byed pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor byed pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma byas /
translated: Subhūti, because the activity is not apprehended, the knowledge of all aspects is not made,

original: rnam par ma byas /
analyzed: rnam par ma byas /
translated: not formed,🔽not produced.

original: mngon par ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ma byas pa dang / ma bshig pa dang / ma bcos pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ma byas pa dang / ma bshig pa dang / ma bcos pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
translated: And so on. “Not made,” “not destroyed,” and “not fabricated” are the reasons.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang 'byor 'di ltar gzugs mi byed rnam par mi byed /
analyzed: rang 'byor 'di ltar gzugs mi byed rnam par mi byed /
translated: Subhūti, form does not make, does not form,🔽does not produce.

original: mngon par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: And so on. This shows the reason that the activity is not apprehended.

original: byed pa po zhig yod na yang gzugs la sogs pa 'jig @171b rten pa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: byed pa po zhig yod na yang gzugs la sogs pa 'jig @171b rten pa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: If there is an agent, then it is either mundane phenomena such as form, etc.,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos shig yin grang na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos shig yin grang na /
translated: or supramundane phenomena such as the perfection of giving, etc., up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: kun rdzob tu de dag so so'i mtshan nyid la brtags na yang byed pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'grub la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de dag so so'i mtshan nyid la brtags na yang byed pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'grub la /
translated: But even if one examines their individual characteristics conventionally, the characteristic of an agent is not established.

original: don dam par yang de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir byed pa mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par yang de dag shin tu mi dmigs pa'i phyir byed pa mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And ultimately, since they are not apprehended at all, the agent is not apprehended.🔽Thus, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who has put on the great armor is said to have put on the armor without any armor.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni go cha med pa'i go cha bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni go cha med pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni go cha med pa'i go cha bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni go cha med pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the conclusion and teaching of the meaning of the absence of armor.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal te /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal te /
translated: He said: “Lord, I understand the meaning of what the Lord has said.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of “unbound and unfreed” is taught in the passage beginning with “Blessed One, form is neither bound nor freed.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni go cha chen po bgos pa'i dpe sgyu ma lta bu bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni go cha chen po bgos pa'i dpe sgyu ma lta bu bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i don dang sbyar na /
translated: The passage beginning with “Blessed One, I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said” applies the example of the great armor, which is like an illusion, to the meaning explained by the Blessed One.

original: don dam par go cha med pa yin la /
analyzed: don dam par go cha med pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the Blessed One’s statement is that ultimately there is no armor.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po rnams dang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po rnams dang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings la /
translated: Since the five aggregates, such as form, are ultimately unreal, it is not tenable to say that when one is an ordinary being one is bound by the afflictions,

original: 'phags par gyur pa'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa rnams las grol lo zhes byar yang mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags par gyur pa'i tshe ni nyon mongs pa rnams las grol lo zhes byar yang mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and that when one becomes an ārya one is freed from the afflictions. To teach this, the text says, “Form is neither bound nor freed,” and so on.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams gang gi bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams gang gi bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra said to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes pa rab 'byor gyis bstan pa'i don dang tshig slar brtag pa'i phyir de lta yin nam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes pa rab 'byor gyis bstan pa'i don dang tshig slar brtag pa'i phyir de lta yin nam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, is form unfettered and liberated?” and so on. This is asking whether the meaning and words taught by Subhūti that the five aggregates are unfettered and liberated are correct.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po de de bzhin te /🔽tshe dang ldan pa gang po gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga po ma bcings ma grol ba yin no @172a * //
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po de de bzhin te / tshe dang ldan pa gang po gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga po ma bcings ma grol ba yin no @172a * //
translated: He said, “Venerable Pūrṇa, it is so.

original: zhes rab 'byor gyis lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes rab 'byor gyis lan btab pa'o //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, form is unfettered and liberated,” and so on. This is Subhūti’s reply that the five aggregates are unfettered and liberated.

original: gang pos smras pa /
analyzed: gang pos smras pa /
translated: Pūrṇa said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba'i gzugs gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga rnams rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa rnams ma bcings ma grol ba yin par bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir dris🔽pa'o // smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba'i gzugs gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga rnams rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa rnams ma bcings ma grol ba yin par bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir dris pa'o // smras pa /
translated: The question beginning with “Venerable Subhūti, what is the form that is not bound and not liberated?” is asked in order to open the section teaching that the five aggregates, which are like dreams, etc., are not bound and not liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po gang 'di rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs de ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga rnams rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po gang 'di rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs de ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga rnams rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang /
translated: The answer beginning with “Venerable Pūrṇa, that form which is like a dream is not bound and not liberated” teaches that the five aggregates are like a dream, an illusion, an echo, an optical illusion, a reflection,

original: smig rgyu dang / sprul pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu dang / sprul pa lta bu yin te /
translated: a mirage, and a magical creation.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas bcings pa dang grol ba yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas bcings pa dang grol ba yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since such form, etc., do not exist in reality, they are not bound and not liberated.

original: che dang ldan pa gang po 'das pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: che dang ldan pa gang po 'das pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The past form of the venerable Pūrṇa is neither bound nor liberated.🔽

original: dus gsum gyi phung po lnga yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi phung po lnga yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with “Venerable Pūrṇa, past form is neither bound nor liberated” teaches that the five aggregates of the three times are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽tshe dang ldan pa gang po gzugs med pa'i phyir gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum gyi phung po lnga gong du smos pa rnams ma bcings ma grol ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / tshe dang ldan pa gang po gzugs med pa'i phyir gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum gyi phung po lnga gong du smos pa rnams ma bcings ma grol ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Why is that?🔽The passage beginning with “Venerable Pūrṇa, because form does not exist, form is neither bound nor liberated” teaches the reason why the five aggregates of the three times mentioned above are neither bound nor liberated.

original: dus gsum gyi phung po lnga yang don dam par dngos po med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi phung po lnga yang don dam par dngos po med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that the five aggregates of the three times are neither bound nor liberated because ultimately they are non-things, they are void, and they are unarisen.

original: che dang ldan pa gang po dge ba'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs su gtogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: che dang ldan pa gang po dge ba'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs su gtogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with “Venerable Pūrṇa, wholesome form is neither bound nor liberated” teaches that the five aggregates belonging to the types of wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de la dge ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mi ldan pa'o//
analyzed: de la dge ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mi ldan pa'o//
translated: Among them, wholesome is not associated with attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'o //🔽lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mi ldan pas gcig kho nar dge bar 'gyur bar lung bstan du yang mi mngon la /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'o // lung du ma bstan pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mi ldan pas gcig kho nar dge bar 'gyur bar lung bstan du yang mi mngon la /
translated: Unwholesome is associated with attachment, aversion, and delusion.🔽Neutral is not associated with attachment, aversion, and delusion. It is not evident that it is taught to be wholesome alone.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / @172b gti mug dang ma bral bas gcig kho nar mi dge bar 'gyur bar lung bstan du yang mi mngon te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / @172b gti mug dang ma bral bas gcig kho nar mi dge bar 'gyur bar lung bstan du yang mi mngon te /
translated: It is not evident that it is taught to be unwholesome alone, because it is not free from attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: bzo byed pa dang / spyod lam bzhi la gnas pa'i phung po lnga lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzo byed pa dang / spyod lam bzhi la gnas pa'i phung po lnga lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the five aggregates of one who is engaged in the four types of correct action.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang bo 'jig rten pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phung po lnga yang ma bcings ma grol ba'i zhes bstan pa ste /🔽de la 'jig rten pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa goms par byed pa la ma gtogs pa khams gsum du skye zhing 'bor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang bo 'jig rten pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phung po lnga yang ma bcings ma grol ba'i zhes bstan pa ste / de la 'jig rten pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa goms par byed pa la ma gtogs pa khams gsum du skye zhing 'bor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: The venerable Ghoṣaka says: “Worldly form is neither bound nor liberated,” and so on. He teaches that the five aggregates included in the mundane, supramundane, contaminated, and uncontaminated are neither bound nor liberated.🔽Among them, the mundane are those included in the three realms, who are born and die, except for those who cultivate the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa goms par byed pa khams gsum du skye zhing 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa goms par byed pa khams gsum du skye zhing 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: The supramundane are those who cultivate the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, who are not born and do not die in the three realms.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “With outflows” means together with the afflictions of the three realms.

original: zag pa med pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: “Without outflows” means not possessing the afflictions of the three realms.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gzugs med pa'i phyir gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po de ci'i phyir zhe na / gzugs med pa'i phyir gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, why is that?🔽“Because form is formless, it is neither bound nor liberated.” And so on. This teaches the reason why the five aggregates—virtuous, nonvirtuous, indeterminate, mundane, supramundane,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams ma bcings ma grol ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams ma bcings ma grol ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: with outflows, and without outflows—are neither bound nor liberated.

original: med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of nonexistence, voidness, and nonarising is as before.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po chos thams cad kyang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po chos thams cad kyang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa, all phenomena are neither bound nor liberated.

original: med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they do not exist, they are neither bound nor liberated.”

original: dben pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because of being void, it is neither bound nor liberated.🔽Because of being unborn, it is neither bound nor liberated.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir ma bcing sa ma grol ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir ma bcing sa ma grol ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad mdor bsdus te /
translated: This is the teaching of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena in brief,

original: ma bcings ma grol ba gtan tshigs dang bcas te pa stan pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba gtan tshigs dang bcas te pa stan pa'o //
translated: neither bound nor liberated, together with the reason.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa @173a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa @173a * //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, the perfection of generosity is neither bound nor liberated.🔽This and so forth

original: ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / 'dus ma byas pa la thug gi bar du dkar po'i chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol ba gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum dang bcas te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / 'dus ma byas pa la thug gi bar du dkar po'i chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol ba gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum dang bcas te bstan pa ste /
translated: is the teaching of all virtuous phenomena, from the six perfections up to the limit of reality and the unconditioned, neither bound nor liberated, together with the three types of reasons.

original: dkar po'i chos thams cad tshar gcig tu mi smos par ris ris su bcad cing med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni 'dul ba'i skye bo kha cig la de ltar ris ris su bcad de bstan na go sla zhing dad pa skye bar 'gyur ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshe dang ldan pa gang po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol bar rtogs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
analyzed: dkar po'i chos thams cad tshar gcig tu mi smos par ris ris su bcad cing med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni 'dul ba'i skye bo kha cig la de ltar ris ris su bcad de bstan na go sla zhing dad pa skye bar 'gyur ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro // tshe dang ldan pa gang po 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sgo ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol bar rtogs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: The reason why all the virtuous dharmas are not mentioned in one place, but are divided into parts and taught with the three reasons of non-existence, isolation, and non-arising, is that it is possible that some disciples may understand and develop faith when they are taught in this way, divided into parts.🔽This, Venerable Pūrṇa, is the Dharma gateway called unbound and unfreed of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: 'thob pa'i sgo'am rgyur gyur pa'i phyir chos kyi sgo zhes bya'o /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i sgo'am rgyur gyur pa'i phyir chos kyi sgo zhes bya'o /
translated: Because it becomes the gateway or cause for attaining the knowledge of all aspects, it is called a Dharma gateway.

original: de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma bcings ma grol pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma bcings ma grol pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The perfection of giving is unbound and unfreed, and so on, up to

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma bcings ma grol pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma bcings ma grol pa'o //
translated: the limit of reality is unbound and unfreed.

original: 'dus ma byas ma bcings ma grol ba ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkar po'i chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol ba'i chos kyi sgo yin par nges par gtan la phab ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma bcings ma grol ba ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkar po'i chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol ba'i chos kyi sgo yin par nges par gtan la phab ste bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to “unconditioned, unfettered, and liberated” is the teaching of ascertaining the door of Dharma of all virtuous dharmas as unfettered and liberated.

original: de ma bcings ma grol ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ma bcings ma grol ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “ Abiding in the perfection of giving that is unfettered and liberated” up to🔽“Venerable Pūrṇa, thus should a bodhisattva mahāsattva be known as wearing the great armor of the Mahāyāna that is unfettered and liberated.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma bcings ma grol ba'i theg pa chen po'i go cha bgos par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba'i go cha chen po bgos
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma bcings ma grol ba'i theg pa chen po'i go cha bgos par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba'i go cha chen po bgos
translated: Thus, wearing the great armor that is unfettered and liberated,

original: pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rlabs chen po spyod nus pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rlabs chen po spyod nus pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits of the perfection of wisdom are shown: the bodhisattva who has the perfection of wisdom is able to practice the great waves of bodhisattva conduct, such as ripening sentient beings, and never separates from the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma bcings ma grol ba /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma bcings ma grol ba /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, thus the bodhisattva mahāsattva, not bound, not liberated,🔽by the six perfections that are not bound, not liberated,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ma bcings ma grol bas med pa dang / dben pa dang / skye ba med pa nye bar bzung zhing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ma bcings ma grol bas med pa dang / dben pa dang / skye ba med pa nye bar bzung zhing /
translated: having taken up non-existence, isolation, and non-arising,🔽penetrates all phenomena.

original: chos @173b thams cad khong du chud par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos @173b thams cad khong du chud par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so on is the conclusion and teaching of the meaning of not bound, not liberated.

original: mdor na don dam par byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa chos thams cad kyang med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol bar khong du chud cing kun rdzob tu yang de la ma chags ma zhen par sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i las rnams mi byed pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mdor na don dam par byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa chos thams cad kyang med pa dang / dben pa dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol bar khong du chud cing kun rdzob tu yang de la ma chags ma zhen par sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i las rnams mi byed pa yang ma yin la /
translated: In brief, one should understand that ultimately, the bodhisattva, the six perfections, and all phenomena are unfettered and liberated because they do not exist, are void, and are unborn. And, on the relative level, one should not engage in the deeds of bringing sentient beings to maturity and so forth with attachment and clinging to them.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon rnams thob par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon rnams thob par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And, one should not fail to obtain the benefits such as never being separated from the blessed buddhas.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis go cha chen po bgos pa'i don bstan zin pa dang / de'i 'og tu yang 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig sngar smos pa las gleng bslangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis go cha chen po bgos pa'i don bstan zin pa dang / de'i 'og tu yang 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig sngar smos pa las gleng bslangs nas /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One has explained the meaning of donning the great armor, and after that, the noble Subhūti, in the context of the earlier statement “one who has set out in the Great Vehicle,”

original: theg pa chen po'i don rnam pa lnga zhu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don rnam pa lnga zhu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ask about the five topics of the Great Vehicle,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhu ba rnam pa lnga ni theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / ji tsam gyis na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par chud pa dang /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhu ba rnam pa lnga ni theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / ji tsam gyis na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par chud pa dang /
