translated: then it says, “Thereupon the venerable Subhūti addressed the Lord as follows,” and so on. The five topics of inquiry are: what is the Great Vehicle, by what extent is one considered to have correctly entered the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa de gang nas 'byung pa dang / theg pa de gang du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zhu ba dang lnga'o //
analyzed: theg pa de gang nas 'byung pa dang / theg pa de gang du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zhu ba dang lnga'o //
translated: where does that vehicle come from, where will that vehicle come to rest, and who will emerge from that vehicle.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis zhu ba rnam pa lnga zhus pa las /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis zhu ba rnam pa lnga zhus pa las /
translated: Having asked in this way, the Bhagavān said to the venerable Subhūti, and so on. From among the five topics of inquiry asked by Subhūti,

original: theg pa chen po gang lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: theg pa chen po gang lags zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: in response to the question, “What is the Great Vehicle?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po zhes bya ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po zhes bya ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: The Lord has explained the so-called Great Vehicle by dividing it into twenty-one aspects.

original: de la theg pa chen po rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug theg pa chen po yin pa dang / stong pa bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug theg pa chen po yin pa dang / stong pa bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
translated: The twenty-one aspects of the Great Vehicle are: the six perfections are the Great Vehicle; the eighteen emptinesses are the Great Vehicle; the meditative stabilizations are the Great Vehicle;

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / yang dag par sdod ba @174a * //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / yang dag par sdod ba @174a * //
translated: the four thorough abandonings are the Great Vehicle; the four legs of manifestation are the Great Vehicle;

original: rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / dbang po lnga theg pa chen po yin pa dang / stobs lnga theg pa chen po yin pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
analyzed: rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / dbang po lnga theg pa chen po yin pa dang / stobs lnga theg pa chen po yin pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
translated: the five faculties are the Great Vehicle; the five powers are the Great Vehicle; the seven branches of enlightenment are the Great Vehicle;

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa theg pa chen po yin pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / shes pa bcu theg pa chen po yin pa dang / dbang po gsum theg pa chen po yin pa dang /🔽rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum theg pa chen po yin pa dang / rjes su dran pa drug theg pa chen po yin pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / stobs bcu theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa theg pa chen po yin pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / shes pa bcu theg pa chen po yin pa dang / dbang po gsum theg pa chen po yin pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum theg pa chen po yin pa dang / rjes su dran pa drug theg pa chen po yin pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams theg pa chen po yin pa dang / stobs bcu theg pa chen po yin pa dang /
translated: the eightfold noble path is the Great Vehicle, the eight liberations are the Great Vehicle, the ten knowledges are the Great Vehicle, the three faculties are the Great Vehicle,🔽the three doors of liberation are the Great Vehicle, the six recollections are the Great Vehicle, the meditative absorptions are the Great Vehicle, the ten powers are the Great Vehicle,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa dang nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa dang nyi shu rtsa gcig go //
translated: the four fearlessnesses are the Great Vehicle, the four detailed and thorough knowledges are the Great Vehicle, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha are the Great Vehicle, and the dhāraṇī gateways are the Great Vehicle.

original: de la rab 'byor pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In this regard, Subhuti, the six perfections are the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: de ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: This, Subhuti, is the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: de la don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni phongs shing 'dod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni phongs shing 'dod pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, one who is in need is one who is in want and desire.

original: phyi nang gi dngos po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for outer and inner things,

original: phyi'i dngos po ni gser dngul dang / dang zab la sogs pa bdag gi lus la ma gtogs pa'i nor rdzas rnams so //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po ni gser dngul dang / dang zab la sogs pa bdag gi lus la ma gtogs pa'i nor rdzas rnams so //
translated: outer things are gold, silver, jewels, etc., and wealth and goods other than one's own body.

original: nang gi dngos po ni lus dang mgo la sogs pa yan lag dang nyid lag rnams yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po ni lus dang mgo la sogs pa yan lag dang nyid lag rnams yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Inner things are the giving away of one's body, head, etc., and the major and minor parts of the body.🔽

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis yongs su rdzogs par byed cing de'i bsod nams kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis yongs su rdzogs par byed cing de'i bsod nams kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: Thus, the six perfections are completed with a mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, and their merit is made common to all sentient beings.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba nyid gang zag dang chos la bdag med @174b par rtogs shing bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yin pas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o🔽// sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba nyid gang zag dang chos la bdag med @174b par rtogs shing bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yin pas theg pa chen po zhes bya'o // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: And that is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by way of nonapprehending. Since it is the perfect fulfillment of one's own and others' goals, it is the realization of the selflessness of persons and of phenomena. It is called the Great Vehicle.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni bstan /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ni bstan /
translated: In the context of the perfection of generosity, it is taught that one should make it common to all sentient beings and dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sems can pha rol po sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang / rab tu dgod pa la bstan la /
analyzed: sems can pha rol po sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang / rab tu dgod pa la bstan la /
translated: It is taught that one should encourage other sentient beings to give, and establish them in giving.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams la sems can pha rol po rnams kyang tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang ; rab tu dgod pa bstan la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan rnams la sems can pha rol po rnams kyang tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang ; rab tu dgod pa bstan la /
translated: It is taught that one should encourage other sentient beings to observe morality, etc., and establish them in morality, etc.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas ma bstan du zin yang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas ma bstan du zin yang /
translated: Even though it is not taught that one should dedicate the merit to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: sems can pha rol po rnams yang dag par bskul pa yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su sbyar zhing /
analyzed: sems can pha rol po rnams yang dag par bskul pa yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs su sbyar zhing /
translated: it should be understood that one should encourage other sentient beings in the context of the perfection of giving,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la sbyar ba don gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la sbyar ba don gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: and that one should dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in the context of the perfection of morality, etc.

original: yang dag par bskul ba ni dang po spyod du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul ba ni dang po spyod du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Encouraging is to cause to enter into practice at the beginning.

original: gzhog pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gnas shing nyams su len du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhog pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la gnas shing nyams su len du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Establishing is to cause to abide in the perfections and to practice them.

original: pha rol tu dgod pa ni de bas kyang bstan par byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa las mi nyams shing 'bras bu thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu dgod pa ni de bas kyang bstan par byas nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa las mi nyams shing 'bras bu thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Establishing in the other side is to cause to attain the result by not letting the practice of the six perfections decline, having taught them even more.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva is as follows:

original: nang stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, and so on, up to...

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa nyid bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa nyid bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva. This teaches that the eighteen kinds of emptiness are the Great Vehicle.

original: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Regarding What is the emptiness of internal phenomena? and so on, it teaches the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: mig dang yid kyi bar du nang gi dbang po drug rnams bdag gi lus dang sems kyis zin pa'i phyir nang gi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang yid kyi bar du nang gi dbang po drug rnams bdag gi lus dang sems kyis zin pa'i phyir nang gi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The six inner faculties, from the eye to the mind, are called inner phenomena because they are grasped by the body and mind of a self.

original: mi rtag mi 'jigs pa'i phyir mig mig gis stong zhes bya ba ni mig dngos po zhig yod na rtag pa'i @175a * //🔽rang bzhin rnams mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: mi rtag mi 'jigs pa'i phyir mig mig gis stong zhes bya ba ni mig dngos po zhig yod na rtag pa'i @175a * // rang bzhin rnams mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin grang na /
translated: Because it is impermanent and does not perish, the eye is empty of the eye. If the eye existed as a thing, it would either be permanent or impermanent.

original: don dam par mig dngos po med pas rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par mig dngos po med pas rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
translated: But because the eye does not exist as a thing ultimately, it is impermanent because it is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'jig pa'o //
translated: Because it is not impermanent, it does not perish.

original: de ltar dngos po med cing mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i phyir mig de mig gi dngos pos stong pas na /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med cing mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i phyir mig de mig gi dngos pos stong pas na /
translated: Thus, because it does not exist as a thing, is impermanent, and does not perish, the eye is empty of the entity of the eye.

original: mig mig gis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mig mig gis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The eye is empty of the eye.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la mig gi dngos po med pa nyid de'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig la mig gi dngos po med pa nyid de'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: Because that is its nature. The nonexistence of the eye as the entity of the eye is its nature.

original: rgyu gzhan gyis bshig ste stong par byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyis bshig ste stong par byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not destroyed by another cause and made empty.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa 'og ma thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa 'og ma thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be applied to all the remaining faculties such as the ear, etc.

original: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Regarding the question, “What is external emptiness?” and so on, it teaches external emptiness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa chos kyi bar du yul drug po de rnams phyi rol du dmigs pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa chos kyi bar du yul drug po de rnams phyi rol du dmigs pa'i yul yin la /
translated: The six objects such as form and so on up to phenomena are external objects that are observed as external.

original: bdag gi lus dang sems kyis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi chos rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang sems kyis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi chos rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they are not appropriated by one’s body and mind, they are called external phenomena.

original: de dag stong pa nyid kyi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag stong pa nyid kyi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of their emptiness is as before.

original: de la phyi nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi nang stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la phyi nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi nang stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Regarding the question, “What is internal and external emptiness?” and so on, it teaches internal and external emptiness.

original: nang gi chos rnams phyi'i chos kyis stong /
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams phyi'i chos kyis stong /
translated: Internal phenomena are empty of external phenomena.

original: phyi'i chos rnams nang gi chos kyis stong ste zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa sngar bshad zin pas skabs 'dir nang gi skye mched rnams la yang phyi'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin med pa dang🔽/ phyi'i skye mched rnams la yang nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do zhes bstan to //🔽de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang zhen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams nang gi chos kyis stong ste zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis rnams kyi so so'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa sngar bshad zin pas skabs 'dir nang gi skye mched rnams la yang phyi'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin med pa dang / phyi'i skye mched rnams la yang nang gi skye mched rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir phyi nang stong pa nyid do zhes bstan to // de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang zhen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: External phenomena are empty of internal phenomena means that the individual natures of the twelve internal and external bases are empty, as has already been explained.

original: chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos rnams stong ngo zhes bya ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos rnams stong ngo zhes bya ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de yang /
translated: Therefore, in this context, the internal bases do not have the nature of the external bases and the external bases do not have the nature of the internal bases.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist in the nature of emptiness.

original: de rang bzhin gyis stong pa la stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rang bzhin gyis stong pa la stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature is called emptiness.

original: de la chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @175b chen po stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @175b chen po stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: What is the emptiness of the great?

original: snod kyi 'jig rten phyogs bcu la sogs pa tha gru yangs shing gzhi che ba rnams rang bzhin med pa la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten phyogs bcu la sogs pa tha gru yangs shing gzhi che ba rnams rang bzhin med pa la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The great refers to the vast and extensive world systems of the ten directions and so on, which are said to be empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de la don dam pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: What is the emptiness of the ultimate?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de don du sgrub pa'i nang na mchog dam pa yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de don du sgrub pa'i nang na mchog dam pa yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Nirvana is called the ultimate because it is the supreme and highest among all that is to be accomplished.

original: rnam pa gnyis su na ye shes dam pa'i dmigs pa'i yul lam don yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su na ye shes dam pa'i dmigs pa'i yul lam don yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In another way, it is called the ultimate because it is the object or referent of the highest wisdom.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de'i rang bzhin med pa la don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de'i rang bzhin med pa la don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of the nature of nirvana.

original: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the emptiness of the conditioned begins with the question, “What is the emptiness of the conditioned?”

original: khams gsum du skye zhing gnas pa'i chos rnams ni las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs pas byas shing bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams gsum du skye zhing gnas pa'i chos rnams ni las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs pas byas shing bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
translated: The phenomena that arise and abide in the three realms are called “conditioned” because they are created and produced by the assembly and combination of causes and conditions, such as karma and afflictions.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin med pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin med pa ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the nature of those is called “the emptiness of the conditioned.”

original: de la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the emptiness of the unconditioned begins with the question, “What is the emptiness of the unconditioned?”

original: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the nature of the unconditioned.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs shing 'dus pas ma byas ma bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs shing 'dus pas ma byas ma bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not produced or generated by the assembly and convergence of causes and conditions such as karma, defilements and so on.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i chos de rnams ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i chos de rnams ni 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is a phenomenon that does not arise, does not cease and does not change from the state of rest and it is called unconditioned.

original: de dag kyang nam mkha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtag pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang nam mkha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtag pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
translated: It is also called space, suchness, analytical cessation and nonanalytical cessation.

original: chos de dag rang bzhin med pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag rang bzhin med pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The absence of intrinsic existence of these phenomena is called the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes begins with the question, What is the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes?

original: rtag pa'i mtha' dang / chad pa'i mtha' la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis mi dmigs pa nyid @176a * //🔽mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtha' dang / chad pa'i mtha' la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis mi dmigs pa nyid @176a * // mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The transcendence of extremes is the non-apprehension of the two extremes, such as the extreme of eternalism and the extreme of nihilism.

original: de'i rang bzhin med pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin med pa ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of that is called the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes.

original: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless begins with the question, What is the emptiness of the beginningless and endless?

original: gang la thog ma mi dmigs shing /🔽tha ma mi dmigs pa de la 'gro ba mi dmigs 'ong ba mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang la thog ma mi dmigs shing / tha ma mi dmigs pa de la 'gro ba mi dmigs 'ong ba mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is not apprehended in the beginning🔽and is not apprehended in the end is not apprehended as going or coming.

original: 'khor ba la thog ma yang mi dmigs tha ma yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'khor ba la thog ma yang mi dmigs tha ma yang mi dmigs te /
translated: Samsara is not apprehended in the beginning and is not apprehended in the end.

original: thog ma dang tha ma gnyis med pas dbus kyang mi dmigs so ;
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma gnyis med pas dbus kyang mi dmigs so ;
translated: Since neither a beginning nor an end exist, the middle is also not apprehended.

original: ; de ltar mtha' gnyis dang dbus kyang med pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ; de ltar mtha' gnyis dang dbus kyang med pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs te /
translated: Thus, because there is no end, no middle, and no middle, coming and going are not perceived.

original: de ltar 'khor ba'i rang bzhin med pa nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba'i rang bzhin med pa nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, the absence of any intrinsic nature in cyclic existence is called “the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.

original: de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “What is the emptiness of non-rejection?” and so forth.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: gang la gang yang dor ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gang la gang yang dor ba med pa ste zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
translated: “There is nothing whatsoever that is rejected” refers to the nirvana in which the remainder of the aggregates does not remain.

original: dor ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: dor ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
translated: “Rejection” refers to the five contaminated aggregates.

original: phung po lnga po de dag phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan la 'das pa'i tshe med par gyur pa'i phyir dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan la 'das pa'i tshe med par gyur pa'i phyir dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When those five aggregates do not remain in the nirvana in which the remainder of the aggregates does not remain, they are said to be “non-rejected.”

original: dor ba med pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa de de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa de de'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That nirvana which is the nature of non-rejection is empty of the nature of non-rejection, and this is called “the emptiness of non-rejection.”

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi skabs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bshad pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi skabs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bshad pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid las dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: In the context of the emptiness of the ultimate, nirvana is explained, intending the nirvana with remainder of aggregates, which is characterized by freedom from afflictions.

original: 'dir ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dgongs te gsungs pas zlos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dgongs te gsungs pas zlos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, however, it is explained intending the nirvana without remainder of aggregates, so there is no repetition.

original: de la rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Regarding the passage beginning “What is the emptiness of nature?” and so on, it teaches the emptiness of nature.

original: 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ye nas stong pa nyid yin pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems @176b dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang yod pa'am med par ma byas pas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ye nas stong pa nyid yin pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems @176b dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang yod pa'am med par ma byas pas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since the nature of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena is primordially emptiness, it is not made existent or nonexistent by śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, or tathāgatas. Therefore, because of being empty of nature, it is called “emptiness of nature.”

original: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Regarding “emptiness of all phenomena,” and so on, it teaches the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug dang / gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug dang / gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang /
translated: “All phenomena” refers to the five aggregates, the twelve sense bases, the eighteen elements, the six kinds of contact, the six kinds of feeling that arise from the condition of contact, the form realm, the formless realm,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: conditioned phenomena, and unconditioned phenomena.

original: chos de dag gi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The non-existence of the intrinsic nature of those dharmas is called the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: As for the question, “What is the emptiness of intrinsic nature?” and so on, it teaches the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams don dam par yod pa ma yin pas de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang med pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams don dam par yod pa ma yin pas de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang med pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since conditioned and unconditioned dharmas do not exist ultimately, their intrinsic nature also does not exist, and therefore it is called the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan ni rang log tu zad pas bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan ni rang log tu zad pas bshad mi dgos so //
translated: Since the other characteristics are just the opposite of intrinsic nature, there is no need to explain them.

original: bshad dgos pa nyi tshe zhig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad dgos pa nyi tshe zhig bshad par bya ste /
translated: But we will explain just the ones that need to be explained.

original: khams ni gdug pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni khams bco brgyad 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams ni gdug pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni khams bco brgyad 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eighteen constituents have the characteristic of being poisonous because they are the cause of saṃsāra.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa la nyes pa mi 'byung bas phyis mi 'gyod cing sems la gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa la nyes pa mi 'byung bas phyis mi 'gyod cing sems la gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The perfection of morality has the characteristic of being without torment, because there is no regret later on and no mental torment for one who possesses morality, since no fault arises.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa la bdud la sogs pa bar du gcod pa rnams kyis mi brdzi zhing mi thub pa'i phyir ro //🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yang dag par 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa sems rtse gcig tu 'dus shing bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par byed cing dge ba'i
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa la bdud la sogs pa bar du gcod pa rnams kyis mi brdzi zhing mi thub pa'i phyir ro // bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yang dag par 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa sems rtse gcig tu 'dus shing bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas sems can yongs su smin par byed cing dge ba'i
translated: The perfection of effort has the characteristic of being invincible, because one who possesses effort cannot be overcome or defeated by demons and other obstacles.

original: rtsa ba 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration has the characteristic of being well assembled, because one who possesses meditative concentration has a mind that is well assembled and one pointed, and by the fruits of meditative concentration such as the superknowledges, one ripens sentient beings and assembles the roots of virtue.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyis chos @177a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyis chos @177a * //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called the characteristic of nonattachment.

original: thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs nas /
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs nas /
translated: Having realized with wisdom that all phenomena are essenceless,

original: ci la yang ma chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci la yang ma chags par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: one becomes unattached to anything.

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni /
translated: The four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions

original: 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: are called the characteristic of nondisturbance.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa 'di rnams sems g-yeng zhing 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa 'di rnams sems g-yeng zhing 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir ro // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa /
translated: Because these concentrations and so forth are not disturbed by a distracted mind.🔽The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are called the characteristic of emergence.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams 'khor ba nas 'byung zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnams 'khor ba nas 'byung zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, such as the four establishments of mindfulness, are the cause for emerging from saṃsāra and attaining nirvāṇa.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad stong par rtogs shing dngos po gang dang yang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ni dben pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad stong par rtogs shing dngos po gang dang yang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness gate of liberation has the characteristic of being void, because all phenomena are realized to be empty and are not mixed with any entity.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan ma sna tshogs su mi 'dzin pa nyid zhi ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mtshan ma sna tshogs su mi 'dzin pa nyid zhi ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The signless gate of liberation has the characteristic of being peace, because it does not apprehend various signs.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni khams gsum gyi bde ba la ma chags shing mi smon pas /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa ni sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni khams gsum gyi bde ba la ma chags shing mi smon pas /
translated: The wishless gate of liberation has the characteristic of eliminating suffering, because it is not attached to or wishes for the happiness of the three realms.

original: de thob par bya ba'i sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no suffering to attain it.

original: rnam par grol ba rnam par 'grel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par thar pa brgyad la rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnam par 'grel ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par thar pa brgyad la rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the explanation of liberation is the eight liberations.

original: de dag khams gsum gyi lus la sogs pa la ma chags pa las grol zhing thar bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag khams gsum gyi lus la sogs pa la ma chags pa las grol zhing thar bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they liberate and free from attachment to the body, etc. of the three realms.

original: stobs rnams ni shin tu rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shin tu rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: stobs rnams ni shin tu rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir shin tu rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The powers have the characteristic of complete realization, because the ten powers of the Tathagata, such as the knowledge of the possible and impossible, etc. have the nature of knowledge.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams ni shin tu bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan na bdud la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing bsgyur du mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams ni shin tu bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan na bdud la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis zil gyis mi non cing bsgyur du mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fearlessnesses have the characteristic of complete demonstration, because when one possesses the four forms of fearlessness, one is not overwhelmed by Mara, etc. or by adversaries.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa bzhi dang ldan na @177b bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro //🔽dga' ba chen po ni rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob na byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis thob pa dang 'dra bar rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa bzhi dang ldan na @177b bdud la sogs pas bar chad bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro // dga' ba chen po ni rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob na byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis thob pa dang 'dra bar rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The analytical knowledges have the defining characteristic of being unbreakable, because when one possesses the four beginning with the analytical knowledge of the teachings, one cannot be obstructed by demons, etc.🔽Great joy has the defining characteristic of delight, because when sentient beings obtain mundane and supramundane perfections, the bodhisattva is delighted as if he himself had obtained them.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob pa'i tshe na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa rab tu rtogs pa'i tshe dga' ba'i shugs chen po 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob pa'i tshe na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa rab tu rtogs pa'i tshe dga' ba'i shugs chen po 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: Or else, when the bodhisattva obtains the first stage, he realizes the purity of the realm of the Dharma, and a great flood of joy arises.

original: btang snyoms chen po ni 'dre pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dgra dang zin gnyis la byams sdang med par sems snyoms pas byams pa dang sdang ba'i sems la snyoms pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po ni 'dre pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dgra dang zin gnyis la byams sdang med par sems snyoms pas byams pa dang sdang ba'i sems la snyoms pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great equanimity is called the “trait of non-mixture.” It is equanimity of mind toward friend and enemy, without love and hate, and it is equanimity of mind toward love and hate, because it is unmixed with them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni mi 'phrogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas 'grib pa'am nyams par bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni mi 'phrogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas 'grib pa'am nyams par bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are called the “trait of non-sublation.” They are the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, the three ways of being vigilant, and the two kinds of mindfulness. They are not sublated or diminished by demons, tīrthikas, and so on, because the Tathāgata is without error and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes de shes par bya ba'i yul thams cad la skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes de shes par bya ba'i yul thams cad la skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin
translated: The gnosis of the knowledge of all aspects is called the “trait of direct perception.” The gnosis of the knowledge of all aspects is like a myrobalan fruit placed in the palm of the hand.

original: du sgrib pa dang thogs pa med par mngon sum du gsal bar thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du sgrib pa dang thogs pa med par mngon sum du gsal bar thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has directly realized them clearly, without obscuration or obstruction.

original: mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are neither permanent nor annihilated,🔽all those phenomena, whose individual characteristics are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena and the characteristics of unconditioned phenomena, are empty of those characteristics.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i rang rang gi mtshan nyid de dag gi chos de dag thams cad kyis stong ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi don mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i rang rang gi mtshan nyid de dag gi chos de dag thams cad kyis stong ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi don mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning of emptiness of individual characteristics in brief.

original: mdor na 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdor na 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas de dag gi mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In brief, all unconditioned phenomena are ultimately unreal, and therefore their characteristics do not exist. This is the meaning of emptiness.

original: de la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Regarding the emptiness of non-apprehension, the root text states, “What is the emptiness of non-apprehension?”

original: 'das pa ni dngos po med par gyur zin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni da dud dngos por ma red @178a * //
analyzed: 'das pa ni dngos po med par gyur zin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni da dud dngos por ma red @178a * //
translated: The past is that which has already ceased to exist as a thing, and the future is that which has not yet come into existence as a thing.🔽The present is not established as enduring in terms of an instant.

original: pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni skad cig gi tshul gyis gnas pa ma grub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni skad cig gi tshul gyis gnas pa ma grub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “non-apprehension.”

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de nyid kyang dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba de nyid kyang dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is called “non-apprehension” is also not an existent thing.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “the emptiness of non-apprehension.”

original: de la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: Regarding the question, “What is the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence?” and so forth, it teaches the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence.

original: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba na rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs pa'i mthu las skye'i gzhan la mi ltos pa'i rang skye ba ni med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba na rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus shing tshogs pa'i mthu las skye'i gzhan la mi ltos pa'i rang skye ba ni med de /
translated: All phenomena are without an essential nature that is a composite because they arise in dependence on conditions.

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skyes pa de ni yang dag par skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis skyes pa de ni yang dag par skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is produced by the power of other causes and conditions is not really produced.

original: 'dus pa las skyes pa ni ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dus pa las skyes pa ni ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that what is produced from a collection is essenceless.

original: de bas na 'dus pa 'dus pas stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dus pa 'dus pas stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the collection is empty of the collection.

original: rgyu rkyen 'dus pa las byung ba rnams ni yang dag par skyes pa ma yin pas 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen 'dus pa las byung ba rnams ni yang dag par skyes pa ma yin pas 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since those that arise from the collection of causes and conditions are not really produced, it is taught that they are empty of the nature of a collection.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, entities are empty of entities, and so on, is another way of explaining the emptiness of the nature of nonentities.

original: dngos po med pa zhes smos pa dang / dngos po yod pa yang zlas 'grub /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes smos pa dang / dngos po yod pa yang zlas 'grub /
translated: The term nonentity and the term existent entity are mutually established.

original: dngos po yod med gnyis smos pa dang / bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po gnyis kyang zhar la brtag dgos te /
analyzed: dngos po yod med gnyis smos pa dang / bdag gi dngos po dang gzhan gyi dngos po gnyis kyang zhar la brtag dgos te /
translated: The terms existent entity and nonexistent entity and the terms one’s own entity and another’s entity must also be examined in this context.

original: de bas na dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
translated: Therefore, an existent thing is empty of an existent thing.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
translated: A non-existent thing is empty of a non-existent thing.

original: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: A nature is empty of a nature.🔽An other-existent thing is empty of an other-existent thing.

original: gzhan gyis dngos po ni gzhan gyi dngos pos stong ngo zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhir phye ste gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dngos po ni gzhan gyi dngos pos stong ngo zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhir phye ste gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is explained as being divided into four types.🔽Here, what is called an existent thing?

original: de la dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir phye ste /🔽bstan pa stong pa nyid yin par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir phye ste / bstan pa stong pa nyid yin par bshad pa ste /
translated: and so on. The division into four types of existent thing and non-existent thing and so on is explained as emptiness.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis stong par bshad pa ni rang log tu zad do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis stong par bshad pa ni rang log tu zad do //
translated: The explanation of the emptiness of existent thing and non-existent thing is just a self-refutation.🔽How is a nature empty of a nature?

original: ji ltar na rang bzhin rang bzhin gyis stong zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na rang bzhin rang bzhin gyis stong zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: and so on. The teaching of the emptiness of its own entity is as follows.

original: @178b rang gi dngos po de yang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir byar rung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: @178b rang gi dngos po de yang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir byar rung ba ma yin pas /
translated: Since that intrinsic reality is also devoid of essence, it is not suitable to be produced.

original: shes pas ma byas mthong bas ma byas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes pas ma byas mthong bas ma byas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “It is not produced by consciousness, it is not produced by seeing.”

original: shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
translated: “Consciousness” refers to nonconceptual wisdom.

original: mthong ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las byung ba dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las byung ba dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: “Seeing” refers to the pure mundane wisdom that arises after nonconceptual wisdom.

original: shes pa dang mthong ba des kyang ma byas pa'i phyir stong ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba des kyang ma byas pa'i phyir stong ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not produced by that consciousness and that seeing, it is empty.🔽Regarding this, what is the emptiness of other entities?

original: de la gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the emptiness of other entities.

original: chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos nyid la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos nyid la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: These synonyms for suchness, such as the reality of phenomena and the nature of phenomena, whether the tathāgatas appear in the world or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni ye nas de bzhin du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni ye nas de bzhin du gnas pa ste /
translated: The reality of phenomena has always been just as it is.

original: de dag la phung po la sogs pa chos gzhan rnams kyi dngos po med pa de nyid gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la phung po la sogs pa chos gzhan rnams kyi dngos po med pa de nyid gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The non-existence of other phenomena, such as the aggregates, in those is called the emptiness of the non-existence of other.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is as follows:

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnams theg pa chen po yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnams theg pa chen po yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The concentrations, beginning with the concentration called “heroic stride,” are the Great Vehicle.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi spyi'i don ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du mnyam par gzhag pa las sngon gyi spyod pa dang smon lam gyi mthus sems can yongs su
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi spyi'i don ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du mnyam par gzhag pa las sngon gyi spyod pa dang smon lam gyi mthus sems can yongs su
translated: The general meaning of the concentrations is that, through the power of their previous conduct and aspirations, the non-conceptual wisdom of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, which is characterized by a one-pointed mind, is in equipoise.

original: smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la sogs pa mthu rnam pa sna tshogs lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ba tha dad pa las ming rnam pa sna tshogs su btags te bstan to //🔽de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la sogs pa mthu rnam pa sna tshogs lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ba tha dad pa las ming rnam pa sna tshogs su btags te bstan to // de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The various powers are spontaneously accomplished in various ways, such as in ripening beings and in purifying the Buddha-land. They are taught by being given various names.

original: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the explanation of the names of the meditative stabilizations begins with “What is the meditative stabilization called ‘Heroic Valour’?” and continues up to “What is the meditative stabilization called ‘Space-like Non-attachment, Liberation, and Non-defilement’?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u brgyad pa'o /🔽// / de la dpa' par 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin @179a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u brgyad pa'o / // / de la dpa' par 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin @179a * //
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in one hundred and fifty verses, called “Extensive Exposition.

original: gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming don dang rjes su mthun par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming don dang rjes su mthun par bshad pa ste /
translated: Here, the explanation of the names of the meditative stabilizations that accord with their meanings begins with “What is the meditative stabilization called ‘Heroic Valour’?” and continues up to “What is the meditative stabilization called ‘Space-like Non-attachment, Liberation, and Non-defilement’?

original: de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod yul la spyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mi dpa' bo de bdag gi yul yang srung nus la /
analyzed: de la dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod yul la spyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mi dpa' bo de bdag gi yul yang srung nus la /
translated: What is the samadhi called “heroic progress”?🔽That samadhi is the domain of activity of all samadhis.

original: gzhan gyi yul yang srung nus pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'di la mnyam par gzhag na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul yang srung nus pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'di la mnyam par gzhag na /
translated: Just as that hero is able to protect his own domain and is able to protect the domain of others, in the same way, when one rests in equipoise in this samadhi,🔽one has the power to realize the ultimate non-arising of all phenomena and the conventional ability to engage in various activities for the welfare of sentient beings, which are the results of samadhi.

original: bdag gi spyod yul dang ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi spyod yul don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs spyod nus pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir dpa' bar 'gro ba dang 'dra bas dpa' bar 'gro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi spyod yul dang ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi spyod yul don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs pa dang / kun rdzob tu ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs spyod nus pa'i mthu yod pa'i phyir dpa' bar 'gro ba dang 'dra bas dpa' bar 'gro zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “heroic progress” because it is like a hero.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tshig ni skabs 'dir rtogs pa'am dpyod pa la bya'o//
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tshig ni skabs 'dir rtogs pa'am dpyod pa la bya'o//
translated: The word “progress” in this context refers to realization or analysis.

original: de la rin chen phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rin chen phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Ratnamudra samadhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin des ting nge 'dzin thams cad rgyas btab pa lta bur 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin des ting nge 'dzin thams cad rgyas btab pa lta bur 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: It is the samadhi in which all samadhis are sealed.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad so so'i spyod yul las mi 'gyur zhing rgyas btab pa bzhin du gnas pa'i mthu dang ldan pa la rin chen phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad so so'i spyod yul las mi 'gyur zhing rgyas btab pa bzhin du gnas pa'i mthu dang ldan pa la rin chen phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is absorbed in this samadhi, all the samadhis in one's own and others' mindstreams are sealed, as it were, and remain in their own sphere. It is called Ratnamudra because it has the power to seal all samadhis in one's own and others' mindstreams, so that they remain in their own sphere and do not move from it.

original: rin che ba de ni ting nge 'dzin de lta bu thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin zhing dkon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin che ba de ni ting nge 'dzin de lta bu thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin zhing dkon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is precious because it is the domain of no one, being so rare.

original: de la seng ge rnam par rtse ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la seng ge rnam par rtse ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Simhavijrmbhita samadhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis rnam par rtse ba ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar seng ge gcan gzan thams cad kyis 'jigs pa med cing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis rnam par rtse ba ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar seng ge gcan gzan thams cad kyis 'jigs pa med cing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative absorption, one plays with all meditative absorptions.🔽Just as a lion is fearless of all beasts of prey and,

original: gcan gzan dang ri dags thams cad zil gyis mnan te rgyu ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis mnan nas thams cad la spyod pa'i mthu dang ldan pa la seng ge rnam par🔽rtse ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcan gzan dang ri dags thams cad zil gyis mnan te rgyu ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis mnan nas thams cad la spyod pa'i mthu dang ldan pa la seng ge rnam par rtse ba zhes bya ste /
translated: having overcome all beasts and deer, roams about, in the same way, when one rests in equipoise in that meditative absorption, one has the power to engage in all activities, having overcome all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽This is called “the lion’s play.”

original: rtse ba zhas bya ba ni skabs 'dir spyod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rtse ba zhas bya ba ni skabs 'dir spyod pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, “play” refers to activity.

original: de la zla ba bzang po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zla ba bzang po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellent moon meditative absorption?🔽Abiding in that meditative absorption, one illuminates all meditative absorptions.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la @179b gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba'i 'od kyis mun pa thams cad bsal te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la @179b gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba'i 'od kyis mun pa thams cad bsal te /
translated: Just as the light of the moon dispels all darkness,

original: gsal zhing bzang bar snang ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad bsal nas ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi don du bya ba rnams la thags thogs med cing gsal bar rtogs te /
analyzed: gsal zhing bzang bar snang ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad bsal nas ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi don du bya ba rnams la thags thogs med cing gsal bar rtogs te /
translated: Just as the moon appears to be clear and good, in the same way, when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, having cleared away all the darkness of ignorance, one realizes clearly and without obstruction the things to be done for all other meditative stabilizations.

original: zla ba ltar mdzes shing bzang ba'i phyir zla ba bzang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba ltar mdzes shing bzang ba'i phyir zla ba bzang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is beautiful and good like the moon, it is called the “good moon.”

original: de la zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the “śaśi-ketu-śrī” meditative stabilization?🔽That meditative stabilization holds the banner of all meditative stabilizations.

original: ting nge 'dzin de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgrib pa dang / bar du gcod pa bsal zhing zla ba ltar 'od gsal ba nyid rtags sam mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgrib pa dang / bar du gcod pa bsal zhing zla ba ltar 'od gsal ba nyid rtags sam mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, having cleared away the obscurations and interruptions of all meditative stabilizations, the clear light itself is the sign or the mark. Because it is like the moon, it is called the “śaśi-ketu-śrī.”

original: dpal ni rgyal mtshan gyi tog la bya'o //
analyzed: dpal ni rgyal mtshan gyi tog la bya'o //
translated: Glory is to be understood as the banner’s top ornament.

original: de la chos thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis mngon par 'phags pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthus 'khor ba'i chos thams cad las mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba'i phyir
analyzed: de la chos thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis mngon par 'phags pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthus 'khor ba'i chos thams cad las mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ba'i phyir
translated: What is the Sarvatṛga-vikrīdita-samādhi?🔽Abiding in this samādhi, he is exalted above all samādhis.🔽When he is absorbed in this samādhi, he is exalted above all dharmas of saṃsāra by the power of all samādhis.

original: chos thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Sarvatṛga-vikrīdita-samādhi.

original: de la spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Śikhin-avalokita-samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don gyi mtha' khyad par du rtogs pa la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don gyi mtha' khyad par du rtogs pa la /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization, he sees the crest of all meditative stabilizations.

original: spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyi gtsug rnam par lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the “seeing the crest” meditative stabilization.

original: spyi gtsug ces bya ba ni skabs 'dir mtha'am rtse mo la bya'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug ces bya ba ni skabs 'dir mtha'am rtse mo la bya'o //
translated: In this context, “crest” means “end” or “peak.”

original: de la chos kyi dbyings su nges pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings su nges pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “definite in the dharma-dhātu”?🔽Abiding in that meditative stabilization, he goes to the realization of the dharma-dhātu.🔽This is called the “definite in the dharma-dhātu” meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing chos kyi dbyings su rtogs par 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos kyi dbyings nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings nges pa zhes bya ste /🔽rtogs par 'gro @180a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing chos kyi dbyings su rtogs par 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos kyi dbyings nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings nges pa zhes bya ste /🔽rtogs par 'gro @180a * //
translated: When he is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, he realizes the dharma-dhātu.🔽Therefore, it is called the “definite in the dharma-dhātu” meditative stabilization.

original: ba zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir rtogs par khong du chud pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir rtogs par khong du chud pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, ba means to understand.

original: de la nges pa'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called Glorious Victory Banner of Certainty?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samadhi,🔽one upholds the victory banner of all samadhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan nges par 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi yon tan gyi mtshan ma dang / nges par ldan par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan nges par 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi yon tan gyi mtshan ma dang / nges par ldan par 'gyur ba la /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samadhi, one possesses the signs and qualities of all other samadhis.

original: nges pa'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the Glorious Victory Banner of Certainty.

original: rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba skabs 'dir ni mtshan ma'am rtags la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dpal zhes bya ba skabs 'dir ni mtshan ma'am rtags la bya'o //
translated: Here, victory banner means a sign or mark.

original: de la rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the vajra samadhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'jig par mi 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi shigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rdo
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'jig par mi 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi shigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rdo
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization, no meditative stabilization is destroyed.

original: rje dang 'dra bas rdo rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rje dang 'dra bas rdo rje zhes bya'o //
translated: Because when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, all other meditative stabilizations are not destroyed by the discordances of each one, it is like a vajra.

original: de la chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called the mudra of entry into all dharmas?🔽Abiding in that samadhi, the mudra of all dharmas is entered.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing chos thams cad kyi phyag rgya la 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing chos thams cad kyi phyag rgya la 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
translated: Because when one is equipoised in that samadhi, one realizes that all dharmas are non-arisen and unceasing, it is called the mudra of entry into all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid tshad ma'i rtags sa ma mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid tshad ma'i rtags sa ma mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the non-arising and non-ceasing of all phenomena are the sign of valid cognition, it is called a seal.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
