translated: What is the samadhi called Abiding Like a King?🔽It is the samadhi in which one abides and abides like a king over all samadhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po chen po yul sa ma thob pa rnams ni thob par byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po chen po yul sa ma thob pa rnams ni thob par byed /
translated: Just as a great king conquers lands that have not been conquered,🔽and protects and fully sustains those that have been conquered,

original: thob pa rnams ni ma zhig ma nyams par srung zhing yongs su skyong bar byed pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan ma thob pa rnams ni thob par byed thob pa rnams ni nyams par mi 'gyur bar byed
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni ma zhig ma nyams par srung zhing yongs su skyong bar byed pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan ma thob pa rnams ni thob par byed thob pa rnams ni nyams par mi 'gyur bar byed
translated: in the same way, when one rests in equipoise in that samadhi, one conquers samadhis that have not been conquered, and one prevents the loss of those that have been conquered.

original: pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rgyal po ltar rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the samadhi that is like a king.

original: de la 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya ba'i @180b ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya ba'i @180b ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called Radiating Light?🔽Abiding in this samadhi, he radiates the light of all samadhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na de'i mthus ting nge 'dzin gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul 'od zer bkye pa las sems can gyi don
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na de'i mthus ting nge 'dzin gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul 'od zer bkye pa las sems can gyi don
translated: When he enters this samadhi, by its power he has the ability to perform the benefit of sentient beings through the light of the supernatural powers of other samadhis.

original: byed pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i mthu yod pa'i phyir 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i mthu yod pa'i phyir 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the samadhi that radiates light.

original: de la dpung rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dpung rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called Array of Armies?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samadhi, he sees the armies of Mara.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi stobs rnam par dgod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi mthu dang rdzu 'phrul sems can gyi don bya ba la sogs pa 'byung zhing ston par nus la
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi stobs rnam par dgod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi mthu dang rdzu 'phrul sems can gyi don bya ba la sogs pa 'byung zhing ston par nus la
translated: The power of all concentrations is arrayed means that when one rests in equipoise in that concentration, one is able to display and arise with the power and miracles of all other concentrations, such as benefiting sentient beings,

original: / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bar du gcod pa rnams kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ba la dpung rnam par bkod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bar du gcod pa rnams kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ba la dpung rnam par bkod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and one becomes invulnerable to the harms of all the opposing factors that are obstacles.

original: de la yang dag par 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad yang dag par 'phags par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: all samādhis are increased means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi,

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyang yang dag par 'grub cing mngon sum du 'gyur ba la yang dag par 'phags pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig bstan pa la 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ming dang don rjes su mthun par 'chad cing ston nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur
translated: Dwelling in that meditative stabilization, he enters into the teaching of the etymologies of all meditative stabilizations means that when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one has the power to explain and teach the names and meanings of all meditative stabilizations in accordance with their order.

analyzed: ba la nges pa'i tshig la gdon mi za bar 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called unerring because one enters into the etymologies.

original: de la tshig bla dags la yang dag par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshig bla dags la yang dag par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the correct engagement of designations meditative stabilization?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Dwelling in that meditative stabilization, he engages in the correct designations of all phenomena means that when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one is able to engage in the correct designations of all phenomena.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi @181a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi @181a * //
translated: It is the entrance into the designation of all meditative stabilizations.🔽When one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization, one has the power to explain and teach the designations of the names of all meditative stabilizations, as mere conventional symbols and conventions.

original: tshig bla dags la 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ming kun rdzob tu brda dang tha snyad tsam du bla thabs su btags pa 'chad cing ston nus pa'i mthu yod par 'gyur ba🔽la tshig bla dags la yang dag par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig bla dags la 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ming kun rdzob tu brda dang tha snyad tsam du bla thabs su btags pa 'chad cing ston nus pa'i mthu yod par 'gyur ba la tshig bla dags la yang dag par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the entrance into the designation of all meditative stabilizations.

analyzed: de la phyogs rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s meditative stabilization called viewing the directions?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,

translated: The “direction-viewing” of all meditative stabilizations is that, when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one knows and is able to perform the object-field of all meditative stabilizations, the one-pointed observation of the suchness of the ultimate, and the benefit of sentient beings, etc.,🔽by the power of meditative stabilization, spontaneously and in the conventional.

original: phyogs rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi spyod yul rtogs shing de'i bya ba byed nus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi spyod yul rtogs shing de'i bya ba byed nus pa la bya'o //
translated: The “direction-viewing” in this context is the realization of the object-field of the meditative stabilizations and the ability to perform their function.

analyzed: de la phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “seizing the seal”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization, one realizes the meaning of all meditative stabilizations, that all phenomena are primordially unborn.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa'i don de las gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa'i don de las gzhan du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning that is realized does not change into something else.

original: rgyas btab pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas btab pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is like a seal, it is called the seal that holds.

original: de la nyams pa med ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyams pa med ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “unfailing”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: When one rests in this meditative stabilization,🔽one does not fail in any meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad nyams par mi 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthu nyams par mi 'gyur ba'am /

translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization, one does not fail in the power of any meditative stabilization.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don rtogs pa las dran pa nyams par mi 'gyur ba la nyams pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “unwavering” because, having realized the meaning of all meditative stabilizations, one’s mindfulness does not deteriorate.

original: de la chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “the seal of the gathering of all phenomena into the ocean”?🔽It is the meditative stabilization that is the seal of the gathering of all phenomena into the ocean.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'du @181b zhing khong du chud par 'dod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du chu bran thams cad 'du zhing lan tshva bro ba'i ro gcig tu 'gyur ba de bzhin
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'du @181b zhing khong du chud par 'dod pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du chu bran thams cad 'du zhing lan tshva bro ba'i ro gcig tu 'gyur ba de bzhin
translated: It is called “the seal of the gathering of all phenomena into the ocean” because, just as all the small rivers gather into the great ocean and become of one taste with the salty flavor,

original: du ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis rtogs par bya ba'i don chos thams cad skye ba med par ro gcig tu rgyas btab pa bzhin du de las gzhan du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba

translated: in the same way, when one is equipoised in meditative stabilization, all meditative stabilizations are gathered and the meaning that is to be realized by all meditative stabilizations—all phenomena being of one taste in the absence of arising—is sealed, and it does not change into anything else.

original: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the “space-filling” meditative stabilization?🔽It is the meditative stabilization standing in which they fill space with all meditative stabilizations.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthu dang cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nam mkha' rgyas
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthu dang cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nam mkha' rgyas

analyzed: par 'gengs pa'am /

analyzed: de la rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi tshogs rdo rje dang 'dra ba bdud la sogs pa bar du gcod pa rnams kyis mi tshugs pa
translated: It is the complete retention of the maṇḍala of all samādhis.🔽🔽If one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, the assembly of all samādhis, like a vajra, cannot be destroyed by māras and so on.🔽

analyzed: thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir rdo rje dkyil 'khor zhes bya ste /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir tshogs sam mang po 'dus pa la bya'o //
translated: “Maṇḍala” here refers to an assembly or a gathering.

analyzed: de la rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i dpung rgyan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called the victory banner’s crest jewel?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,

analyzed: ji ltar rgyal mtshan dam pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad las 'phags te zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /

translated: and outshines all the counteragents to samādhi. This is the samādhi called the victory banner crest jewel.

analyzed: de la dbang po'i dbal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the indraketu samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: It is the samādhi dwelling in which

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dbang dam pa thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi rgyal mtshan mthong ba tsam gyis lha ma yin gyi dgra thams cad ring du bros pas lha'i dbang po
translated: The “glory of sovereignty” absorption is so called because when one rests in equipoise in that absorption, merely by seeing the banner of Śakra, lord of the gods, all the enemies of the demigods flee far away.

translated: Just as Śakra, lord of the gods, rules over the gods, in the same way, by having relinquished all the cognitive and afflictive obscurations far away, one attains sovereignty over all absorptions.

analyzed: dpal zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan nam ru mtshon la bya'o //

analyzed: de la rgyun gyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the “following the stream” absorption?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that absorption,

translated: “The samādhi that goes in the wake of the stream” means that one is able to enter into equipoise in a continuous and progressive way on all samādhis.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing rdul dang dri ma thams cad rab tu spang ba'i dbang du gyur cing ji ltar seng ge'i rgyal po bzhin dbang thob pas bsgyings pa lta bu ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na nyon mongs
translated: When one is equipoised in that samādhi, one is able to completely abandon all the afflictive

analyzed: pa'i rdul dang dri ma thams cad spang bar bya ba la dbang du gyur cing /
translated: They have mastery in abandoning all the stains and particles of the afflictions.🔽

translated: It is called the “lion’s play absorption” because it is the mastery of the elimination of all the dust and stains of the three realms, and because it is the mastery of all meditative absorptions and all phenomena, and because it is the fearless roaring of the lion’s roar like the king of lions.

original: de la snrel zhi zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas @182b shing 'khor ba'i chos rnams rgyun gcod par byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang du gyur pas go rims med par ting nge 'dzin thams cad la ci dga'

translated: “What is the ‘alternating’ meditative absorption?🔽It is the meditative absorption that, while abiding in it, severs the phenomena of saṃsāra.”🔽While abiding in that meditative absorption, one gains mastery over all meditative absorptions and, as one wishes,

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas @184a * //

translated: When he is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the power of all other meditative stabilizations is not overwhelmed by the māras and other obstacles.

translated: When one is absorbed in this samadhi, one realizes that all samadhis are ultimately devoid of entities. Therefore, since exhaustion is impossible in the absence of entities, one sees that they are inexhaustible.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ba ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ba ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That is how one sees.

original: dngos po cung zad kyang med par rtogs pa nyid zad mi shes par rjes su mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po cung zad kyang med par rtogs pa nyid zad mi shes par rjes su mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one sees the exhaustion of the inexhaustible, which is the realization that there is not even the slightest thing.

original: de la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the immovable meditative stabilization?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽he does not move, does not stir, does not differentiate, and does not think about any meditative stabilization at all.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad mi g-yo mi 'gul rab tu mi 'byed rlom sems su mi byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la yang rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub par 'gyur ba
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad mi g-yo mi 'gul rab tu mi 'byed rlom sems su mi byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la yang rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub par 'gyur ba
translated: The meaning is that when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one is spontaneously present in the absence of conceptualization with regard to all meditative stabilizations.

original: la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “immovable” because one does not move from that meditative stabilization.

original: mi g-yo mi 'gul rab tu mi 'byed rlom sems su mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mi g-yo mi 'gul rab tu mi 'byed rlom sems su mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “Does not move, does not stir, does not differentiate, and does not think about” are synonyms for “non-conceptualization.”

original: de la 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called “non-destruction”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samadhi,🔽one does not see the destruction of any samadhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'jig par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad las nyams par mi 'gyur ba la 'jig pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'jig par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad las nyams par mi 'gyur ba la 'jig pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is absorbed in this samadhi, one does not fall away from any samadhi. This is called “non-destruction.”

original: de la nyi @184b ma'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyi @184b ma'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called “sun-lamp”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samadhi,🔽one illuminates the doors of all samadhis.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgo snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don rtogs par byed pa'i sgo mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab nyi ma dang 'dra ba'i sgron ma
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgo snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don rtogs par byed pa'i sgo mnyan pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab nyi ma dang 'dra ba'i sgron ma
translated: When one is absorbed in this samadhi, the sun-lamp of wisdom, which is the hearing and contemplation that illuminates the meaning of all samadhis,

original: gsal bar 'gyur ba la nyi ma'i sgron ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar 'gyur ba la nyi ma'i sgron ma zhes bya'o //
translated: becomes clear. This is called “sun-lamp.”

original: de la zla ba dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zla ba dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Vimaladharmamegha samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which one rains down the rain of the Dharma on all the samadhis.🔽It is the samadhi in which one rains down the rain of the Dharma on all the samadhis.🔽What is the Vimalaprabhasa samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which all the samadhis are illumined.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad mun pa med par byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba sprin gyis ma bsgribs pa'i 'od kyis mun pa bsal te snang ba gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge🔽'dzin thams cad kyi sgrib pa bsal zhing so so'i dmigs pa'i yul gsal bar byed pa la zla ba dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad mun pa med par byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba sprin gyis ma bsgribs pa'i 'od kyis mun pa bsal te snang ba gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgrib pa bsal zhing so so'i dmigs pa'i yul gsal bar byed pa la zla ba dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the samadhi in which all the samadhis are illumined.🔽What is the Prasadanarati samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which one has mastery over all the samadhis.🔽It is the samadhi in which one has mastery over all the samadhis.🔽What is the Sarvadharmasamavasaraṇa samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which all the samadhis are included.🔽It is the samadhi in which all the samadhis are included.

original: de la snang ba gsal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la snang ba gsal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Sarvadharmasvabhāvasamatāksānti samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which one has the acceptance of the equality of the nature of all dharmas.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ye shes kyi snang
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ye shes kyi snang
translated: It is the samadhi in which one has the acceptance of the equality of the nature of all dharmas.🔽What is the Sarvadharmasvabhāvaprasthāna anupalabdhi samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which one does not perceive the departure of the nature of all dharmas.🔽It is the samadhi in which one does not perceive the departure of the nature of all dharmas.🔽What is the Sarvadharmasamatāprativedha samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which one penetrates the equality of all dharmas.🔽It is the samadhi in which one penetrates the equality of all dharmas.🔽What is the Sarvadharmasvabhāvapraveśa samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which one enters into the nature of all dharmas.🔽It is the samadhi in which one enters into the nature of all dharmas.🔽What is the Sarvadharmasvabhāvasamutthāna anupalabdhi samadhi?🔽It is the samadhi in which one does not perceive the origin of the nature of all d

original: bas chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams gsal bar byed nus par 'gyur ba la snang ba gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bas chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams gsal bar byed nus par 'gyur ba la snang ba gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the illumination samādhi because it is able to illuminate the Dharma, its meaning, its words, and its confidence.

original: de la snang ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la snang ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the illuminating light samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin de thams cad kyi sgo snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la 'jug pa'i sgo chos bdag med par rtogs pa goms par byed pa'i shes rab gsal bar byed pa
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin de thams cad kyi sgo snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la 'jug pa'i sgo chos bdag med par rtogs pa goms par byed pa'i shes rab gsal bar byed pa
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽it illuminates the gateway to all samādhis.

original: la snang bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la snang bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the illuminating light samādhi because when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, the wisdom that cultivates the realization of the absence of self in phenomena, the gateway to entering all samādhis, is illuminated.

original: de la bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bya ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the performing action samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi bya ba rnams byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthus sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi bya ba rnams byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthus sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization, one performs the functions of all meditative stabilizations.🔽When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one is able to perform the various methods for bringing sentient beings to full maturity and liberating them through the power of all meditative stabilizations.

original: rnam par grol bar byed pa'i thabs sna tshogs byed nus par 'gyur ba la bya ba byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed pa'i thabs sna tshogs byed nus par 'gyur ba la bya ba byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “performing a function.”

original: de la ye shes dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang @185a * //
analyzed: de la ye shes dpal zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang @185a * //
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “glory of pristine wisdom”?

original: zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽one sees the glory of pristine wisdom of all meditative stabilizations.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ye shes dpal yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don rtogs par byed par nus pa'i ye shes 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ye
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ye shes dpal yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don rtogs par byed par nus pa'i ye shes 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ye
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the pristine wisdom that is able to realize the meaning of all meditative stabilizations arises.

original: shes dpal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes dpal zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “glory of pristine wisdom.”

original: dpal zhes bya ba skabs 'dir rgyal mtshan gyi tog la bya'o //
analyzed: dpal zhes bya ba skabs 'dir rgyal mtshan gyi tog la bya'o //
translated: The word “glory” here means the top ornament of a victory banner.

original: ye shes de rgyal mtshan gyi tog dang 'dra bar mtho zhing btsan pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes de rgyal mtshan gyi tog dang 'dra bar mtho zhing btsan pa'am /
translated: That wisdom is like the top ornament of a victory banner, high and powerful,

original: don rtogs pa'i mtshan ma 'am /
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i mtshan ma 'am /
translated: or it is the sign or mark of the realization of the meaning.

original: rtags su 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyal mtshan gyi tog dang 'dra bas dpal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtags su 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyal mtshan gyi tog dang 'dra bas dpal zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is like the top ornament of a victory banner, it is called “glory.”

original: de la rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called “like a vajra”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bar khong du chud par byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes rdo
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bar khong du chud par byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i ye shes rdo
translated: Dwelling in that samadhi,🔽one penetrates the understanding that even the samadhi of all samadhis is not seen.

original: rje lta bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: rje lta bu 'byung ste /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samadhi, the wisdom that realizes all phenomena as emptiness arises like a vajra.

original: ye shes des ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rang bzhin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid so so rang gis rig pa tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bar nus pa la rdo rje lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes des ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rang bzhin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid so so rang gis rig pa tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bar nus pa la rdo rje lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: That wisdom is called “vajra-like” because it is able to see that even the nature of all meditative stabilizations, which is the characteristic of a one-pointed mind, is not ultimately real.

original: de la sems gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “mind-abiding”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas na sems mi g-yo rnam par mi g-yo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas na sems mi g-yo rnam par mi g-yo //
translated: When one dwells in that meditative stabilization, the mind does not move, does not waver,

original: rnam par mi ldog /
analyzed: rnam par mi ldog /
translated: does not turn back,

original: yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not become discouraged,

original: nyams su mi bde ba med la /
analyzed: nyams su mi bde ba med la /
translated: is not unhappy,🔽and the thought “This is the mind” does not occur.

original: de la sems zhes bya ba 'di yin zhes bya bar sems mi 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub cing sems mi g-yo bar gnas par 'gyur ba la sems gnas pa zhes
analyzed: de la sems zhes bya ba 'di yin zhes bya bar sems mi 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub cing sems mi g-yo bar gnas par 'gyur ba la sems gnas pa zhes
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, it is non-conceptual, spontaneous, and the mind abides without moving.

original: bya ste / sems mi g-yo ba dang / rnam par mi g-yo ba dang / sems zhes bya ba 'di yin zhes bya bar sems mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi ldog pa'i rnam grangs so//
analyzed: bya ste / sems mi g-yo ba dang / rnam par mi g-yo ba dang / sems zhes bya ba 'di yin zhes bya bar sems mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi ldog pa'i rnam grangs so//
translated: The term “not turning back” is a synonym for “not moving” and “not wavering.”

original: rnam par mi ldog pa dang / yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur ba dang / nyams su mi bde ba med pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de lhun gyis grub pas skyo zhing gtong 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rnam par mi ldog pa dang / yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur ba dang / nyams su mi bde ba med pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de lhun gyis grub pas skyo zhing gtong 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The term “not turning back” is a synonym for “not becoming weary” and “not becoming discouraged.”

original: de la kun du lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas @185b shing /
analyzed: de la kun du lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas @185b shing /
translated: What is the samādhi called “all-seeing”?🔽The sūtra says, “Standing in this samādhi, he sees all the worlds in the ten directions.”

original: thams cad du lta bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i mthus phyogs bcu thams cad du snang ba gsal bar 'byung ba mthong bar 'gyur ba la kun du lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du lta bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i mthus phyogs bcu thams cad du snang ba gsal bar 'byung ba mthong bar 'gyur ba la kun du lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “all-seeing” means that through the power of being equipoised in this samādhi, the arising of light that illuminates all the ten directions is seen.

original: de la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called “well-established”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samadhi,🔽all samadhis are well-established.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: This means that when one enters meditative absorption in this samadhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mnyam par bzhag cing gnas par 'gyur ba la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mnyam par bzhag cing gnas par 'gyur ba la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: all samadhis are established and abide in meditative absorption. This is called “well-established.”

original: de la rin chen mtha' zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rin chen mtha' zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called “jewel summit”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad rin chen mtha' ltar kun nas snang ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi cho 'phrul 'od zer rin po che'i rtse mo ltar snang bar 'gyur ba la rin
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad rin chen mtha' ltar kun nas snang ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi cho 'phrul 'od zer rin po che'i rtse mo ltar snang bar 'gyur ba la rin
translated: Abiding in this samadhi,🔽all samadhis appear like the summit of a jewel.

original: chen mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chen mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: This means that by the power of entering meditative absorption in this samadhi, the miracles of all other samadhis appear like the summit of a precious jewel. This is called the “jewel summit.”

original: rin chen mtha' zhes bya ba skabs 'dir rin po che'i rtse mo 'bar ba la bya ste /
analyzed: rin chen mtha' zhes bya ba skabs 'dir rin po che'i rtse mo 'bar ba la bya ste /
translated: The “jewel summit” is the blazing jewel peak in this context.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi cho 'phrul 'od zer 'bar ba 'byung ba rin po che'i rtse mo 'bar ba 'dra ba'i phyir rin chen mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi cho 'phrul 'od zer 'bar ba 'byung ba rin po che'i rtse mo 'bar ba 'dra ba'i phyir rin chen mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the magical manifestation of samādhi arises as the blazing light rays, it is like the blazing jewel peak. Therefore, it is called the “jewel summit.”

original: de la chos dam pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos dam pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the saṃādhi called the seal of the sublime Dharma?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad phyag rgya med pa'i mtha' phyag rgyas btab pa nye bar bzung bas phyag rgyas btab par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad phyag rgya med pa'i mtha' phyag rgyas btab pa nye bar bzung bas phyag rgyas btab par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽all samādhis are sealed with the seal of the limit of signlessness.

original: bzhin las mi 'gyur bar byed nus pa ste /
analyzed: bzhin las mi 'gyur bar byed nus pa ste /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one is able to make all samādhis not move from the nature of the completely pure realm of phenomena.

original: chos dam pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la bya'o //
analyzed: chos dam pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la bya'o //
translated: The “sublime Dharma” refers to the realm of phenomena.

original: phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings las mi 'gyur zhing ma nyams pa la bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings las mi 'gyur zhing ma nyams pa la bya'o //
translated: The term “seal” refers to the fact that the expanse of reality is unchanging and undiminishing.

original: phyag rgya med pa'i mtha' phyag rgyas btab pa nye bar bzung bas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya de yang don dam par phyag rgya med pa'i phyir phyag rgyas btab pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya med pa'i mtha' phyag rgyas btab pa nye bar bzung bas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya de yang don dam par phyag rgya med pa'i phyir phyag rgyas btab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase “the limit of the absence of seals is taken as a sealed object” means that the expanse of reality, which is a seal, is said to be “sealed” because, in an ultimate sense, it is a seal that is devoid of seals.

original: mtha' zhes bya ba ni med pa'i mthas gtugs pa'am phul du gyur pa la bya'o //🔽nye bar bzung bas zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya med pa'i @186a * //
analyzed: mtha' zhes bya ba ni med pa'i mthas gtugs pa'am phul du gyur pa la bya'o // nye bar bzung bas zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya med pa'i @186a * //
translated: The term “limit” here means the limit of nonexistence or the ultimate point.

original: mtha' phyag rgyas btab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' phyag rgyas btab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “is taken as” means “is taken as a sealed object” because the limit of the absence of seals is sealed.

original: de ltar dngos po med par rtogs pa nyid chos dam pa chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas btab pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med par rtogs pa nyid chos dam pa chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas btab pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the understanding that things do not exist is itself the supreme Dharma, which is sealed by the expanse of reality.

original: de la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative absorption called “the sameness of all things”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: When one abides in this meditative absorption,

original: chos gang yang mnyam pa nyid du ma chud pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyi
analyzed: chos gang yang mnyam pa nyid du ma chud pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyi
translated: It is the meditative stabilization that is called “the meditative stabilization of the sameness of all phenomena” because, when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one sees that there is not any phenomenon whatsoever that is not included in sameness.

original: khong du ma chud pa med par rtogs pa la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khong du ma chud pa med par rtogs pa la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization that there is not any phenomenon whatsoever that is not included in the sameness of the realm of phenomena is called “the meditative stabilization of the sameness of all phenomena.”

original: de la dga' ba spong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dga' ba spong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Sarva­dharma­pratisenā-śamatha meditative stabilization?”

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: It is the meditative stabilization standing in which

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang chos thams cad kyi dga' ba spong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ro la chags pa'i dga' ba dang / chags par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad la chags shing dga' ba med par 'gyur ba la dga' ba spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang chos thams cad kyi dga' ba spong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ro la chags pa'i dga' ba dang / chags par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad la chags shing dga' ba med par 'gyur ba la dga' ba spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The “abandonment of delight in all meditative stabilizations and all phenomena” means that when one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization, one abandons delight in attachment to the taste of all meditative stabilizations and one abandons delight in attachment to all phenomena that are objects of attachment.

original: de la chos kyis 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyis 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Dharma-udgata meditative stabilization?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽it is the dispelling of the darkness of all phenomena and the exaltedness of all meditative stabilizations.

original: chos thams cad kyi mun pa sel ba dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mngon par 'phags par gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad la sgrib pa med cing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i yul rnams gsal
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mun pa sel ba dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mngon par 'phags par gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad la sgrib pa med cing ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i yul rnams gsal
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization, there is no obscuration with regard to all phenomena that are objects of knowledge and all objects of knowledge are clear to all meditative stabilizations.

original: bar khong du chud pa la chos kyis 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar khong du chud pa la chos kyis 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who has risen above the Dharma” because he has penetrated the middle.

original: de la rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Vikiranarati samadhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Dwelling in this samadhi,🔽all dharmas are scattered.

original: chos thams cad rnam par 'thor ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos spong bar bya ba rnams gtor ba bzhin du spang bar 'gyur ba la rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par 'thor ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos spong bar bya ba rnams gtor ba bzhin du spang bar 'gyur ba la rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is absorbed in this samadhi, all dharmas belonging to the category of defilement are abandoned like scattered chaff. This is called “scattering.”

original: de la chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Sarvadharmavikalpaprahasa samadhi?

original: @186b ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: @186b ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Dwelling in this samadhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu 'byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus ting nge 'dzin thams cad bshad pa'i tshig dang / chos thams cad bshad pa'i tshig rnams bye brag tu 'byed cing 'chad nus pa la chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu 'byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus ting nge 'dzin thams cad bshad pa'i tshig dang / chos thams cad bshad pa'i tshig rnams bye brag tu 'byed cing 'chad nus pa la chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The “distinction of the words of all Dharmas” means that, by the power of resting in equipoise in this samādhi, one is able to explain the words that explain all samādhis and the words that explain all Dharmas.

original: de la yi ge mnyam par 'god pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yi ge mnyam par 'god pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “arranging letters evenly”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yi ge mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad ston pa'i yi ge rnams ting nge 'dzin so so'i don dang rjes su mthun par spyod
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yi ge mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad ston pa'i yi ge rnams ting nge 'dzin so so'i don dang rjes su mthun par spyod
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,

original: cing ston nus pa la /
analyzed: cing ston nus pa la /
translated: the attainment of the sameness of the letters of all samādhis means that, when resting in equipoise in this samādhi, one is able to teach the letters that demonstrate all samādhis in accordance with the meaning of each samādhi.

original: yi ge mnyam par 'god pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge mnyam par 'god pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the “syllable-free” meditative stabilization.

original: de la yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “ What is the ‘syllable-free’ meditative stabilization?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: When they enter this meditative stabilization🔽they do not apprehend even a single syllable of any meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yi ge gcig kyang dmigs pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad ston pa'i yi ge rnams mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yi ge gcig kyang dmigs pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad ston pa'i yi ge rnams mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: When they enter this meditative stabilization, they do not apprehend any syllables that teach any meditative stabilization as a sign,

original: dngos por mi dmigs pa'i shes rab 'thob par 'gyur ba la yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos por mi dmigs pa'i shes rab 'thob par 'gyur ba la yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and they do not apprehend them as a thing. The attainment of that wisdom is called the ‘syllable-free’ meditative stabilization.

original: de yang dmigs pa gcod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa gcod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “ What is the ‘cutting off of the objective support’ meditative stabilization?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: When they enter this meditative stabilization

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi so so'i dmigs pa'i yul rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa mi 'byung ba la dmigs
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi so so'i dmigs pa'i yul rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa mi 'byung ba la dmigs
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the object of observation of not observing the object of observation of each of all meditative stabilizations is observed.

original: pa gcod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “the object-chopper.”

original: de la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “unmoving”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽chos thams cad 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /🔽chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / chos thams cad 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na / chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du rtogs te /
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization,🔽the unobservability of the movement of all phenomena is observed.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa 'gyur ba med par khong du chud pa la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la rnam pa med pa zhe bya @187a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa 'gyur ba med par khong du chud pa la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya'o // de la rnam pa med pa zhe bya @187a * //
translated: That is called “unmoving.”

original: ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “without features”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽all phenomena are not observed even as mere aspects.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa tsam yang dmigs su med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag na phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su bye brag tu 'byed pa'i mtshan mar dmigs
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa tsam yang dmigs su med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag na phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su bye brag tu 'byed pa'i mtshan mar dmigs
translated: This means that when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the signs of the various distinctions of phenomena such as the aggregates, constituents, sense spheres and so on are not observed.

original: pa med par 'gyur ba la rnam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa med par 'gyur ba la rnam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “without aspects.”

original: de la ming nges par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ming nges par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization of engaging with certainty?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽all etymologies are not observed as real and are merely dependent on conventions.

original: nges pa'i tshig thams cad ni yang dag par dmigs su med cing tha snyad la ltos pa tsam mo zhes rtogs par 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi ming nges pa rnams don dam par dngos po med par rtogs la /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig thams cad ni yang dag par dmigs su med cing tha snyad la ltos pa tsam mo zhes rtogs par 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos thams cad kyi ming nges pa rnams don dam par dngos po med par rtogs la /
translated: This means that when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one realizes that the certainties of the names of all meditative stabilizations and all phenomena are ultimately unreal.

original: kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye bas nges par rtogs par byed pa la ming nges par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye bas nges par rtogs par byed pa la ming nges par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “samādhi of the engagement of the definition of names” because it is the realization of the definitive expression of the conventional, merely in terms of the world.

original: de la gnas med par spyod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas med par spyod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called no location?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: It is the samādhi in which bodhisattvas abide🔽and in which all samādhis are not apprehended.”

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gnas dmigs pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul rnams med par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gnas dmigs pa med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul rnams med par rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is called the “samādhi of no location” because when one is absorbed in that samādhi, the objects of reference of all samādhis are not apprehended.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi dmigs pa'i yul lam rten la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi dmigs pa'i yul lam rten la bya'o //
translated: “Location” here refers to the objects of reference or supports of the samādhis.

original: de la rab rib med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rab rib med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called no cataract?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: It is the samādhi in which bodhisattvas abide🔽and in which all samādhis are purified.”

original: chos thams cad kyi rab rib rnam par sel ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /🔽'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams shes par bya ba bsgrib pa 'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rab rib rnam par sel ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams shes par bya ba bsgrib pa 'am /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative absorption,

original: thags thogs med par shes par 'gyur ba la rab rib med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thags thogs med par shes par 'gyur ba la rab rib med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: one either knows mundane and supramundane phenomena without obscuration or one knows them without obstruction.

original: de la spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: The “meditative absorption endowed with activity” is as follows:

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative absorption,🔽one does not see the activity of any meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod pa cho 'phrul @187b sna tshogs bstan pas sems can yongs su smin pa
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod pa cho 'phrul @187b sna tshogs bstan pas sems can yongs su smin pa
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative absorption, one does not see the activity of any meditative absorption—the ripening of sentient beings through the display of various miracles—

original: dang / rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa don dam par dngos po med par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dang / rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa don dam par dngos po med par rtogs pa ste /
translated: and one realizes that the “liberation” and so on are ultimately unreal.

original: de ltar spyod pa dngos po med par rtogs pa nyid don dam pa'i spyod pa yin pas spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa dngos po med par rtogs pa nyid don dam pa'i spyod pa yin pas spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the very realization of the non-existence of things is the ultimate practice, and so it is called “endowed with practice.”

original: de la g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la g-yo ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called ‘unmoving’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽one sees all samādhis as unmoving.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad g-yo ba med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyang so so'i dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu bzhag pa las mi 'gyur
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad g-yo ba med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyang so so'i dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu bzhag pa las mi 'gyur
translated: If one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, then all other samādhis will not move from the one-pointed placement of the mind on their individual objects.

original: zhing mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba la g-yo ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhing mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba la g-yo ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not moving is called ‘unmoving.’

original: de la yul las brgal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yul las brgal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called ‘beyond objects’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'da' ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul dang / sgrub pa'i don rnams dngos po med par rtogs shing de dag la mtshan mar 'dzin pa las 'das pa la yul las brgal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'da' ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul dang / sgrub pa'i don rnams dngos po med par rtogs shing de dag la mtshan mar 'dzin pa las 'das pa la yul las brgal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is absorbed in this meditative concentration, one realizes that the domain of the objective supports of all meditative concentrations, and the objects of their practice, are insubstantial, and one transcends the apprehension of their signs. This is called the “transcendence of the domain.”

original: de la yon tan thams cad kyi tshogs su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: de la yon tan thams cad kyi tshogs su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: What is the meditative concentration called “the collection of all good qualities”?🔽When one is absorbed in this meditative concentration, one acquires the collection of good qualities of all dharmas and all meditative concentrations.

original: chos thams cad dang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan gyi tshogs rjes su 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi yon tan mang po dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan gyi tshogs rjes su 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi yon tan mang po dang /
translated: When one is absorbed in this meditative concentration, one acquires many good qualities of supramundane dharmas such as the elements leading to enlightenment and the perfections.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan chos bdag med par rtogs pa dang / sems can gyi don sna tshogs byed nus pa rnams thob par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan chos bdag med par rtogs pa dang / sems can gyi don sna tshogs byed nus pa rnams thob par 'gyur ba la /
translated: They will attain all the qualities of meditative absorption, the realization of the absence of self in phenomena, and the ability to accomplish the various kinds of benefit for beings.

original: yon tan thams cad kyi tshogs su gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi tshogs su gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “accumulation of all good qualities” because it obtains all the good qualities of meditative stabilization, such as the realization of the selflessness of phenomena and the ability to perform various benefits for sentient beings.

original: de la sems med par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems med par gnas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “abiding without mind”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la sems mi 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam @188a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la sems mi 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam @188a * //
translated: the mind does not engage with any meditative stabilization.

original: par bzhag na dmigs pa gang la sems rtse gcig tu bzhag pa las ting nge 'dzin gzhan la sogs pa'i dmigs pa gzhan la sems mi g-yeng zhing rtog pa med par 'gyur ba la sems med par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par bzhag na dmigs pa gang la sems rtse gcig tu bzhag pa las ting nge 'dzin gzhan la sogs pa'i dmigs pa gzhan la sems mi g-yeng zhing rtog pa med par 'gyur ba la sems med par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the mind does not become distracted to other objects, such as other meditative stabilizations, and it does not conceptualize them.

original: de la dge ba'i me tog rgyas shing gsal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i me tog rgyas shing gsal ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “the blooming and shining of the flower of virtue”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dge ba'i me tog rgyas shing gsal ba rab tu thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs me tog kha bye ba
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dge ba'i me tog rgyas shing gsal ba rab tu thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs me tog kha bye ba
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽he attains the blooming and shining of the flowers of virtue of all meditative stabilizations.🔽The blooming and shining of the flowers of virtue is as follows.

original: bzhin du rgyas shing gsal bar 'gyur ba la dge ba'i me tog rgyas shing gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du rgyas shing gsal bar 'gyur ba la dge ba'i me tog rgyas shing gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the power of all meditative stabilizations, the collection of merit and wisdom, blooms and shines like a flower that has opened.

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called Possessing the Factors of Awakening?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽he attains the seven factors of awakening of all meditative stabilizations.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan gang la mnyam par gzhag kyang rung ste mnyam par bzhag ma thag tu dran pa byang
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin gzhan gang la mnyam par gzhag kyang rung ste mnyam par bzhag ma thag tu dran pa byang
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, no matter in which other meditative stabilization one becomes equipoised, as soon as one becomes equipoised, mindfulness is purified and becomes clear.

original: chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa byang chub kyi yan lag bdun thob par 'gyur ba la byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa byang chub kyi yan lag bdun thob par 'gyur ba la byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The seven limbs of enlightenment are the limb of the foundation of mindfulness, the limb of the foundation of the investigation of phenomena, the limb of the foundation of effort, the limb of the foundation of joy, the limb of the foundation of tranquility, the limb of the foundation of concentration, and the limb of the foundation of equanimity.

original: de la spobs pa mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la spobs pa mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the anantamukha-prabhāvanā-samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la spobs pa mtha' yas pa rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi tshig dang don rnams so sor phye ste gzhan la bstan pa la spobs pa mtha'
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la spobs pa mtha' yas pa rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi tshig dang don rnams so sor phye ste gzhan la bstan pa la spobs pa mtha'
translated: all samādhis are attained.

original: yas pa thob par 'gyur ba la spobs pa mtha' yas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yas pa thob par 'gyur ba la spobs pa mtha' yas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the anantamukha-prabhāvanā-samādhi.

original: de la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samata-viṣayā-nanta-samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang du gyur pa de bzhin du ting
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang du gyur pa de bzhin du ting
translated: “Equality in all samādhis” means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one attains equality with the Blessed Buddhas in all samādhis.

original: nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang du @188b 'gyur ba thob pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nge 'dzin thams cad la dbang du @188b 'gyur ba thob pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Equality with the unequaled” means that one attains the state of being like the Blessed Buddhas in all samādhis.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bya'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bya'o //
translated: “Equality with the unequaled” refers to the Blessed Buddhas.

original: de dang mnyam par gyur pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa 'thob pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la chos thams cad las 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dang mnyam par gyur pa la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa 'thob pa zhes bya'o // de la chos thams cad las 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: To become like them is called “attaining equality with the unequaled.”

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: “The samādhi that transcends all phenomena” means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one transcends all phenomena.

original: khams gsum pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na khams gsum du skye zhing 'khor bar mi 'gyur zhing 'dus ma byas pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba la chos thams cad
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na khams gsum du skye zhing 'khor bar mi 'gyur zhing 'dus ma byas pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ba la chos thams cad
translated: “Correctly transcending all three realms” means that when one rests in equipoise in this samādhi, one is not born and does not cycle in the three realms, and one abides in the unconditioned realm.

original: las 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “transcending all phenomena.”

original: de la yongs su gcod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su gcod par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called ‘making complete’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samādhi,

original: chos thams cad dang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyu mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi so so'i rang bzhin dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyis rtogs shing yongs su gcod nus pa la yongs su gcod par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyu mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi so so'i rang bzhin dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyis rtogs shing yongs su gcod nus pa la yongs su gcod par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is equipoised in that samādhi, one is able to understand and comprehend the individual natures and general characteristics of all mundane and supramundane dharmas and all samādhis with wisdom.

original: de la nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “dispelling doubt”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽one attains the dispelling of all doubts about all samādhis and all dharmas.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang chos thams cad la nem nur rnam par sel ba rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don dang tshig la the tshom med par 'gyur ba dang
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang chos thams cad la nem nur rnam par sel ba rab tu 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don dang tshig la the tshom med par 'gyur ba dang
translated: When one is equipoised in that samādhi, one becomes free of doubt about the meaning and words of all samādhis.

original: / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom med par 'gyur ba la nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom med par 'gyur ba la nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called dispelling doubt because it eliminates doubt about the ultimate and conventional characteristics of all mundane and supramundane phenomena.

original: de la gnas su bya ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas su bya ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called no location?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽chos thams cad kyi gnas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pas de dag gi gnas kyang med par rtogs par 'gyur pa la gnas su bya
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / chos thams cad kyi gnas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pas de dag gi gnas kyang med par rtogs par 'gyur pa la gnas su bya
translated: Abiding in this samadhi,🔽one does not see the location of any phenomena.

original: ba med pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la gcig tu rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting @189a * //
analyzed: ba med pa zhes bya'o // de la gcig tu rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting @189a * //
translated: This means that when one enters this samadhi, one realizes that all phenomena are unreal, and therefore one realizes that they have no location. It is called no location because it is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are unreal.

original: nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi called single arrangement?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samadhi,

original: chos gang yang gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig par rtogs shing rtag pa dang chad pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su lta bar mi 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: chos gang yang gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig par rtogs shing rtag pa dang chad pa dang / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su lta bar mi 'gyur ba la /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one realizes that all phenomena are one in the nature of suchness and does not view them as the two extremes of permanence and annihilation, existence and nonexistence, and so on.

original: gcig tu rnam par bkod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig tu rnam par bkod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called ‘single array.’

original: de la rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called ‘accomplishment of aspects’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽one does not see any phenomenon as accomplishing the aspects of all samādhis.
