original: chos thams cad ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad kyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad kyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one does not see the aspects of all phenomena, such as their colors and shapes, and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rang bzhin sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i rnam pa la yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rang bzhin sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i rnam pa la yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: It is also nonconceptual with regard to the aspect of the nature of all meditative concentrations, which is the one-pointed mind.

original: de ltar mi rtog pa'i rnam par gyur pa nyid la rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtog pa'i rnam par gyur pa nyid la rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the very state of being nonconceptual is called the accomplishment of the aspect.

original: de la rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “one aspect”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽he does not see the aspect of any meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa so so'i dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa so so'i dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: When he is thus concentrated in that meditative stabilization, he realizes that the aspects of all meditative stabilizations, which have the characteristic of the one-pointed mind that is focused on the individual objects of those meditative stabilizations,

original: rnams don dam par stong pa'i rnam pa gcig pur gyur par rtogs pa la /
analyzed: rnams don dam par stong pa'i rnam pa gcig pur gyur par rtogs pa la /
translated: are ultimately a single aspect, which is emptiness.

original: rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “one aspect.”

original: de la rnam pa 'dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa 'dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “without aspects”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad gnyis su med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad gnyis su med par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽one sees all samādhis as nondual.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gcig cing gnyis su med par rtogs pa la rnam par 'dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gcig cing gnyis su med par rtogs pa la rnam par 'dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one realizes that all samādhis are the same in being of the nature of nonconceptuality and are nondual. It is called “without aspects”

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pa de mi 'dor zhing de dang ma bral ba la rnam par 'dor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pa de mi 'dor zhing de dang ma bral ba la rnam par 'dor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because one does not abandon that aspect of nonconceptuality and is not separated from it.

original: de la rtogs pas srid pa'i @189b gzhi thams cad khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtogs pas srid pa'i @189b gzhi thams cad khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “realization of the basis of all existence”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes la zhugs nas de la zhugs pa'i phyir khong du mi chud pa gang yang med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes la zhugs nas de la zhugs pa'i phyir khong du mi chud pa gang yang med pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one realizes that all meditative stabilizations are objects of observation🔽and one attains the wisdom that realizes that ultimately all phenomena are empty and that conventionally knows the characteristics of all things in the three realms.

original: don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs par bya ba dang / kun rdzob tu khams gsum gyi dngos po thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes par byed pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba la rtogs pas srid pa'i gzhi thams cad khong du chud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad stong par rtogs par bya ba dang / kun rdzob tu khams gsum gyi dngos po thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes par byed pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba la rtogs pas srid pa'i gzhi thams cad khong du chud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because of that realization, it is called “the meditative stabilization that comprehends all the bases of existence.”

original: srid pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la bya'o //
translated: The “bases of existence” are the things of the three realms.

original: de la brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “engaging with words and sounds”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi brda dang sgra la 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ming dang brda dang sgrar btags pa rnams don dang rjes su mthun par shes par 'gyur ba la
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi brda dang sgra la 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ming dang brda dang sgrar btags pa rnams don dang rjes su mthun par shes par 'gyur ba la
translated: The samādhi that is the entry into the sounds and words of all samādhis means that, when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one will understand the names, sounds, and words that are imputed to all samādhis in accordance with their meaning.

original: brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “the entry into the sounds and words.”

original: de la sgra dbyangs kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgra dbyangs kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called free from the syllables of sound and word?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad yi ge dang bral ba rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad don dam par yi ge dang sgras brjod du med par rtogs par 'gyur ba la sgra dbyangs
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad yi ge dang bral ba rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad don dam par yi ge dang sgras brjod du med par rtogs par 'gyur ba la sgra dbyangs
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽one sees all samādhis as free from syllables.

original: kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “free from the syllables of sound and word.”

original: de la sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dhyāna called blazing lamp?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this dhyāna,🔽all dhyānas are illuminated, radiant, and shining.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad gzi brjid kyis lham me lhan ne lhang nger byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ye shes kyi sgron ma snang bas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i don gsal bar shes🔽shing snang bar 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad gzi brjid kyis lham me lhan ne lhang nger byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ye shes kyi sgron ma snang bas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i don gsal bar shes shing snang bar 'gyur ba la /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in this dhyāna, the lamp of wisdom illuminates all dhyānas, and the meaning to be understood through all dhyānas is clearly known.

original: sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the blazing lamp

original: lham me lhan ne lhang nge zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: lham me lhan ne lhang nge zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: because it illuminates.

original: de la mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the dhyāna called thorough refinement of characteristics?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this dhyāna,

original: @190a * // ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yongs su dag par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / so so'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: @190a * // ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yongs su dag par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / so so'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag par byed pa ste /
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the general characteristic of all meditative stabilizations and their individual characteristics are purified.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
translated: The general characteristic of all meditative stabilizations is the one-pointed abiding of the mind on the object of meditation.

original: so so'i mtshan nyid ni sems can gyi don du cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: so so'i mtshan nyid ni sems can gyi don du cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The individual characteristics are the various kinds of miracles that occur for the sake of sentient beings and so forth.

original: de dag yongs su dag par byed pa ni de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su dag par byed pa ni de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa med par byed pa'o //
translated: Purifying them is the removal of the obscurations that are discordant with them.

original: de la mngon par dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: de la mngon par dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “non-apprehension”?

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par dmigs pa med par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na don dam par ting nge 'dzin thams cad mtshan mar bzung zhing /🔽dmigs pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba mngon par dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par dmigs pa med par rjes su mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na don dam par ting nge 'dzin thams cad mtshan mar bzung zhing / dmigs pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba mngon par dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the realization that all meditative concentrations are non-apprehensible.🔽When one is equipoised in that meditative concentration, one realizes that all meditative concentrations are ultimately non-apprehensible, in that they are not apprehended as signs.🔽🔽

original: de la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: “The samādhi that sees all samādhis as not being apprehended” means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one realizes that all samādhis ultimately are not apprehended and are not taken to have characteristics.🔽“The samādhi endowed with all supreme aspects” means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthu dang / yon tan gyi rnam pa mchog thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthu dang / yon tan gyi rnam pa mchog thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba la rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: all the powers and qualities of all samādhis are endowed with all supreme aspects.

original: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “no delight in any happiness or suffering”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samādhi,🔽one does not see any samādhi as happiness or suffering.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in this samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la bde ba dang sdug bsngal du mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la bde ba dang sdug bsngal du mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa la /
translated: one does not conceptualize any samādhi as happiness or suffering, and one does not apprehend it as a sign.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “no delight in any happiness or suffering.”

original: de la zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “inexhaustible casket”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad zad par rung bar yang @190b dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam bar bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan zad mi shes pa'i snod du gyur pa la /🔽zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya'o //🔽de la gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /🔽gzungs thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na don dang tshig 'dzin nus pa'i gzungs thams cad kyi shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur ba la gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad zad par rung bar yang @190b dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam bar bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan zad mi shes pa'i snod du gyur pa la / zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya'o // de la gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing / gzungs thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa ste zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na don dang tshig 'dzin nus pa'i gzungs thams cad kyi shes rab dang ldan par 'gyur ba la gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: “The dhāraṇī of the inexhaustible casket” means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one becomes a vessel for the inexhaustible qualities of all samādhis.🔽“The dhāraṇī of the mind of retention” means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one becomes endowed with the wisdom of all dhāraṇīs that are able to retain meanings and words.

original: de la yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “The samādhi called the elimination of all that is right and wrong” means that when one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one eliminates all that is right and wrong.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽he does not see any meditative stabilizations as real or unreal.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad yang dag pa dang / log pa dang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad yang dag pa dang / log pa dang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: When he is equipoised in that meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la yang dag pa dang / log par rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba la yang dag pa dang / log pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la yang dag pa dang / log par rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba la yang dag pa dang / log pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: all conceptual thoughts of meditative stabilizations as real or unreal do not occur, and that is called the meditative stabilization that eliminates all real and unreal things.

original: de la 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meditative stabilization called the pacification of all opposition and cessation?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽he does not see any meditative stabilizations as opposed or ceased.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la 'gal ba dang / 'gog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgrib pa dang bgegs rnams med par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la 'gal ba dang / 'gog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi sgrib pa dang bgegs rnams med par 'gyur ba la /
translated: When he is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, all the obstructions and hindrances to meditative stabilizations are eliminated.

original: 'gal ba dang 'gog pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang 'gog pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “the samādhi that pacifies all conflict and cessation.

original: 'gal ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa la bya'o //
translated: ” Conflict refers to the obscurations that are incompatible with samādhi.

original: 'gog pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa'i bgegs la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa'i bgegs la bya'o //
translated: Cessation refers to the hindrances that interrupt samādhi.

original: de la mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called ‘free from conflict and compatibility’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽one does not see any conflict or compatibility in any samādhi.”

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mthun pa dang 'gal ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la mi dmigs🔽shing mtshan mar mi @191a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mthun pa dang 'gal ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la mi dmigs shing mtshan mar mi @191a * //
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, one does not observe either the antidotes to or the incompatible factors of any samādhi.

original: 'dzin par 'gyur ba la mthun pa dang 'gal pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par 'gyur ba la mthun pa dang 'gal pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not apprehending any characteristics, it is called “free from conflict and compatibility.”

original: de la 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called ‘stainless light’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽the maṇḍala of light of all meditative stabilizations is not apprehended.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na rnam par mi rtog pa'i lhun gyis grub par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ye shes kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na rnam par mi rtog pa'i lhun gyis grub par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ye shes kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor
translated: That is to say, when one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, since it becomes nonconceptual and spontaneous, the maṇḍala of light of the pristine consciousness of all meditative stabilizations

original: snang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus lus las 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'byung ba yang mi dmigs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus lus las 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'byung ba yang mi dmigs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and the maṇḍala of light that arises from the body through the power of meditative stabilization and meditative absorption are not apprehended.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa nyid /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa nyid /
translated: In that way, the very nonapprehension

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi 'od skyon med pa yin pa'i phyir 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi 'od skyon med pa yin pa'i phyir 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is the stainless light of nonconceptual pristine consciousness. Therefore, it is called the stainless light.

original: de la snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called endowed with essence?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi snying po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la don dam par snying po med par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi snying po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la don dam par snying po med par mthong ba ste /
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the essence of all meditative stabilizations is seen to be ultimately non-existent.

original: de ltar snying po med par rtogs pa nyid mchog dam pa yin pa'i phyir snying po dang ldan bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar snying po med par rtogs pa nyid mchog dam pa yin pa'i phyir snying po dang ldan bzhes bya'o //
translated: Since the realization of that non-existence is itself the highest and best, it is called “having an essence.”

original: de la zla ba dri ma med par rgyas pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zla ba dri ma med par rgyas pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “light of the stainless full moon”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽all meditative stabilizations are completely fulfilled, like the orb of the full moon.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'di lta ste dper na zla ba nya ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan dang / ye shes kyi 'od gsal ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'di lta ste dper na zla ba nya ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan dang / ye shes kyi 'od gsal ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa la /
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, the light of the qualities and wisdom of all meditative stabilizations is completely fulfilled.

original: zla ba dri ma med par rgyas pa'i 'od ces bya ste /
analyzed: zla ba dri ma med par rgyas pa'i 'od ces bya ste /
translated: It is called the “light of the full moon without blemish. ”

original: zla ba nya ba 'dra ba'i dpe ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: zla ba nya ba 'dra ba'i dpe ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The example of the full moon is an example of completeness.

original: de la glog gi 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la glog gi 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the vidyuddyotā (lightning light) samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽with a pure and cool light, he illuminates the realms of sentient beings and removes the torment of the heat of the darkness. ”

original: dag cing bsil ba'i 'od kyis sems can gyi ris snang bar byas shing mun pa mun nag gi tsha bas gdung ba sel bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na 'od glog bzhin du 'byung ba dag cing bsil bar
analyzed: dag cing bsil ba'i 'od kyis sems can gyi ris snang bar byas shing mun pa mun nag gi tsha bas gdung ba sel bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na 'od glog bzhin du 'byung ba dag cing bsil bar
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that samādhi, a light like lightning arises, pure and cool,

original: sems can gyi ris tshim zhing snang bar @191b bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris tshim zhing snang bar @191b bya ste /
translated: satisfying and illuminating the realms of sentient beings.

original: mun pa mun nag dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba bsal nas rnam par rig par byed pa la glog gi 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mun pa mun nag dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba bsal nas rnam par rig par byed pa la glog gi 'od kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: Having removed the darkness and the torment of afflictions, it is called the vidyuddyotā samādhi.

original: de la rgyan chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyan chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the mahāvyūha (great array) samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rgyan chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs dang yang ldan par 'gyur ba la rgyan chen po zhes bya
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad rgyan chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs dang yang ldan par 'gyur ba la rgyan chen po zhes bya
translated: “It is the great ornament of all meditative stabilizations” means that when one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization, one comes to possess the various qualities of all meditative stabilizations, which is called “the great ornament.”

original: ste / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi yon tan sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang mthu rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non par ston pa nyid rgyan chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ste / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi yon tan sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang mthu rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non par ston pa nyid rgyan chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The display of various kinds of miracles and powers for the sake of ripening sentient beings and liberating them, which cannot be outshone by others, is called “the great ornament” of the meditative stabilizations.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “illuminating all aspects”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad snang bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: “it illuminates all meditative stabilizations” means that when one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i yul gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba la /
translated: It is the clear realization of the object of observation of all other concentrations.🔽

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the radiance in every way because it illuminates the object of observation of all other meditative stabilizations.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called the sameness of meditative stabilizations?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: It is the meditative stabilization standing in which

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la 'khrug pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la 'khrug pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: he does not observe any disturbance in all meditative stabilizations🔽and does not observe any single focus.

original: rtse gcig kyang mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng ba dang / de'i gnyen po sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gnyi ga yang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas g-yeng ba dang /
analyzed: rtse gcig kyang mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng ba dang / de'i gnyen po sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa gnyi ga yang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas g-yeng ba dang /
translated: When he is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, by the power of realizing the sameness of all phenomena, he realizes the sameness of both the mental distraction that is the counteragent to all meditative stabilizations and the single focus of mind that is the antidote to that.

original: sems rtse gcig pa gnyi gar mi dmigs shing so so'i mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa gnyi gar mi dmigs shing so so'i mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa la /
translated: He does not observe either mental distraction or single focus of mind and does not apprehend their individual characteristics.

original: ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the “sameness of samādhi.”

original: de la rdul med pa'i rdul dang bral ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdul med pa'i rdul dang bral ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called ‘free from dust, free from defilement’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that samādhi,🔽one realizes the sameness of all dharmas, that they are free from dust and free from defilement.’

original: ting nge 'dzin dang chos thams cad rdul can dang rdul dang bral ba mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs @192a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang chos thams cad rdul can dang rdul dang bral ba mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs @192a * //
translated: When one is absorbed in that samādhi, one realizes that all dharmas are emptiness.

original: pas ting nge 'dzin la yang dngos por mi lta /
analyzed: pas ting nge 'dzin la yang dngos por mi lta /
translated: One does not see even samādhi as a thing.

original: chos thams cad la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
translated: One does not grasp any dharmas as having characteristics.

original: skyon dang skyon med pa gnyi ga mnyam pa nyid du lta ba la /
analyzed: skyon dang skyon med pa gnyi ga mnyam pa nyid du lta ba la /
translated: One sees the sameness of both faults and non-faults.

original: rdul med cing rdul dang bral ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdul med cing rdul dang bral ba'i tshul dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘free from dust, free from defilement.’

original: de la nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called ‘arriving at non-affliction’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽all meditative stabilizations become free of afflictions.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative stabilization,🔽all the counteragents to meditative stabilizations—distractions and discursive thoughts—are absent.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng zhing rnam par rtog pa thams cad med par 'gyur ba la nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng zhing rnam par rtog pa thams cad med par 'gyur ba la nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “the meditative stabilization that is the right orientation to freedom from afflictions.”

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sems g-yeng ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la bya'o //
translated: In this context, “afflictions” refers to distractions and discursive thoughts, which are counteragents to meditative stabilizations.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “the right orientation to freedom from afflictions for all that is associated with afflictions”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba 'thob par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag cing nyon mongs🔽pa med par 'gyur bar nus pa la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba 'thob par 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag cing nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur bar nus pa la /
translated: It is called ‘the absorption that is the gateway to the absence of afflictions for all that is associated with afflictions’ because when one rests in equipoise in that absorption, all phenomena associated with afflictions can be purified and become free of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‘the gateway to the absence of afflictions for all that is associated with afflictions’ because it is able to purify all phenomena associated with afflictions and make them free of afflictions.

original: de la gnas dmigs su med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: de la gnas dmigs su med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: What is the absorption called ‘the application to the non-apprehension of a basis’?🔽It is the absorption that rests in the non-apprehension of the basis of all the absorptions.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi kun gzhi nye bar mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi kun gzhi nye bar mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: It is called ‘the application to the non-apprehension of a basis’ because when one rests in equipoise in that absorption,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gzhi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i ye shes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs shing yongs su dag pa la yang mi dmigs par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gzhi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa'i ye shes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs shing yongs su dag pa la yang mi dmigs par 'gyur ba la /
translated: The wisdom that is the transformation of the all-base consciousness, the basis of all meditative concentrations, is free from apprehended and apprehender and is completely pure.

original: gnas dmigs su med pa la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dmigs su med pa la brtson pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To be diligent in the non-apprehension of a basis is called ‘diligence in the non-apprehension of a reference point.’

original: de la de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative concentration called ‘abiding in suchness and being without mind’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative concentration,🔽one does not turn back from the suchness of all meditative concentrations.

original: @192b ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las phyir mi ldog pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: @192b ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las phyir mi ldog pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: When one rests in equipoise in that meditative concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi don chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ba la /
translated: one’s mind becomes one-pointed in the non-conceptual nature of the suchness that is the pure realm of phenomena, the meaning of all meditative concentrations.

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “abiding in suchness without mind.”

original: de la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called ‘eliminating the faults of the body’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in this samādhi,🔽one does not apprehend the body of any samādhi.”

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi lus mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus sems can gyi don du lus rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa 'byung ba rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi lus mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus sems can gyi don du lus rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa 'byung ba rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: This means that through the power of resting in equipoise in this samādhi, the various bodies emanated for the sake of sentient beings do not arise as signs, and

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ste /
translated: not conceptualizing them is called “eliminating the faults of the body.”

original: lus kyi skyon zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir lus sna tshogs su sprul pa la /
analyzed: lus kyi skyon zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir lus sna tshogs su sprul pa la /
translated: Here, “faults of the body” refers to the various emanations of the body

original: mtshan mar 'dzin cing dngos por rtog pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin cing dngos por rtog pa la bya'o //
translated: that are apprehended as signs and conceptualized as things.

original: de la ngag gi skyon rnams 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngag gi skyon rnams 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called ‘like space through the destruction of the faults of speech’?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽the verbal activity of all meditative stabilizations is not apprehended.🔽This is called the meditative stabilization “Destruction of Verbal Faults.”

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngag gi las mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus sems can gyi don du sgra skad rnam pa sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngag gi las mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag pa'i mthus sems can gyi don du sgra skad rnam pa sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: Through the power of being equipoised in that meditative stabilization, for the sake of sentient beings, when teaching the Dharma with various sounds and languages, one does not apprehend them as signs and does not conceive of them as entities.

original: dngos por mi rtog pa la ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos por mi rtog pa la ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because verbal faults are destroyed, it is said to be like space.

original: de la nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative stabilization called “Liberation Without Distraction and Without Stain Like Space”?

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas shing /
translated: Abiding in that meditative stabilization,🔽all phenomena are liberated without distraction and without stain like space.🔽This is called the meditative stabilization “Liberation Without Distraction and Without Stain Like Space.”

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur rtogs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa 'thob pa ste zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par bzhag na chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur rtogs te /
translated: When one is equipoised in that meditative stabilization, one realizes that all phenomena are like illusions.

original: de la ma chags pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya ba'i sgrib pa las grol zhing nam mkha' ltar cis kyang gos pa med par 'gyur ba la /🔽nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par @193a * //
analyzed: de la ma chags pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya ba'i sgrib pa las grol zhing nam mkha' ltar cis kyang gos pa med par 'gyur ba la / nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par @193a * //
translated: By being unattached to that, one is liberated from the afflictive and knowledge obscurations and becomes like space, unstained by anything.

original: grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “liberation without stain, like space, due to nonattachment.”🔽Subhūti, this is the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi theg pa chen po mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi theg pa chen po mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This concludes the teaching on the Great Vehicle of the concentrations.

original: gong du smos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rnams la mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de rnams la mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: If one rests in equipoise on those concentrations mentioned above,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i lam mam /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i lam mam /
translated: it becomes the path or cause for attaining the great, unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: rgyur 'gyur pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de rnams la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyur 'gyur pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de rnams la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those concentrations are called the “Great Vehicle.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the ninth chapter in the vast commentary on the perfection of wisdom in one hundred thousand lines, called Illuminating the Meaning.

original: // / de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi theg pa chen po bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi theg pa chen po bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the Great Vehicle of meditative stabilization,

original: de'i 'og tu dran nye bar gzhag pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dran nye bar gzhag pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that the four close mindfulnesses are the Great Vehicle,

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: it is said, “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings is as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the four close mindfulnesses.”

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Regarding this, it is said, “What is the close mindfulness of the body?”

original: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing /
translated: and so on up to “having eliminated worldly attachment and unhappiness,🔽they engage in analysis without conceptualizing the body.”

original: rnam par spyod kyang lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par spyod kyang lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the close mindfulness of the body.

original: de la nang gi lus zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi lus zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: The inner body is the body of the self, endowed with mind and mental factors.

original: phyi'i lus zhes bya ba ni mi tshe 'phos pa'i lus la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang mi ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i lus zhes bya ba ni mi tshe 'phos pa'i lus la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang mi ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: The outer body is the body of another person, not endowed with mind and mental factors.

original: phyi nang gi lus zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan gyi lus la bya ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gi lus zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan gyi lus la bya ste /
translated: The inner and outer body is the body of another sentient being.

original: bdag gi lus la ma gtogs pas phyi'i lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus la ma gtogs pas phyi'i lus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called outer because it is not included in one's own body.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir nang gi lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir nang gi lus zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called inner because it is endowed with mind and mental factors.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i phyir phyi nang gi lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang gnyi ga dang ldan pa'i phyir phyi nang gi lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called inner and outer because it is endowed with both inner and outer.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi lus gsum char yang don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de la dngos por mi lta ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi lus gsum char yang don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas de la dngos por mi lta ba la bya'o //
translated: The phrase in a manner of non-apprehension means that, because the three bodies - inner, outer, and inner and outer - are ultimately not established as existent entities, one should not view them as entities.

original: lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu ji ltar snang ba'i lus la brten nas /
analyzed: lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu ji ltar snang ba'i lus la brten nas /
translated: The phrase observing the body means that, in terms of the relative, one observes the body as it appears.

original: bdag @193b dang bdag gi med par rtogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bdag @193b dang bdag gi med par rtogs pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase observing the body means that, on the basis of the body as it is perceived conventionally, one realizes that there is no self and no mine.

original: brtson 'grus can zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par mi dmigs pa dang / kun rdzob tu lus kyi rjes su lta ba la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / nan tan cher bya ste brtson pa la bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus can zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par mi dmigs pa dang / kun rdzob tu lus kyi rjes su lta ba la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / nan tan cher bya ste brtson pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase one who is diligent means that one is constantly and uninterruptedly diligent in the practice of nonapprehending in the ultimate sense and in the observation of the body in the conventional sense.

original: shes bzhin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang bag byed pa dang ldan par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang bag byed pa dang ldan par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who is self-controlled means that one is endowed with wisdom and self-control.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa'i yul la dran pa mi rmongs pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi tshugs par srung bar dran pa dang mi yengs par byed pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa'i yul la dran pa mi rmongs pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi tshugs par srung bar dran pa dang mi yengs par byed pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase one who is mindful means that one is endowed with the mindfulness that is not confused about the object of nonapprehending, the mindfulness that protects against being harmed by adverse factors, and the mindfulness that does not become distracted.

original: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang / shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang / shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase having eliminated worldly attachment and unhappiness indicates the quality of being endowed with vigilance, mindfulness, and effort.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad spangs pa la chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba bsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad spangs pa la chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba bsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The elimination of the eight worldly dharmas is called the elimination of worldly attachment and unhappiness.

original: de la rnyed pa dang grags pa dang / bde ba dang / bstod pa rnams la mi chags pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la rnyed pa dang grags pa dang / bde ba dang / bstod pa rnams la mi chags pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Here, attachment refers to the occurrence of attachment to gain, fame, pleasure, and praise.

original: ma rnyed pa dang / ma grags pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / smad pa rnams la ni yid mi bde ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa dang / ma grags pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / smad pa rnams la ni yid mi bde ba 'byung ste /
translated: Unhappiness refers to the occurrence of unhappiness in the face of the absence of gain, fame, pleasure, and praise.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos de rnams spangs pa la 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnams par bsal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos de rnams spangs pa la 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnams par bsal zhes bya'o //
translated: The elimination of these worldly dharmas is called the elimination of worldly attachment and unhappiness.

original: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu de ltar lus kyi rjes su lta yang don dam par de ltar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu de ltar lus kyi rjes su lta yang don dam par de ltar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not conceptualize the conceptualizations associated with the body. The meaning is that he does not conceptualize them ultimately, although he does see the body conventionally.

original: rjes su lta ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don ni 'og ma thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽nang gi tshor ba la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rjes su lta ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don ni 'og ma thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // nang gi tshor ba la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The meaning of the explanations of the foundations of mindfulness of feeling, mind, and dharmas should be understood in the same way as the above explanation of the foundation of mindfulness of the body.🔽The foundation of mindfulness of feeling is taught in the passage beginning with “he dwells contemplating feelings in the feelings internally” and ending with “he does not conceptualize the conceptualizations associated with feeling.”

original: tshor ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The foundation of mindfulness of mind is taught in the passage beginning with “he dwells contemplating mind in the mind internally” and ending with “he does not conceptualize the conceptualizations associated with mind.”🔽The foundation of mindfulness of dharmas is taught in the passage beginning with “he dwells contemplating dharmas in the dharmas internally” and ending with “he does not conceptualize the conceptualizations associated with the dharmas.”

original: de la nang gi tshor ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms pa'o //🔽phyi'i tshor ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po sems dang @194a * //
analyzed: de la nang gi tshor ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms pa'o // phyi'i tshor ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po sems dang @194a * //
translated: Internal feeling is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling that arises in dependence on one’s own body.

original: sems las byung ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sems las byung ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: External feeling is the three kinds of feeling that arise in dependence on external things that are not associated with mind or mental factors.

original: phyi nang gi tshor ba ni sems can gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum mo //🔽nang gi sems la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phyi nang gi tshor ba ni sems can gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum mo // nang gi sems la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Internal-external feeling is the three kinds of feeling that arise in dependence on the bodies of other sentient beings.

original: sems dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The mindfulness of mind is taught in the passage that begins, “He watches the mind internally, as it is, without being mentally engaged, and he watches the mind externally, as it is, without being mentally engaged,” and ends with, “He does not conceptualize the mind that is associated with conceptualization.”

original: phyi dang nang dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi dang nang dang / phyi nang gi tshor ba'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just as explained in the section on internal, external, and internal-external feeling.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug med pa la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug med pa la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: The so-called mind is the mind with passion, the mind without passion, the mind with hatred, the mind without hatred, the mind with ignorance, the mind without ignorance, and so on.

original: nang gi chos la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nang gi chos la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The internal phenomena are not apprehended, and so on up to:

original: chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: He does not conceptualize the conceptualizations that are in accord with the Dharma.

original: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang dang ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang dang ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The internal, the external, and the internal and external are as explained above.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
translated: The so-called phenomena are mundane phenomena such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and supramundane phenomena such as the factors of awakening.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the four applications of mindfulness by way of the Bodhisattva Vehicle,

original: de'i 'og tu nyan thos kyi theg pa las byung ba'i tshul gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyan thos kyi theg pa las byung ba'i tshul gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to teach the application of mindfulness of the body by way of the method that comes from the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva-mahāsattvas attend to the body in the body inwardly?” and so on.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'gro na 'gro zhes bya ba rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'gro na 'gro zhes bya ba rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, when going, know “I am going,” and so on.

original: rab 'byor da ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @194b lus kyi rjes su lta zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor da ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @194b lus kyi rjes su lta zhing /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they attend to the body inwardly in the body,

original: brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni spyod lam bzhi'i sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni spyod lam bzhi'i sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Translation: བརྩོན་འགྲུས་དང་ལྡན་པ་ཤེས་བཞིན་དང་ལྡན་པ་དྲན་པ་དང་ལྡན་པས་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཆགས་སེམས་དང་ཡིད་མི་བདེ་བ་རྣམ་པར་བསལ་ནས་རྣམ་པར་སྤྱོད་དོ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་བར་གྱིས་ནི་སྤྱོད་ལམ་བཞིའི་སྒོ་ནས་ལུས་དྲན་པ་ཉེ་བར་གཞག་པ་བསྟན་ཏོ་།།

original: de la spyod lam la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la spyod lam la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two aspects to the right conduct:🔽

original: spyod lam chen po dang / spyod lam phra mo'o //
analyzed: spyod lam chen po dang / spyod lam phra mo'o //
translated: the great deportment and the subtle deportment.

original: de la spyod lam chen po ni lam ring por 'gro ba na /
analyzed: de la spyod lam chen po ni lam ring por 'gro ba na /
translated: The great posture is when you are traveling a long distance.

original: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'i tshe lus kyi spyod lam gang la spyod pa de lam yengs par dran pa nye bar 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'i tshe lus kyi spyod lam gang la spyod pa de lam yengs par dran pa nye bar 'jog pa ste /
translated: When walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, he places mindfulness in front of him and is not distracted from the right path, whatever his physical behavior.🔽

original: de yang rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'gro na 'gro zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de yang rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'gro na 'gro zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, here the Bodhisattva, the great being, when he goes, knows that he goes.🔽

original: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: He practices, having eliminated worldly thoughts of desire and mental dissatisfaction.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing rnam par spyod de /
translated: Subhūti, furthermore, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with regard to the internal body, practices observing the body as a corpse, without objectifying anything.

original: 'gro'am 'od yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'gro'am 'od yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Whether walking or standing, he practices with vigilance, and so on, up to🔽he practices with vigilance in meditative equipoise.

original: nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni spyod lam phra mo bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nang du yang dag par 'jog pa la yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni spyod lam phra mo bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the subtle aspects of conduct.

original: grong nas grong du 'gro ba dang / gnas gcig na 'dug pa'i tshe nye 'khor du 'gro zhing 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam la bag yod cing dran pa nye bar 'jog pa la spyod lam phra mo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: grong nas grong du 'gro ba dang / gnas gcig na 'dug pa'i tshe nye 'khor du 'gro zhing 'dug pa la sogs pa'i spyod lam la bag yod cing dran pa nye bar 'jog pa la spyod lam phra mo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When going from village to village, or when staying in one place, the conduct of going, staying, and so on in the vicinity, is called “subtle conduct” because it is heedful and mindful.

original: 'gro'am 'ong ngam zhes bya ba gong ma ni grong nas grong du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro'am 'ong ngam zhes bya ba gong ma ni grong nas grong du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la bya'o //
translated: The above “going or coming” refers to going from village to village and coming back.

original: 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba 'og ma ni nye 'khor na spyod pa'i tshe 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba 'og ma ni nye 'khor na spyod pa'i tshe 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la bya'o //
translated: The below “going and coming” refers to going and coming when one is moving about in the vicinity.

original: nang du yang dag par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog cing dben pa na gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: nang du yang dag par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog cing dben pa na gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: “Inner serenity” refers to the meditative absorption of serenity and insight in union, and to the state of being in solitude.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽when they are mindful and breathe in, they are mindful and know they are breathing in, and so on,

original: dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu na yang dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /🔽rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems @195a * //
analyzed: dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu na yang dran zhing dbugs nang du rgyu'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas / rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems @195a * //
translated: up to

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing /
analyzed: nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing /
translated: Inwardly, with regard to the body, they watch the body, without objectifying it.

original: brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: They are diligent, mindful, and endowed with alertness.🔽They are free from worldly attachment and mental unhappiness.

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang ; yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nang gi lus la dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i tshe dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang ; yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nang gi lus la dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i tshe dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains the close placement of mindfulness with regard to the body when one is breathing in and out.

original: bsam gtan pa sems mi yengs shing bsam gtan la sems las su rung bar sbyang ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du ring thung du rgyu ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa sems mi yengs shing bsam gtan la sems las su rung bar sbyang ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du ring thung du rgyu ba'i tshe /
translated: In order to train the mind in concentration so that it is not distracted and becomes serviceable, when one is breathing in and out long and short, one should be mindful and alert.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin gnyis kyis dran zhing tshor bar bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin gnyis kyis dran zhing tshor bar bya ste /
translated: One should be mindful and aware.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phyi nang gi dngos po gzhan la sems ma yengs shing mi rtog par dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la brtag cing sems sbyangs nas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phyi nang gi dngos po gzhan la sems ma yengs shing mi rtog par dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la brtag cing sems sbyangs nas /
translated: Without letting the mind be distracted to other things, such as forms, one should examine the inhalation and exhalation of the breath and train the mind.

original: de ltar sbyangs te sems las su rung na lus kyang las su rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar sbyangs te sems las su rung na lus kyang las su rung ste /
translated: Thus, when the mind is trained and becomes workable, the body also becomes workable.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yang je bde je chung je phrar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yang je bde je chung je phrar 'gyur ro //
translated: The in-and-out breathing becomes more comfortable, less, and more subtle.

original: de ltar dbugs rje bde je chung je phrar gyur na sems kyi g-yeng ba dang / rtog pa yang je bde je nyung je phrar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dbugs rje bde je chung je phrar gyur na sems kyi g-yeng ba dang / rtog pa yang je bde je nyung je phrar 'gyur te /
translated: When the breathing becomes more comfortable, less, and more subtle, the distractions and thoughts of the mind also become more comfortable, less, and more subtle.

original: gang la dmigs pa de la sems rtse gcig tu 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa de la sems rtse gcig tu 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind becomes one-pointedly concentrated on whatever object it is focused on.

original: de'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan to // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the mindfulness of in-and-out breathing is taught.

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i rdza mkhan rdza byed pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba na /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba'i mchan bu mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i rdza mkhan rdza byed pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: for example, a potter or a potter's skilled apprentice, when turning the wheel for making pottery,

original: rdza che chung gi bye brag las 'khor lo yun ring thung du bskor ba'i nyams drod rdza mkhan la yod pa'i dpes bsam gtan pa sems sbyong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rdza che chung gi bye brag las 'khor lo yun ring thung du bskor ba'i nyams drod rdza mkhan la yod pa'i dpes bsam gtan pa sems sbyong ba'i tshe /
translated: The example of the potter who has the experience of turning the wheel for a long or short time according to the size of the pot, illustrates that when the meditator trains the mind,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yun ring thung ji srid du rgyu ba'i nyams drod yod par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yun ring thung ji srid du rgyu ba'i nyams drod yod par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: he should have the experience of breathing in and out for as long as he breathes in and out.

original: rdza mkhan gyi mkhan po dang / mchan bu'i dpes smos pa ni bsam gtan pa'i mkhan po dang / slob ma bsam gtan goms pa dang ma goms pa'i khyad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi mkhan po dang / mchan bu'i dpes smos pa ni bsam gtan pa'i mkhan po dang / slob ma bsam gtan goms pa dang ma goms pa'i khyad par bstan pa'o //
translated: The example of the potter and his apprentice illustrates the difference between the meditator who is familiar with meditation and the one who is not.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom,

original: lus 'di la sa'i khams kyang yod do @195b zhes bya ba nas /
