analyzed: lus 'di la sa'i khams kyang yod do @195b zhes bya ba nas /
translated: he considers this body of his as consisting of the earth-element,🔽etc.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'greng ngam 'dug ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'greng ngam 'dug ste /
translated: Thus, Subhuti, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, stand or sit in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: They observe the body as it is, with diligence, with mindfulness, with alertness,🔽and they completely eliminate worldly attachment and unhappiness.

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsam zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sa'i khams la sogs pa khams bzhi la brtag pa'i sgo nas nang gi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsam zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sa'i khams la sogs pa khams bzhi la brtag pa'i sgo nas nang gi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the close placement of mindfulness of the internal body by way of investigating the four elements, earth and so on.

original: lus 'di 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: lus 'di 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: This body has the nature of the four great elements.🔽Since the four great elements have the nature of impermanence, if one realizes that ultimately there are no entities, one will not become attached to them.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin par rtogs na de la chags par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir khams kyi sgo nas brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin par rtogs na de la chags par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir khams kyi sgo nas brtag pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the investigation by way of the elements is taught.

original: ba lang gi shan pa'i dpe bstan pa ni shan pas phyugs bshas pa'i sha rnams mngon sum du mthong zhing bye brag phyed pa bzhin du bsam gtan pas kyang bdag gi lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin par mngon sum du rtogs par bya ba bstan
analyzed: ba lang gi shan pa'i dpe bstan pa ni shan pas phyugs bshas pa'i sha rnams mngon sum du mthong zhing bye brag phyed pa bzhin du bsam gtan pas kyang bdag gi lus 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin par mngon sum du rtogs par bya ba bstan
translated: The example of the butcher is taught to show that just as the butcher sees the meat of the slaughtered animal with his own eyes and distinguishes the different parts, so the meditator should realize with his own eyes that his body is of the nature of the four great elements.

original: pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: lus 'di la rkang pa'i mthil yan chad ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: lus 'di la rkang pa'i mthil yan chad ces bya ba nas /
translated: they contemplate the body from the soles of the feet upward, thinking, 'In this body there is head hair, body hair,

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing /
analyzed: nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing /
translated: they contemplate the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally, but they do not apprehend it.

original: brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus can shes bzhin dang ldan pa /
translated: They are diligent, mindful, and fully aware,

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nang gi lus la mi gtsang ba sna tshogs yod par brtag pa'i sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi chags sems dang / yid mi bde ba bsal zhing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nang gi lus la mi gtsang ba sna tshogs yod par brtag pa'i sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage, endowed with mindfulness, he dwells having removed worldly attachment and distress, teaches the application of mindfulness to the body by way of the contemplation of the various impurities in the internal body.

original: de ltar lus la mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar brtags na lus la ma chags par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //🔽chun pa'i snod 'bru sna tshogs kyis gang ba'i dpe bstan pa ni zhing pa 'bru'i rgyus la mkhas pa /
analyzed: de ltar lus la mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar brtags na lus la ma chags par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o // chun pa'i snod 'bru sna tshogs kyis gang ba'i dpe bstan pa ni zhing pa 'bru'i rgyus la mkhas pa /
translated: Thus, it teaches that when one contemplates the body as filled with various impurities, one will not be attached to the body.🔽The example of a container filled with various grains teaches that the meditator,

original: 'bru sna @196a * //
analyzed: 'bru sna @196a * //
translated: like a farmer who is skilled in the causes of grain,

original: tshogs la mngon du lta zhing /
analyzed: tshogs la mngon du lta zhing /
translated: who looks directly at the various grains,

original: 'bru'i bye brag phyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'bru'i bye brag phyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: and who distinguishes the different grains,

original: bsam gtan pa lus mi gtsang bar bsgom pa yang lus mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba mngon sum du gyur par byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa lus mi gtsang bar bsgom pa yang lus mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba mngon sum du gyur par byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: contemplates the body as filled with various impurities and makes the various impurities of the body manifest.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nam dur khrod na yod pa'i gzugs sna tshogs dur khrod du bor ba ro'i mal du bsnyal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i lus la dmigs pa'i sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nam dur khrod na yod pa'i gzugs sna tshogs dur khrod du bor ba ro'i mal du bsnyal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i lus la dmigs pa'i sgo nas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning “When they see various forms in the charnel ground, discarded in the charnel ground, laid out on a charnel ground bier” teaches the cultivation of the application of mindfulness to the body by means of observing the external body.

original: phyi'i lus dur khrod na 'dug pa gsar rnying mi sdug pa gsar rnying sna tshogs dang ldan pa mthong nas bdag gi lus kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin par brtags nas lus lam chags par bya ba la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i lus dur khrod na 'dug pa gsar rnying mi sdug pa gsar rnying sna tshogs dang ldan pa mthong nas bdag gi lus kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin par brtags nas lus lam chags par bya ba la bstan pa'o //
translated: Having seen the external body in the charnel ground, with various degrees of decay, fresh and old, and having investigated that “My body also has that nature,” one should not be attached to the body.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi lus la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning he watches the internal body as a body in terms of the non-apprehension of the body is a summary of the cultivation of the mindfulness of body according to the method found in the scriptures of the Hinayana.

original: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi lus ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi lus ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The internal body, the external body, and the internal-external body are as explained above.

original: nang gi tshor ba la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las 'byung ba'i tshul gyis tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa bstan
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las 'byung ba'i tshul gyis tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa bstan
translated: The passage beginning he watches the internal feelings as feelings in terms of the non-apprehension of feelings is a summary of the cultivation of the mindfulness of feelings, mind, and dharmas according to the method found in the scriptures of the Hinayana.

original: pa ste / de dag gi don kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: pa ste / de dag gi don kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of these is the same as before.

original: rab 'byor 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las 'byung ba'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung las 'byung ba'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: This too, Subhuti, is the great vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: pa la spyod pas gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs par byas nas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na bla na med pa'i byang chub theg pa chen po 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bstan @196b
analyzed: pa la spyod pas gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs par byas nas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na bla na med pa'i byang chub theg pa chen po 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bstan @196b
translated: Thus, this cultivation of the four applications of mindfulness is also called the great vehicle because, when a Bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom has realized the selflessness of both persons and things and cultivated that by way of nonapprehending, it becomes the cause for attaining the unsurpassed enlightenment of the Great Vehicle.🔽Furthermore, Subhuti, the great vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being, is as follows: the four right efforts...

original: pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar yang dag par spong pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar yang dag par spong pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, the four right efforts are taught to be the Great Vehicle.

original: brtson 'grus kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spangs pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spangs pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams pa skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang /
translated: Diligence is the non-production of non-virtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen, the abandonment of those that have arisen, the production of virtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen, the maintenance of those that have arisen, and their further increase.

original: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa la yang dag par spong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa la yang dag par spong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Diligence is called “perfect abandonment” because it prevents the arising of nonvirtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen, abandons those that have arisen, gives rise to virtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen, and stabilizes those that have arisen, causing them to increase and be perfected.

original: de la brtson 'grus la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Diligence is also of four kinds:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: armor-like diligence, diligence in application, diligence that is never discouraged, and skillful diligence.

original: de la mos pa bskyed cing zhes bya ba ni dang po 'di ltar bya'o zhes sems mos shing 'dun pa bskyed pa ste ;
analyzed: de la mos pa bskyed cing zhes bya ba ni dang po 'di ltar bya'o zhes sems mos shing 'dun pa bskyed pa ste ;
translated: “Giving rise to interest” means to give rise to interest and enthusiasm, thinking, “First I will do this.”

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: This is armor-like diligence.

original: rtsol lo zhes bya ba ni de ltar go cha bgos pa'i brtson 'grus dang mthun par sdig pa'i chos spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos skyed pa la sbyor bas sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsol lo zhes bya ba ni de ltar go cha bgos pa'i brtson 'grus dang mthun par sdig pa'i chos spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos skyed pa la sbyor bas sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase he exerts himself refers to the effort that is in harmony with the armoring effort and is applied to the abandonment of the addictions and the production of the virtues. This is called the effort of application.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes bya ba ni mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes bya ba ni mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: The phrase he initiates effort refers to the effort that is not discouraged.

original: bya dka' zhing tshegs che ba byung du zin kyang sems mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom pas na mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya dka' zhing tshegs che ba byung du zin kyang sems mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus rtsom pas na mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: Even when he encounters difficulties and hardships, he initiates effort without discouragement. This is called the effort that is not discouraged.

original: sems kyi mthu skyed do //
analyzed: sems kyi mthu skyed do //
translated: He generates the power of mind.

original: yang dag par smon lam 'debs te zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: yang dag par smon lam 'debs te zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi brtson 'grus te /
translated: He makes his prayers firm refers to the effort that is skillful.

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i che sems bying bar gyur na thabs kyis sems kyi mthu skyed cing gsal bar byed pa dang / sems rgod par gyur na thabs kyis sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa la thabs kyi brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin sgom pa'i che sems bying bar gyur na thabs kyis sems kyi mthu skyed cing gsal bar byed pa dang / sems rgod par gyur na thabs kyis sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa la thabs kyi brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: If the mind becomes excited, the method is to settle the mind in one-pointedness. This is called the striving of method.

original: yang dag par smon lam 'debs zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir sems legs par 'jog cing mi g-yengs bar 'dzin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par smon lam 'debs zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir sems legs par 'jog cing mi g-yengs bar 'dzin pa la bya'o //
translated: Making right aspirations means in this context to settle the mind well and hold it without distraction.

original: theg pa chen po'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the Great Vehicle is as explained above.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs @197a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs @197a * //
translated: Subhūti, moreover, the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings is like this: the four bases of magical power, and so on.

original: pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the four bases of magical power are the Great Vehicle.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnams thob par byed pa'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnams thob par byed pa'i rgyu'am /
translated: The term “bases of supernatural power” means the causes for attaining supramundane supernatural powers.

original: gzhi'am rten yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi'am rten yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The expression “bases of supernatural power” means that the four kinds of one-pointed concentration are called “bases of supernatural power” because they are the cause, basis, or support for attaining the supranormal powers.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi ni mos pa dang sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi ni mos pa dang sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The four kinds of one-pointed concentration are the one-pointed concentration of aspiration, the one-pointed concentration of energy, the one-pointed concentration of mind, and the one-pointed concentration of investigation.🔽The one-pointed concentration of aspiration is the one-pointed concentration of the mind that is attained through the power of aspiration, when one has generated a great aspiration to cultivate virtuous qualities.🔽The one-pointed concentration of energy is the one-pointed concentration of the mind that is attained through the power of energy, when one has generated a great energy to cultivate virtuous qualities.🔽The one-pointed concentration of mind is the one-pointed concentration of the mind that is attained through the power of the mind, original: de la mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba'i chos sgom pa la mos pa cher skyes nas mos pa'i dbang gis sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig tu gyur pa la mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //🔽spong ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i mthus spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba'i chos sgom pa la mos pa cher skyes nas mos pa'i dbang gis sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig tu gyur pa la mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o // spong ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i mthus spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The one-pointed concentration of mind is the one-pointed concentration of the mind that is attained through the power of the mind, when one has generated a great mind to cultivate virtuous qualities.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: The one-

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms dang brgyad de /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms dang brgyad de /
translated: They are: aspiration, effort, faith, pliancy, mindfulness, vigilance, intention, and equanimity.

original: chos 'di brgyad kyis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di brgyad kyis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: These eight factors are called the “applications of abandoning” because they abandon the afflictions.

original: de la 'dun pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire to enter into the mundane and supramundane meditative concentrations and meditative absorptions.

original: brtson 'grus ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nges par sel bar rtsol zhing 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nges par sel bar rtsol zhing 'bad pa'o //
translated: Effort is the exertion and striving to definitely eliminate all non-virtuous phenomena.

original: dad pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'bras bu bzhi dang ; sa bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'bras bu bzhi dang ; sa bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Faith is the desire to attain the four fruits such as the fruit of stream-entry and so forth, and the qualities of the buddhas and bodhisattvas such as the ten grounds and so forth.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: When one enters into the meditative concentrations and meditative absorptions of pliancy,

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba'o //
translated: It is the serviceability of the mind and body.

original: dran pa ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sems ma rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sems ma rmongs pa'o //
translated: Recollection is the non-confusion of the mind in regard to concentration and meditative concentration.

original: shes bzhin ni shes rab kyi dbang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams mi 'byung bar bag byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni shes rab kyi dbang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams mi 'byung bar bag byed pa'o //
translated: Intellect is the protection of the mind through the power of wisdom, so that the unwholesome dharmas do not arise.

original: sems pa ni sems yongs su sbyong ba'i mtshan nyid sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni sems yongs su sbyong ba'i mtshan nyid sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Thought is the mental attention which has the characteristic of the purification of the mind.

original: btang snyoms ni sems bying pa @197b dang ; rgod pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du lhun gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems bying pa @197b dang ; rgod pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du lhun gyis grub pa ste /
translated: Equanimity is the natural state of the mind, neither depressed nor exalted, when it is in a state of balance.

original: chos de brgyad dang ldan na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams spong bar byed pa'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de brgyad dang ldan na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams spong bar byed pa'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one possesses these eight dharmas, one is said to possess the application of abandoning, because one abandons the unwholesome dharmas such as the defilements.

original: dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de phyi dang nang gi 'du 'dzi dang bral bar gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin de phyi dang nang gi 'du 'dzi dang bral bar gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: Dwelling in solitude means that one dwells in the meditative concentration of aspiration, free from the distractions of the external and internal.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in freedom from desire means abiding in freedom from the afflictions of the three realms.

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rnams 'gog par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal rnams 'gog par gyur ba'o //
translated: Abiding in cessation means the cessation of suffering.

original: rnam par spong bas yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams yongs su spangs par gyur pa'o //🔽brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos spong ba la brtson pa dang / dge ba'i chos spel ba la brtson pa'i brtson 'grus lhur blangs pa'i dbang gis sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par spong bas yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams yongs su spangs par gyur pa'o // brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos spong ba la brtson pa dang / dge ba'i chos spel ba la brtson pa'i brtson 'grus lhur blangs pa'i dbang gis sems mnyam par gzhag cing rtse gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment through elimination means the elimination of the five appropriated aggregates.🔽The concentration of effort means that through the power of undertaking effort in abandoning non-virtuous dharmas and increasing virtuous dharmas, the mind becomes concentrated and one-pointed.

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par sems sbyong ba lhur blangs nas mnyam par 'jog cing sems rtse gcig tu gyur to //
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par sems sbyong ba lhur blangs nas mnyam par 'jog cing sems rtse gcig tu gyur to //
translated: The concentration of mind means that through undertaking the training of the mind in the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā, the mind becomes concentrated and one-pointed.

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam par dpyad pa lhur blangs nas mnyam par gzhag cing sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams rnam par dpyad pa lhur blangs nas mnyam par gzhag cing sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: The so-called concentration of analysis is the one-pointed mind that is concentrated by the force of analyzing the phenomena that are the counteragents and adverse factors of wisdom.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa dang / dben pa la gnas pa la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar dbang po lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa dang / dben pa la gnas pa la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar dbang po lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The application of abandoning, abiding in solitude, and so on are as explained above.🔽Moreover, Subhūti, the Mahāyāna of bodhisattva mahāsattvas is as follows: the five faculties.

original: dbang po lnga theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the five faculties are the Mahāyāna.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting 'dzin dang / shes rab dang chos 'di lnga dang ldan pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / sa dang po la sogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub @198a * //
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting 'dzin dang / shes rab dang chos 'di lnga dang ldan pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / sa dang po la sogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub @198a * //
translated: Because of possessing these five dharmas, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom, one becomes a cause for attaining the four fruits of Stream-enterer and so on, which are supramundane, and for attaining the first ground and so on. Therefore they are called faculties.🔽Furthermore, Subhūti, the Mahāyāna of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is as follows: the five powers.

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar stobs lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stobs lnga theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar stobs lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stobs lnga theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the five powers are the Mahāyāna.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po de dag nyid yang dang yang du bsgoms pa'i mthus brtan zhing mthu dang ldan par gyur pa na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis mi tshugs shing zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po de dag nyid yang dang yang du bsgoms pa'i mthus brtan zhing mthu dang ldan par gyur pa na nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis mi tshugs shing zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir
translated: The five faculties such as faith are called powers when they become strong and powerful through the force of repeatedly cultivating them.

original: stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stobs rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called powers because they cannot be overwhelmed by their opposing factors, such as the afflictions.

original: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga po de dag bsgoms na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga po de dag bsgoms na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: When one cultivates the five faculties and five powers, one will possess the four roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight.

original: bzhi gang zhe na dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
translated: What are the four? They are the heat, peak, forbearance, and the supreme mundane state.

original: de la dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mor gyur pa'i tshe na dad pa la sogs pa la dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mor gyur pa'i tshe na dad pa la sogs pa la dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of heat and peak, the five such as faith are called the five faculties.

original: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i tshe ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i tshe ni stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of possessing forbearance and the supreme mundane state, they are called the five powers.

original: de la nges par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings de kho na nyid nges par rtogs shing bye brag phyed pas na nges par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings de kho na nyid nges par rtogs shing bye brag phyed pas na nges par 'byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “penetration” means that on the first bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva realizes and penetrates the reality of the ultimate dimension of phenomena, and so it is called “penetration.”

original: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga bsgoms te /🔽dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams dang ldan par gyur na nges par 'byed pa zhes bya ba sa dang po'i cha dang mthun zhing /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga bsgoms te / dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams dang ldan par gyur na nges par 'byed pa zhes bya ba sa dang po'i cha dang mthun zhing /
translated: He cultivates the five powers and the five strengths.

original: sa dang po 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa dang po 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: When he is endowed with heat, summit, forbearance, and the highest worldly realization, he is said to have the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetration, because they are conducive to the first stage and are the cause for attaining the first stage.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bzhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “roots of virtue conducive to penetration.”

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi yan lag bdun te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi yan lag bdun te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being, is as follows: the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub ces bya ba ni sa dang po la byang chub kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rtogs pa la bya'o //🔽dran pa la sogs pa chos bdun po 'di dag byang chub kyi rang bzhin de rtogs par bya ba'i grogs su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de la byang chub ces bya ba ni sa dang po la byang chub kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rtogs pa la bya'o // dran pa la sogs pa chos bdun po 'di dag byang chub kyi rang bzhin de rtogs par bya ba'i grogs su gyur pa'am /
translated: Here, enlightenment refers to the realization of the suchness of the dharmadhatu, the nature of enlightenment, on the first ground.🔽These seven factors beginning with mindfulness are called factors of enlightenment because they are the aids to realizing that nature of enlightenment,

original: rgyu'am yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu'am yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ste /
translated: or because they are its causes or branches.

original: de yang dran pa dang / chos rnam @198b par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: de yang dran pa dang / chos rnam @198b par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: The bases of supernormal power are the four bases of supernormal power.🔽The faculties are the five faculties.🔽The powers are the five powers.🔽The seven factors of enlightenment are mindfulness, the investigation of things, effort, joy, fitness, concentration, and equanimity.

original: de la dran pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po ma brjed cing sems gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po ma brjed cing sems gsal ba'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the object by the mind, and the clarity of the mind.

original: brtson 'grus ni chos kyi dbyings nyid rtogs par bya ba la sems spro zhing sgrim pa dang / lhod par ma gyur pa'o //🔽dga' ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa sngon ma mthong zhing nyams su ma myong ba /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni chos kyi dbyings nyid rtogs par bya ba la sems spro zhing sgrim pa dang / lhod par ma gyur pa'o // dga' ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa sngon ma mthong zhing nyams su ma myong ba /
translated: Effort is the mental exertion to realize the realm of the Dharma, and the mind's being neither slack nor excited.🔽Joy is the Dharma joy of one who has not previously seen or experienced the purity of the realm of the Dharma.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i tshe mthong zhing chos kyi dga' ba nyams su myong ba la bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i tshe mthong zhing chos kyi dga' ba nyams su myong ba la bya'o //
translated: It is the experience of Dharma joy at the time of attaining the first stage.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni de ltar chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni de ltar chos kyi dbyings rtogs shing /
translated: Fitness is the fitness of the body and mind that comes from the realization of the realm of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi dga' ba'i nyams su myong ba'i tshe lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs shing bsam gtan la las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba'i nyams su myong ba'i tshe lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs shing bsam gtan la las su rung ba'o //
translated: When one experiences the joy of the Dharma, one's body and mind are very pliable and one is fit for the trances.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni chos kyi dbyings su sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni chos kyi dbyings su sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind in the realm of Dharma.

original: btang snyoms ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non par chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa la sems lhun gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non par chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa la sems lhun gyis grub pa ste /
translated: Equanimity is the spontaneous mind in the realization of the realm of Dharma, not being overcome by adverse elements.

original: chos bdun po de dag chos kyi dbyings byang chub kyi rang bzhin de rtogs par bya ba'i yan lag yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos bdun po de dag chos kyi dbyings byang chub kyi rang bzhin de rtogs par bya ba'i yan lag yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: These seven dharmas are called the limbs of enlightenment because they are the true limbs for the realization of that enlightenment which is the realm of Dharma.

original: dben pa la gnas pa dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par spong bas yongs su grub pa ni /
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par spong bas yongs su grub pa ni /
translated: Abiding in seclusion, abiding in detachment, abiding in cessation, and being fulfilled by rejection,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: are as explained in the chapter on the bases of psychic power.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being, is as follows: the eightfold path of the noble ones, etc.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa yan chad 'phags pa rnams bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa phra mo rnams spang bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i sa thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'di brgyad bsgom ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa yan chad 'phags pa rnams bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa phra mo rnams spang bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i sa thob par bya ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'di brgyad bsgom ste /
translated: The eightfold path of the noble ones is taught to be the Great Vehicle, because the noble ones, the Stream-enterers and so on, and the Bodhisattvas who have attained the first stage and so on, cultivate these eight, such as right view, in order to abandon the subtle afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and in order to attain the stage of liberation.

original: 'di rnams bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa phra mo rnams spangs shing @199a * //
analyzed: 'di rnams bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa phra mo rnams spangs shing @199a * //
translated: By cultivating these, they abandon the subtle afflictions,

original: rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i rgyu'am /
translated: and attain the result of liberation.

original: lam yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “eightfold noble path” because it is the path.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni 'jig rten pa'i log par lta ba spangs nas /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni 'jig rten pa'i log par lta ba spangs nas /
translated: Among them, right view is the abandonment of worldly wrong views.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis chos kyi dbyings phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis chos kyi dbyings phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the vision of the realm of truth without error through the eye of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing gtan la 'bebs pa'o //
translated: Right thought is the realization and ascertainment of the realm of truth itself without error.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i rgyus brdzun du smra ba pa sogs pa log pa'i tshig rnams mi 'byung zhing chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i tshig gis gzhan la chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i rgyus brdzun du smra ba pa sogs pa log pa'i tshig rnams mi 'byung zhing chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba'i tshig gis gzhan la chos ston pa'o //
translated: Right speech is the teaching of the Dharma to others through speech that is not in contradiction with reality, because of the realization of the realm of truth, and the non-occurrence of wrong speech such as lying.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims la skyon med pas mi bya ba'i las rnams mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims la skyon med pas mi bya ba'i las rnams mi byed pa'o //
translated: Right action is the non-performance of actions that should not be done because of the absence of faults in morality.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes pa tsam sgyu la sogs pa log pas 'tsho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes pa tsam sgyu la sogs pa log pas 'tsho ba med pa'o //
translated: Right livelihood is simply having few desires and being content, and not having a wrong livelihood such as deceit.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang de'i gnyen po sgom pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang de'i gnyen po sgom pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: Right effort is the effort to abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation and to cultivate their antidotes.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang / rgod pa gnyis kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar dran pa ne bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang / rgod pa gnyis kyi dbang du mi 'gyur bar dran pa ne bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: Right mindfulness is the placement of mindfulness that is not under the control of the two secondary afflictions of laxity and excitation that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa de'i dbang gis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos kyi dbyings nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa de'i dbang gis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Right samadhi is the one pointed placement of the mind without discursive investigation on the dharmadhatu itself. Through its power one obtains qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: dben pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par spang bas yongs su grub pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dben pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par spang bas yongs su grub pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Abiding in solitude, abiding in freedom from attachment, abiding in cessation, and being perfected through thorough relinquishment are as above.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings is as follows: the three concentrations, and so on. This teaches that the three doors of liberation are the Great Vehicle.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la ting nge 'dzin gsum zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la ting nge 'dzin gsum zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The three doors of liberation are also called the three concentrations.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa @199b las grol zhing thar pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i sgor 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgoms na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa @199b las grol zhing thar pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i sgor 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: The three concentrations on emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are called doors of liberation because they are doors that lead to the nirvana that is characterized by liberation and freedom from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on emptiness?🔽When one realizes that all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, the mind abides in that. That is the door of liberation of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i tshe sems gnas pa de ni stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste zhes bya ba ni byis pa so so skye bo'i spyod yul du gyur pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i tshe sems gnas pa de ni stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste zhes bya ba ni byis pa so so skye bo'i spyod yul du gyur pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba
translated: This is the domain of ordinary beings, free from the imagined characteristic,

original: / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med cing stong pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs shing sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med cing stong pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs shing sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: and when one realizes and meditates on the nature of the perfected characteristic, which is inexpressible and empty,

original: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The one-pointed mind is called the concentration on emptiness.

original: de la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on signlessness?🔽When one realizes that all phenomena are signless, the mind abides in signlessness.🔽This is called the gate of liberation of signlessness.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rtogs pa'i tshe sems gnas pa de ni mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rtogs pa'i tshe sems gnas pa de ni mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin
translated: In this way, through the concentration on emptiness and so forth, one does not grasp at signs in imagined phenomena,

original: cing / rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa la mtshan med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cing / rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa la mtshan med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: and becomes free from discursive thought. This is called the concentration on signlessness.

original: de la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration on wishlessness?🔽When one realizes that all phenomena are non-arising,

original: chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba med do zhes mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba med do zhes mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshe /
translated: and does not engage in mental construction,

original: sems gnas pa de ni smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa dang / mtshan ma med par rtogs pas ci la yang ma chags shing mi smon te /🔽tshe phyi ma la khams gsum du skye zhing khams gsum gyi bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i las nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams mngon par 'du mi byed cing sems rtse gcig tu gnas par sgom pa la smon
analyzed: sems gnas pa de ni smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa dang / mtshan ma med par rtogs pas ci la yang ma chags shing mi smon te / tshe phyi ma la khams gsum du skye zhing khams gsum gyi bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i las nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams mngon par 'du mi byed cing sems rtse gcig tu gnas par sgom pa la smon
translated: Thus, by realizing that all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics and are signless, one is not attached to anything and does not wish for anything.🔽One does not form the karma and afflictions that are the causes for taking rebirth in the three realms in order to attain the happiness of the three realms in future lives.

original: pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental stability of not forming such karma and afflictions is called the concentration of wishlessness.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar ye shes bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ye shes bcu gcig theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar ye shes bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ye shes bcu gcig theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Mahāyāna of bodhisattva mahāsattvas is as follows: the eleven knowledges.

original: de la sdug bsngal shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba @200a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba @200a * //
translated: It is knowledge that suffering will not arise.

original: ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin can don dam par skye ba med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin can don dam par skye ba med par shes pa'o //
translated: It is knowledge that the five aggregates of clinging, which are by nature suffering, do not ultimately arise.🔽What is knowledge of the origin?🔽It is knowledge that the origin is abandoned.

original: de la kun 'byung ba shes pa gang zhe na kun 'byung ba spang bar shes ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po kun 'byung ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa rnams rang bzhin med par rtogs pas phyi mi 'byung bar shes pa nyid la kun
analyzed: de la kun 'byung ba shes pa gang zhe na kun 'byung ba spang bar shes ba'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po kun 'byung ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa rnams rang bzhin med par rtogs pas phyi mi 'byung bar shes pa nyid la kun
translated: It is knowledge that the suffering aggregates, which arise from the causes of action and affliction, will not arise again through the realization of their lack of inherent nature.

original: 'byung ba spang bar shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba spang bar shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called knowledge that the origin is abandoned.

original: de la 'gog pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'gog pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of cessation?🔽It is knowledge that suffering ceases.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i tshe 'khor pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad par gyur pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i tshe 'khor pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad par gyur pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is knowledge that at the time of attaining nirvana, all the suffering of cyclic existence is cut off.

original: de la lam shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lam shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of the path?

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa mthong ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa don dam par dngos po med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa mthong ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa don dam par dngos po med par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the eightfold noble path is the knowledge that the eightfold noble path, which is the cause of seeing cessation, is ultimately non-existent.

original: kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu dang lam yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu dang lam yin par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that it is conventionally the cause and path for attaining nirvana.

original: de la zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zad pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of extinction?🔽 It is the knowledge that desire, hatred, and ignorance are extinguished.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zad par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dgra bcom pa'i sa dang byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad 'thob pa yan chad kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zad par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zad par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dgra bcom pa'i sa dang byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad 'thob pa yan chad kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zad par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that desire and so forth are extinguished by the stage of the Arhat of the Sravakas and by the Bodhisattva from the eighth stage on.

original: de la mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi skye ba shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of non-production?

original: srid pa'i rgyud skye ba med par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad la gnas pa de dag nyid de ltar nyon mongs pa zad par gyur pas phyis nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis srid pa phyi ma mi len par shes pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyud skye ba med par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa yan chad la gnas pa de dag nyid de ltar nyon mongs pa zad par gyur pas phyis nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis srid pa phyi ma mi len par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that the continuum of existence is unborn refers to the noble arhats and bodhisattvas who abide on the eighth stage and above. It is the knowledge that, since their defilements have been extinguished in that way, they will not take up a subsequent existence under the influence of defilement.

original: de la chos shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of dharmas?

original: phung po lnga sgyu mar yongs su rtogs shing shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa'i tshe phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las snang ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin🔽no zhes mngon sum du rtogs shing shes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga sgyu mar yongs su rtogs shing shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa'i tshe phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las snang ba ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin🔽no zhes mngon sum du rtogs shing shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that the five aggregates are illusory refers to the direct realization of liberation. At that time, one directly realizes and knows that the dharmas such as the five aggregates appear as if they truly exist, but are like illusions and so forth.

original: de la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba @200b nas rga shi mi rtag ces bya bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rjes su rtogs pa shes pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba @200b nas rga shi mi rtag ces bya bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rjes su rtogs pa shes pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage explains subsequent knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bcu gnyis rnams mi rtog par shes pa la rjes su rtogs pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bcu gnyis rnams mi rtog par shes pa la rjes su rtogs pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is knowledge that the twelve media such as the eye, the eighteen elements, the six elements such as the earth element, and the twelve members of dependent origination such as ignorance are impermanent.

original: de la kun rdzob tu shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional knowledge?🔽It is knowledge of the minds of other sentient beings.

original: sems can gzhan gyi sems kyis shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan yang kun rdzob tu shes pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi sems kyis shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan yang kun rdzob tu shes pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Other knowledges are also conventional knowledge.

original: don dam par dmigs su med par yang shes par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: don dam par dmigs su med par yang shes par 'gyur bas /
translated: But they are also known to be ultimately unobservable.

original: so so'i dmigs pa'i yul gang yin pa las sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming gzhan du btags so //🔽gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni sems can pha rol po ci sems pa la dmigs nas 'dod chags dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: so so'i dmigs pa'i yul gang yin pa las sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming gzhan du btags so // gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni sems can pha rol po ci sems pa la dmigs nas 'dod chags dang ldan pa'am /
translated: The name of each is derived from its object, such as knowledge of suffering, and so on.

original: mi ldan pa la sogs pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi ldan pa la sogs pa shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds focuses on the minds of other sentient beings and knows whether they are associated with attachment or not.

original: gcig kho nar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la dmigs pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig kho nar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin la dmigs pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called conventional knowledge because it focuses on the imagined nature alone.

original: de la 'dris pa shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dris pa shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of familiarity?🔽It is knowledge of the path and knowledge of purification.

original: gang gis lam shes pa dang / yongs su byang ba shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i lam sgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gis lam shes pa dang / yongs su byang ba shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i lam sgom pa dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattvas cultivate the noble path and cultivate concentration, meditative stabilization and so on,

original: nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ni mi sgom gyi sems can gyi don du chos rnams la 'dris shing yongs su byang bar bya ba'i phyir sgom zhing sbyor ba la 'dris pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos ltar mya ngan las 'da' ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ni mi sgom gyi sems can gyi don du chos rnams la 'dris shing yongs su byang bar bya ba'i phyir sgom zhing sbyor ba la 'dris pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He does not meditate in order to realize nirvana like the Sravakas, but he meditates and applies himself in order to purify and become familiar with phenomena for the sake of sentient beings. This is called the knowledge of familiarity with application.

original: sgra ji bzhin shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of the literal?🔽It is the Tathagata's knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad kyi skad rnam pa sna tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa la sgra ji bzhin shes pa
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis sems can thams cad kyi skad rnam pa sna tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa la sgra ji bzhin shes pa
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of the various languages of all sentient beings just as they are. This is called the knowledge of the literal.

original: zhes bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar dbang po @201a * //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar dbang po @201a * //
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Mahayana of the Bodhisattva, the great being, is as follows:🔽The three faculties

original: gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang po gsum theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang po gsum theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: and so on. This teaches that the three faculties are the Mahayana.

original: de la yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of complete knowledge in the statement, “One should completely know what has not been completely known?”

original: slob ma'i gang zag mngon par rtogs par ma gyur pa rnams kyi dad pa'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos rgyun du 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams la slob ma'i gang zag ces bya ste /
analyzed: slob ma'i gang zag mngon par rtogs par ma gyur pa rnams kyi dad pa'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos rgyun du 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams la slob ma'i gang zag ces bya ste /
translated: Those who are learners but have not attained manifest realization are called “persons who are learners.”

original: gang zag de rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / sa dang po ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir slob cing rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / sa dang po'i chos nyid dang / yon tan sngon mi shes pa las shes shing mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sgom zhing sbyong ba na dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams la yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / sa dang po ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir slob cing rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / sa dang po'i chos nyid dang / yon tan sngon mi shes pa las shes shing mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir sgom zhing sbyong ba na dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams la yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: When those persons are training in order to attain the fruit of stream-entry that they have not attained, and when they are cultivating and refining the five faculties of faith, etc., in order to know and actualize the reality and qualities of the first stage that they have not previously known, they are called faculties in the sense of “I will fully know what has not been fully known.”

original: yongs su snang bar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa dang po la 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yongs su snang bar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa dang po la 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: “What has not fully appeared” means that when one enters the first stage from the stage of action in faith,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dmigs shing snang bar mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dmigs shing snang bar mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: one should understand it to mean that the imagined phenomena of grasped and grasper, etc., are not perceived and do not appear.

original: de la yongs su shes pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of full knowing?

original: gang zag slob pa yongs su shes par gyur pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yan chad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa yan chad dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: gang zag slob pa yongs su shes par gyur pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yan chad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa yan chad dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: those who train and cultivate in order to attain the result of arhat and

original: sangs rgyas kyis thob par bya ba'i phyir sgom zhing sbyong bas na gang zag de dag la yang slob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis thob par bya ba'i phyir sgom zhing sbyong bas na gang zag de dag la yang slob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: those who attain buddhahood.

original: yongs su shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i sa thob cing chos kyi dbyings shes par bya bas dang po yan chad rtogs par gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i sa thob cing chos kyi dbyings shes par bya bas dang po yan chad rtogs par gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: Those who have complete knowledge refers to those who have attained the ārya levels and realized the first level and so on through knowing the dharmadhātu.

original: de dag gi sa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga la yongs su shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga la yongs su shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The five faculties such as faith on their level are called the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: de la yongs su shes pas rtogs pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su shes pas rtogs pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of complete knowledge?

original: gang zag mi slob pa dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba @201b la sogs pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i chos dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mkhyen cing mthar phyin pas de yan chad bslab mi dgos pa'i phyir mi slob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag mi slob pa dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba @201b la sogs pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i chos dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mkhyen cing mthar phyin pas de yan chad bslab mi dgos pa'i phyir mi slob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The five faculties of faith and so on of nonlearners such as arhats, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas and tathagatas are called the faculty of complete knowledge parijnaindriya because they fully comprehend and perfect all phenomena and qualities to be known and obtained by arya sravakas who are arhats, pratyekabuddhas,🔽bodhisattvas on the tenth level and tathagatas.

original: de dag gi dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga la yongs su shes par rtogs pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga la yongs su shes par rtogs pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called nonlearners because they have no need to train beyond that.

original: 'phags pa de dag la slob pa dang ; mi slob pa'i gang zag ces bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams kyis gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag cing byang ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag la slob pa dang ; mi slob pa'i gang zag ces bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams kyis gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag cing byang ste /
translated: The learner and non-learner persons are so called because they are persons who, by means of virtuous qualities such as the accumulations of merit and wisdom, have eliminated and purified the afflictions such as attachment and non-virtuous qualities.

original: med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: They are called persons because they have become free from them.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni ting nge 'dzin gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni ting nge 'dzin gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Mahayana of the bodhisattva, the great being, is the three samadhis. The four dhyanas of the form realm, the four formless absorptions of the formless realm,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sems kyi rgyu ba rags pa dang / 'bring dang phra mo'i khyad par las ting nge 'dzin gsum du btags te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams sems kyi rgyu ba rags pa dang / 'bring dang phra mo'i khyad par las ting nge 'dzin gsum du btags te /
translated: and the absorption of cessation are designated as the three samadhis based on the distinctions of coarse, medium, and subtle movements of the mind.

original: de la rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi that is accompanied by conceptualization and accompanied by investigation?

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pas dben sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pas dben sdig to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa /
translated: Subhuti, here the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, separated from desire, separated from evil and unwholesome dharmas,

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with conceptualization and with investigation,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /🔽'di ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te / 'di ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe /
translated: having attained the joy and bliss born of separation, abides in the first concentration.🔽This is called the samadhi that is accompanied by conceptualization and accompanied by investigation.

original: sems kyi rtog pa dang rgyu ba rags par 'byung ba'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rtog pa dang rgyu ba rags par 'byung ba'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is equipoised in the first concentration, it is called accompanied by conceptualization and accompanied by investigation because the conceptualization and movement of the mind occur in a gross manner.

original: 'dod pas dben pa dang sdig @202a * //
analyzed: 'dod pas dben pa dang sdig @202a * //
translated: Separated from desire, separated from evil and unwholesome dharmas,

original: to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa dang / dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: to mi dge ba'i chos kyis dben pa dang / dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The first absorption is called “the pleasant abode that is free from the evil, unwholesome states and is accompanied by investigation and sustained thought.”

original: de la rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar te zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po las 'das nas /
analyzed: de la rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar te zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po las 'das nas /
translated: What is the concentration that is free from initial thought but possesses sustained thought?🔽It is the concentration that is attained by passing completely beyond the first absorption and

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la 'jug pa'i bar la bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la 'jug pa'i bar la bya ste /
translated: not yet having attained the second absorption.

original: bsam gtan de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bsam gtan de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe /
translated: When one is absorbed in this concentration,

original: sems kyi rtog pa rags pa ni spangs /
analyzed: sems kyi rtog pa rags pa ni spangs /
translated: coarse initial thought is abandoned.

original: rtog pa phra mo dpyod pa tsam zhig yod pa la rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa phra mo dpyod pa tsam zhig yod pa la rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The mere presence of subtle initial thought is called “the concentration that is free from initial thought but possesses sustained thought.”

original: de la rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration that is free from initial thought and sustained thought?

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa man chad la rtog pa dang dpyod pa med cing sems kyi rgyu ba phra bar 'dra bas rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa man chad la rtog pa dang dpyod pa med cing sems kyi rgyu ba phra bar 'dra bas rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge
