translated: The second absorption and so on refers to the second absorption and so on up to the meditative attainment of cessation because they are similar in being samādhis devoid of investigation and analysis since they are similar in being subtle movement of the mind.🔽

original: 'dzin gcig tu bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dzin gcig tu bsdus so //
translated: The second meditative concentration and so on refers to the meditative concentration of the second meditative concentration and above, up to and including the meditative attainment of cessation. Since they are similar in being without investigation and analysis and in having subtle mental activity, they are combined into a single meditative stabilization that is without investigation and analysis.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams 'jig rten pa'i yin du zin gyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na theg pa chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams 'jig rten pa'i yin du zin gyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na theg pa chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though the meditative concentrations and meditative stabilizations of the form and formless realms are mundane, if bodhisattvas cultivate them by means of the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena and by means of the mode of nonapprehending, they become the Great Vehicle. Therefore, the three meditative stabilizations are called the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar rjes su dran pa bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su dran pa bcu theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar rjes su dran pa bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su dran pa bcu theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the ten recollections of the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva are the Great Vehicle.

original: de la sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i tshul du rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i tshul du rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The recollection of the Buddha is the recollection of the Buddha in terms of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de la kun rdzob tu rjes su dran pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa dang rig pa dang zhabs su ldan zhing skyes bu 'dul ba dang / kha lo sgyur ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rjes su dran par byas nas de la dad cing gus pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu rjes su dran pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa dang rig pa dang zhabs su ldan zhing skyes bu 'dul ba dang / kha lo sgyur ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rjes su dran par byas nas de la dad cing gus pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The conventional recollection is the recollection of the qualities of the Buddha, such as the enjoyment body and the emanation body, which are adorned with the major and minor marks, and the qualities of the Buddha, such as knowledge, conduct, and the ability to guide and transform beings.

original: @202b don dam par rjes su dran pa ni chos kyi sku rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la bsam gtan du byed cing sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @202b don dam par rjes su dran pa ni chos kyi sku rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la bsam gtan du byed cing sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
translated: Ultimate recollection is to meditate on the dharmakāya, the nonconceptual expanse, and to abide with a one-pointed mind.

original: chos rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni chos la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni chos la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The recollection of the Dharma is twofold:

original: lung gi chos dang / thob par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: lung gi chos dang / thob par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma of transmission and the Dharma of realization.

original: de la lung gi chos ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i mdo sde gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya ste /🔽de dag gi yon tan dang / don rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: de la lung gi chos ni zhal nas gsungs pa'i mdo sde gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya ste / de dag gi yon tan dang / don rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of transmission refers to the twelve branches of the scriptures, the sūtras and so forth, which were spoken by the Buddha.

original: thob par bya ba'i chos ni /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i chos ni /
translated: The recollection of the Dharma is to recollect the qualities and meaning of these scriptures.🔽The Dharma of realization refers to the four results of stream enterer and so forth, the ten bhūmis, the four fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / sa bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa las 'phags pa'i yon tan rnams thos par bya ba'i phyir de dag gi don dang yon tan rjes su dran zhing goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / sa bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa las 'phags pa'i yon tan rnams thos par bya ba'i phyir de dag gi don dang yon tan rjes su dran zhing goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the Dharma is to recollect and familiarize oneself with the meaning and qualities of these realizations in order to hear about them.

original: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The recollection of the Saṅgha is threefold:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / so so'i skye bo'i dge 'dun te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / so so'i skye bo'i dge 'dun te /
translated: the Sangha of Bodhisattvas, the Sangha of noble Listeners such as Stream-enterers, and the Sangha of ordinary beings.

original: dge 'dun de dag bsod nams kyi zhing yin pa dang / sbyin gnas yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la legs par zhugs pa yin pa dang / tshogs shing 'dus pa'i nang na mchog yin par yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun de dag bsod nams kyi zhing yin pa dang / sbyin gnas yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la legs par zhugs pa yin pa dang / tshogs shing 'dus pa'i nang na mchog yin par yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: These are the Sangha, which is a field of merit, a worthy recipient of gifts, and which has entered well into the teaching of the Tathagata.

original: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The recollection of morality. Morality is threefold:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring wholesome factors, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: The morality of restraint is to abstain from the unwholesome factors such as killing.

original: dge ba'i chos la sogs pa'i tshul khrims ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la sogs pa'i tshul khrims ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The morality of virtuous qualities and so on is to engage in listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting on it, and meditating on it.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ni sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams smin par byed pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba rnams grol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ni sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams smin par byed pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba rnams grol bar byed pa ste /
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of living beings is to bring to maturity those living beings who are not yet mature and to liberate those who are already mature.

original: de lta bu'i tshul khrims ni mtho ris dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba 'thob pa'i rgyu yin par yon tan du lta zhing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul khrims ni mtho ris dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba 'thob pa'i rgyu yin par yon tan du lta zhing /
translated: One should view such morality as a virtue that is the cause for attaining heaven and nirvana.

original: rjes su dran par byed pa'o//
analyzed: rjes su dran par byed pa'o//
translated: One should recollect it.

original: @203a * // gtong ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni gtong ba la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: @203a * // gtong ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni gtong ba la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The recollection of giving is as follows: Giving is of three kinds:

original: zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: giving material things, giving freedom from fear, and giving the Dharma.

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa byas na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin par yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran par byed pa la gtong ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa byas na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin par yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran par byed pa la gtong ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one gives in that way, it is the cause for obtaining the perfect enjoyment of the mundane and supramundane. To view it as a good quality and to recollect it is called “recollection of giving.”

original: lha rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams sngon las bzang po spyod spyod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa dang / lha de dag dang mthun par spyad cing mnyes par byas na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin par yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: lha rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams sngon las bzang po spyod spyod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa dang / lha de dag dang mthun par spyad cing mnyes par byas na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin par yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: “Recollection of the gods” is to view it as a good quality and to recollect that the mundane and supramundane gods are the result of previously engaging in good actions and that if one engages in conduct in accordance with those gods and pleases them, it is the cause for obtaining the mundane and supramundane siddhis.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la sems mi g-yeng zhing las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dran par bya ba la yon tan du lta ba ste
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la sems mi g-yeng zhing las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dran par bya ba la yon tan du lta ba ste
translated: Mindfulness of the in-and-out breath is the view of the virtues in the mindfulness of the in-and-out breath in order to make the mind serviceable and undistracted in the cultivation of meditation and concentration.

original: / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The in-and-out breath is as explained above.

original: skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la ma chags shing skyo bar bya ba la yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la ma chags shing skyo bar bya ba la yon tan du lta zhing rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness of disenchantment is the view of the virtues in the mindfulness of disenchantment and non-attachment to cyclic existence.

original: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni lus mi rtag par sems shing /
analyzed: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni lus mi rtag par sems shing /
translated: Mindfulness of death is the mindfulness of the impermanence of the body.

original: lus dang longs spyod la ma chags par bya ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod la ma chags par bya ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: It is the mindfulness of non-attachment to the body and possessions.

original: lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mgo nas rting gi bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar sems kyang lus la ma chags par byed pa rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mgo nas rting gi bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar sems kyang lus la ma chags par byed pa rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the body is the recollection of the fact that, from head to foot, the body is full of various impurities, and that one should not be attached to the body.

original: rjes su dran pa 'di rnams theg pa chung ngu pa yang sgom mod kyi /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa 'di rnams theg pa chung ngu pa yang sgom mod kyi /
translated: Although the practitioners of the Lesser Vehicle also cultivate these recollections,

original: byang chub sems dpas don dam par mi dmigs par thugs su chud par byas nas kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas don dam par mi dmigs par thugs su chud par byas nas kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba /
translated: the bodhisattva, having understood them as not being perceived ultimately, cultivates them conventionally in order to mature beings

original: sems la dbang du gyur par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms na theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems la dbang du gyur par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms na theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: and to gain mastery over thought. This is called the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is as follows:

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / @203b gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / @203b gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The four meditative concentrations, the four formless meditative attainments, the eight liberations, and the nine serial meditative attainments are taught to be the Great Vehicle.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / yon tan ni go cha chen po bgos pa'i skabs su sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / yon tan ni go cha chen po bgos pa'i skabs su sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics and qualities of the four meditative concentrations, the four formless meditative attainments, and the four immeasurables have already been explained in the section on donning the great armor.

original: de la rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight liberations?🔽The first liberation is the perception of material form while having the notion of material form.

original: gzugs can gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di rnam par thar pa dang po'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa bdag gi lus kyi kha dog la sogs pa la chags pa spang ba'i gnyen por bdag gi lus la klad pa'i rgyas nas rting ba'i bar du mi gtsang
analyzed: gzugs can gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di rnam par thar pa dang po'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa bdag gi lus kyi kha dog la sogs pa la chags pa spang ba'i gnyen por bdag gi lus la klad pa'i rgyas nas rting ba'i bar du mi gtsang
translated: This is the antidote for the attachment of a meditator to the color, etc. of his own body. It is the perception of the body from the top of the head to the soles of the feet as being filled with all kinds of impurities.

original: ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba'i gzugs can du lta zhing bsam gtan byed pa la gzugs can zhes bya'o //🔽gzugs rnams mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar nang gi gzugs la mi gtsang bar lta ba'i ting nge 'dzin grub pa'i 'og tu phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa la sogs par lta zhing mi sdug pa sgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin grub pa la gzugs rnams mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba sna tshogs kyis gang ba'i gzugs can du lta zhing bsam gtan byed pa la gzugs can zhes bya'o // gzugs rnams mthong ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar nang gi gzugs la mi gtsang bar lta ba'i ting nge 'dzin grub pa'i 'og tu phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la rnam par bam pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa la sogs par lta zhing mi sdug pa sgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin grub pa la gzugs rnams mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration that is called having form is the concentration that is practiced by one who sees and considers the body as filled with various kinds of filth.🔽The concentration that is called seeing forms is the concentration that is practiced by one who, after achieving the concentration of viewing the internal body as impure, views external forms as putrid, livid, etc., and achieves the concentration of cultivating the idea of foulness.🔽The second liberation is the concentration that is practiced by one who, having the idea of the internal body as formless, sees external forms.

original: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa la la bdag gi lus la mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar 'du shes pa'i bsam gtan mi
analyzed: nang gzugs med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa la la bdag gi lus la mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar 'du shes pa'i bsam gtan mi
translated: The concentration that is called having the idea of the internal body as formless is the concentration that is practiced by one who, after achieving the concentration of viewing the internal body as impure, views the internal body as formless.

original: byed par phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la rnam par dam pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa la sogs par 'du shes shing bsam gtan sgom pa'o //
analyzed: byed par phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la rnam par dam pa dang / rnam par bsngos pa la sogs par 'du shes shing bsam gtan sgom pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The eighth is the concentration of cessation.🔽The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: bzang bar mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa la phyi nang gi gzugs mi sdug par sgom bsgoms pas sems sba gong zhing zhum par gyur pa sems rtsa gso zhing gzings bstod pa'i phyir gzugs bzang po la dmigs
analyzed: bzang bar mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa la phyi nang gi gzugs mi sdug par sgom bsgoms pas sems sba gong zhing zhum par gyur pa sems rtsa gso zhing gzings bstod pa'i phyir gzugs bzang po la dmigs
translated: The third is the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.🔽The fourth is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The fifth is the concentration of cessation.🔽The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽The third is the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.🔽The fourth is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The fifth is the concentration of cessation.🔽The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽The third is the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.🔽The fourth is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The fifth is the concentration of cessation.🔽The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽The third is the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.

original: pa'am mi sdug pa bsgom bsgoms pa las gzugs bzang po la mos shing bltas nas kha dog la sogs pa la chags shing sems gzhan du 'gyur ram mi 'gyur sad @204a * //
analyzed: pa'am mi sdug pa bsgom bsgoms pa las gzugs bzang po la mos shing bltas nas kha dog la sogs pa la chags shing sems gzhan du 'gyur ram mi 'gyur sad @204a * //
translated: The fourth is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The fifth is the concentration of cessation.🔽The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽The third is the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.🔽The fourth is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The fifth is the concentration of cessation.

original: pa'i phyir kha dog bzang po la sogs pa la lta zhing bsam gtan sgom pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir kha dog bzang po la sogs pa la lta zhing bsam gtan sgom pa'o //
translated: The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽The third is the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.🔽The fourth is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The fifth is the concentration of cessation.🔽The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness.🔽The third is the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The fourth is the concentration of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The fifth is the concentration of cessation.🔽The first is the concentration of the sphere of infinite space.🔽The second is the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bya ste /
translated: Cessation of discernment and feeling is the meditative attainment of cessation.🔽Noble listeners and solitary realizers enter this meditative attainment in order to abide in the bliss of nirvana that is accompanied by the remainder of the aggregates.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa rnams phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'byung bar bkag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa rnams phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'du shes dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'byung bar bkag ste /
translated: It is a state in which the conceptual processes of discernment and feeling, and so on, are blocked and do not occur.

original: lus dang sems mnyam par 'jog pa la bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems mnyam par 'jog pa la bya ste /
translated: It is a state in which the body and mind are evenly composed.

original: de ltar rnam par thar pa dang po gsum dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / brgyad po 'di rnams bsgoms na mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par thar pa'i rang bzhin 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par thar pa dang po gsum dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / brgyad po 'di rnams bsgoms na mya ngan las 'das pa rnam par thar pa'i rang bzhin 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These eight—the first three liberations, the four meditative attainments of the formless realm, and the meditative attainment of cessation—are called “liberations” because they are the causes for attaining the nature of liberation, which is nirvana.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni dmigs pa dang bcas par bsgom /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni dmigs pa dang bcas par bsgom /
translated: These eight liberations are cultivated with reference to an objective support by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽But when the bodhisattvas cultivate them without reference to an objective support, they become the cause for the attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpas de dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: de la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par byas shing sgom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par byas shing sgom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, “having attained and abided” means “having completed and cultivated.”

original: de la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here, what are the nine serial absorptions?🔽Up to: these are the nine serial absorptions.

original: de dag gi mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the nine serial absorptions are the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems sbyang ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mthar gyis gnas shing rim gyis bsgom pa la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems sbyang ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mthar gyis gnas shing rim gyis bsgom pa la mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ste /
translated: The nine serial absorptions are called the four concentrations, the four formless absorptions and the absorption of cessation, which the bodhisattva practices in order to train the mind.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid dang @204b theg pa chen po'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid dang @204b theg pa chen po'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Their characteristics and the meaning of the Great Vehicle are as before.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings is as follows: the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and so on. This teaches that the ten powers of the tathāgatas are the Great Vehicle.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la yang gnas dang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni las dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas yin no
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la yang gnas dang gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni las dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas yin no
translated: The result of practicing virtue is the experience of happiness, which is possible.

original: // las dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: // las dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: The result of practicing virtue is the experience of suffering, which is impossible.

original: las mi dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: las mi dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: The result of practicing nonvirtue is the experience of suffering, which is possible.🔽The result of practicing nonvirtue is the experience of happiness, which is impossible.

original: las mi dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa las legs nyes kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun zhing rigs pa dang mi mthun zhing mi rigs pa rnam pa thams
analyzed: las mi dge ba spyad pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa las legs nyes kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun zhing rigs pa dang mi mthun zhing mi rigs pa rnam pa thams
translated: And so on. He knows correctly and just as it is the concordance and nonconcordance of the cause and result of good and bad actions, what is logical and illogical, and all the aspects of the cause and result of actions.

original: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pas phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //🔽'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i las dang / las yongs su len pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas pa dang / rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang /
analyzed: cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pas phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i las dang / las yongs su len pa'i rnam par smin pa gnas pa dang / rgyu'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang /
translated: The knowledge of the unerring, unobstructed gnosis of omniscience is called the power of knowledge of what is and is not the case.🔽“The knowledge of the past, future, and present karma and the ripening of the karma that is taken up, and the causes, just as they are” means that the Buddha knows what good and bad karma sentient beings have previously done, what they are doing now, and what they will do in the future, through their body, speech, and mind.

original: yid kyi sgo nas las legs nyes sngon ci byas pa dang / da ltar ci byed pa dang / phyis ci byed par 'gyur ba rnams kyang mkhyen cing las de dag gi rnam par smin pa cir 'gyur ba yang phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa la /
analyzed: yid kyi sgo nas las legs nyes sngon ci byas pa dang / da ltar ci byed pa dang / phyis ci byed par 'gyur ba rnams kyang mkhyen cing las de dag gi rnam par smin pa cir 'gyur ba yang phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa la /
translated: He also knows unerringly the ripening of those karmas.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the power of knowledge of karma and its ripening.

original: las yongs su len pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus na bde la /
analyzed: las yongs su len pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus na bde la /
translated: “The karma that is taken up” means that which is pleasant in the present time.

original: phyis sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba len pa'am /
analyzed: phyis sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba len pa'am /
translated: It is the knowledge of the karma that will be experienced later,

original: da ltar gyi dus na mi de la phyis bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba len pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o//
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na mi de la phyis bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba len pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o//
translated: or the knowledge of the karma that will be experienced as pleasure later by the person who is experiencing pain now.

original: @205a * // gnas kyi rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi las sa phyogs dang / yul gang du byas pa dang / sa phyogs dang yul gang du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba la gnas kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //🔽rgyu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'i rgyu dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i sems sam /
analyzed: @205a * // gnas kyi rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi las sa phyogs dang / yul gang du byas pa dang / sa phyogs dang yul gang du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba la gnas kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o // rgyu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'i rgyu dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i sems sam /
translated: The aspect of the basis is the place and the region where sentient beings have created karma, and the place and the region where it will be experienced.🔽The aspect of the cause is the mind that is accompanied by the roots of virtue, or the mind that is accompanied by the roots of nonvirtue, which is the cause of the action.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i sems la rgyu'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i sems la rgyu'i rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspect of the cause is called the aspect of the cause.🔽The aspect of the world is the knowledge of the world, the knowledge of the world in its variety, and the knowledge of the world in its multiplicity.🔽The world is of three kinds:🔽the world of sentient beings,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs can te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs can te /
translated: the world of the environment,🔽and the world of the container.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams du ma pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mi rtag pa la gnas shing brten pa'i phyir sems can la 'jig rten zhes bya'o //🔽khams zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams du ma pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mi rtag pa la gnas shing brten pa'i phyir sems can la 'jig rten zhes bya'o // khams zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'am /
translated: The world is manifold means that the world is manifold in terms of the various realms of sentient beings.

original: rang bzhin la bya ste sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin la bya ste sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'am /
translated: Realm means the various dispositions or natures of sentient beings.🔽The various dispositions or natures of sentient beings are manifold and inconceivable, unknown to the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: rang bzhin rnam pa mang po sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas mi mkhyen pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i bsam pa dang / pag la nyal ba ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par mkhyen nas de dang mthun par chos ston pa mdzad pa la khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa mang po sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas mi mkhyen pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i bsam pa dang / pag la nyal ba ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par mkhyen nas de dang mthun par chos ston pa mdzad pa la khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The tathāgatas, knowing them as they are, without error, teach the Dharma in accordance with them. This is called the power of knowing the various realms.

original: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi mos pa sna tshogs pa dang / mos pa du ma yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi dad pa dang mos pa rab dang / 'bring dang /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi mos pa sna tshogs pa dang / mos pa du ma yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi dad pa dang mos pa rab dang / 'bring dang /
translated: He knows perfectly the various and multiple aspirations of other sentient beings and other persons.

original: tha ma tha dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par mkhyen nas de dang mthun par chos ston pa mdzad pa la mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma tha dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par mkhyen nas de dang mthun par chos ston pa mdzad pa la mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the strength of knowing various aspirations.

original: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi dbang po rab dang / tha ma shes par bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi dbang po rno rtul rab 'bring gsum dang / dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga rnams kyi shas che chung phyi ma log par mkhyen nas de dang rjes su mthun par chos ston pa mdzad pa ni dbang po rab dang tha ma mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan gyi dbang po rab dang / tha ma shes par bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi dbang po rno rtul rab 'bring gsum dang / dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga rnams kyi shas che chung phyi ma log par mkhyen nas de dang rjes su mthun par chos ston pa mdzad pa ni dbang po rab dang tha ma mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the power of knowing higher and lower faculties.🔽He knows perfectly the paths that lead to all destinations.

original: @205b kun du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rigs yang dag par nges pa dang / log par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang ldan pa las so so'i rigs dang mthun par lam la 'jug cing 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba la kun tu 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: @205b kun du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rigs yang dag par nges pa dang / log par nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang ldan pa las so so'i rigs dang mthun par lam la 'jug cing 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba la kun tu 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the power of knowing the paths that lead to all destinations.

original: de la yang dag par nges pa ni 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par nges pa ni 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The first is the family of those who enter the noble path.

original: log par nges pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lta ba la 'jug pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: log par nges pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lta ba la 'jug pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The second is the family of those who enter the mundane view.

original: ma nges pa ni gcig tu chad pa med de /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni gcig tu chad pa med de /
translated: The third is not fixed,

original: gar yang drang du rung ba ste /
analyzed: gar yang drang du rung ba ste /
translated: because it can be led in any direction.

original: de la bu phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa la kun du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bu phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa la kun du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the first is called the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere.🔽The power of knowledge of various dhātus,🔽the power of knowledge of various resolutions,🔽the power of knowledge of various practices,

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par dgod pa dang /

translated: the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties,🔽the power of knowledge of the path that leads everywhere,🔽the power of knowledge of recollection of former existences,🔽the power of knowledge of death and rebirth,🔽and the power of knowledge of the termination of the contaminations.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /

original: bsam tan dang po la sogs pa bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs can gyi gzugs rnams mthong ba la sogs pa rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gsum dang /

original: gzungs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / yon tan shes pa dang / de dag gi nyon mongs pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas bsam gtan la sogs pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu 'khor ba'i longs spyod thob par bsngo ba dang /
