translated: The

original: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag kyang mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: With the pure divine eye that surpasses the human, he sees sentient beings dying and being born.🔽Through that cause and that condition, after the body disintegrates, he is born in a happy realm, among the gods.🔽He knows this.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi lha'i nang du skye'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi lha'i nang du skye'o zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the power of knowing the passing away and rebirth of beings.

original: rang log tu zad do //
analyzed: rang log tu zad do //
translated: The rest is self-evident.🔽For the sake of exhausting the defilements, he practices with his mind liberated, with his wisdom liberated, and without defilements, actualizing and manifesting the superknowledges.

original: zag pa rnams zad pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du bya ste nye bar bsgrubs shing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du bya ste nye bar bsgrubs shing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: zag pa zad pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa rang gis mngon par shes pas mngon du bya ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa rang gis mngon par shes pas mngon du bya ste /
translated: Because of the extinction of the contaminants, he dwells having attained the liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom which is uncontaminated, and he dwells having realized it by himself with direct knowledge.

original: nye bar bsgrubs shing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i zag pa rnams spangs pas sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob par byas nas gnas so
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs shing rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i zag pa rnams spangs pas sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob par byas nas gnas so
translated: Having attained the sphere of nirvana which is characterized by the liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom and is uncontaminated by the contaminants of the defilements such as passion, he dwells.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rjes las byung ba'i ye shes kyis phyin chad 'khor bar mi skye bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rjes las byung ba'i ye shes kyis phyin chad 'khor bar mi skye bar shes pa'o //
translated: My births have been exhausted means that, by the knowledge that arises after attaining nirvana with remainder, he knows that he will not be reborn in samsara again.

original: bdag gis tshangs par spyod pa @206b ni spyad do zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu tshul khrims bsrungs pa la sogs pa mthar phyin par bsrungs zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gis tshangs par spyod pa @206b ni spyad do zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu tshul khrims bsrungs pa la sogs pa mthar phyin par bsrungs zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: I have practiced pure conduct” means that I have practiced morality and so on, which are the causes for attaining nirvana, to the point of perfection.

original: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa la sogs pa don du sgrub pa rnams bsgrubs zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa la sogs pa don du sgrub pa rnams bsgrubs zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ I have done what is to be done” means that I have accomplished the aims to be accomplished, such as the accumulation of the collections of merit and wisdom.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu gzhan ni med do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni phung po 'di lta bu phyis len par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rjes su dpag pa las byung ba'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu gzhan ni med do zhes bya bar rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni phung po 'di lta bu phyis len par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rjes su dpag pa las byung ba'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa la bya ste /
translated: “ I know that there is no other state beyond this” means that I know through the wisdom that arises from inference that such a type of aggregate will not be taken up again.

original: mkhyen pa 'di rnams la stobs zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / bdud kyi stobs thams cad rab tu zil gyis gnon pa dang / bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa 'di rnams la stobs zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / bdud kyi stobs thams cad rab tu zil gyis gnon pa dang / bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: As for the knowledge of these being called powers, it is because they are endowed with the perfect power for all the activities that benefit sentient beings in every way, and because they completely overpower all the powers of Mara, and are not overpowered by adverse factors such as Mara, opponents, and so on.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar mi 'jigs pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is as follows: the four forms of fearlessness, and so on. This teaches that the four forms of fearlessness are the Great Vehicle.

original: de la bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la bdag gis yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here, it says, “If I were to claim, ‘I have fully awakened to perfect buddhahood,’ and so on, up to

original: chos dang ldan par sus kyang bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: chos dang ldan par sus kyang bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste ;
translated: This passage teaches fearlessness with regard to perfect enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag dang chos la bdag med par thug su chud nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gang zag dang chos la bdag med par thug su chud nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa la /
translated: The Tathagata, having fully understood the selflessness of persons and of phenomena, has attained supreme perfect enlightenment.🔽In the world, ascetics, brahmins, and others who are sharp-witted and possess power and miracles may challenge him, saying, “You have not attained perfect enlightenment.”

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa'i 'jig rten na shes rab rno zhing mthu dang rdzu 'phrul du ldan pa rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes rgol ba 'byung bar dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa'i 'jig rten na shes rab rno zhing mthu dang rdzu 'phrul du ldan pa rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes rgol ba 'byung bar dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang
translated: But the Tathagata is fearless with regard to perfect enlightenment, and he has no anxiety.

original: chub pa la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chub pa la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called fearlessness with regard to perfect enlightenment.

original: dam bcas na zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur pa la bdag sangs rgyas yin no @207a * //🔽zhes zhal gyis 'ches pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas na zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur pa la bdag sangs rgyas yin no @207a * // zhes zhal gyis 'ches pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase if one makes a claim refers to the claim that one is a buddha when one has attained manifest enlightenment in that manner.

original: chos dang ldan par rgol ba zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa so so'i chos dang gzhung lugs gang yin pa la brten nas chos de dang ldan par rgol ba'o //🔽rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pas brgal ba'i dmigs sam /
analyzed: chos dang ldan par rgol ba zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa so so'i chos dang gzhung lugs gang yin pa la brten nas chos de dang ldan par rgol ba'o // rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pas brgal ba'i dmigs sam /
translated: The phrase one who is a proper adversary refers to one who is a proper adversary in the sense of being a spiritual practitioner or a brahmin who is a proponent of a particular doctrine and scriptural tradition.

original: skyon nam 'gal ba'i rgyu'am mtshan ma tsam yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyon nam 'gal ba'i rgyu'am mtshan ma tsam yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase does not perceive any reason means that there is not even the slightest basis, fault, or reason for contradiction that could be advanced by a spiritual practitioner or a brahmin.

original: de la bdag bde ba thob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar mi dmigs pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag bde ba thob pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar mi dmigs pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase in that regard, I have attained happiness and the rest indicate the benefits of this nonapprehending.

original: bde ba thob pa ni sku'i phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba thob pa ni sku'i phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase I have attained happiness means that one has attained the happiness of body that is due to the purity of one's physical deeds.

original: sku bag 'khums pa la sogs pa mi mnga' ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sku bag 'khums pa la sogs pa mi mnga' ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the bliss of not having any physical defects, such as stooped posture.

original: bag tsha ba med pa 'thob pa dang zhes bya ba ni gsung gi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir tshig gi skyon 'byung bar bag tsha ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bag tsha ba med pa 'thob pa dang zhes bya ba ni gsung gi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i phyir tshig gi skyon 'byung bar bag tsha ba med pa'o //
translated: He attains fearlessness is the absence of fear in the occurrence of verbal faults, due to the purity of his verbal actions.

original: mi 'jigs pa thob par rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba ni thugs kyi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i thugs zhum pa la sogs pa'i skyon med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob par rnam par spyod do zhes bya ba ni thugs kyi phrin las rnam par dag pa'i thugs zhum pa la sogs pa'i skyon med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: He acts with the attainment of fearlessness is the absence of mental faults, such as discouragement, due to the purity of his mental actions.

original: khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o zhes bya ba ni bde ba thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam bca'o zhes bya ba ni bde ba thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: He is committed to the state of the great bull is the result of attaining bliss.

original: ji ltar glang khyu mchog lce 'bab pa dang / ser ba la sogs pas mi 'jigs pa bzhin bde ba thos pas snyems pa dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar glang khyu mchog lce 'bab pa dang / ser ba la sogs pas mi 'jigs pa bzhin bde ba thos pas snyems pa dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as the great bull is fearless in the face of lightning, hail, and so on, he is fearless in the face of the bliss of hearing the Dharma.

original: 'khor gyi nang na seng ge'i sgra sgrog go zhes bya ba ni bag tsha ba med pa thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang na seng ge'i sgra sgrog go zhes bya ba ni bag tsha ba med pa thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: He roars the lion’s roar in the assembly is the result of attaining fearlessness.

original: gsung ba la skyon ni mnga' bas ji ltar gcan gzan gyi rgyal po seng ge'i sgra thos pa tsam gyis gcan gzan dang / ri dgas thams cad sba gong zhing zil gyis non pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gsung ba la skyon ni mnga' bas ji ltar gcan gzan gyi rgyal po seng ge'i sgra thos pa tsam gyis gcan gzan dang / ri dgas thams cad sba gong zhing zil gyis non pa bzhin du /
translated: Since the Buddha has no faults in speech, just as all beasts and deer are frightened and intimidated by merely hearing the sound of the king of beasts, the lion,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos pa tsam gyis bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad sba gong zhing zil gyis gnon pa'i sgra sgrog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos pa tsam gyis bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad sba gong zhing zil gyis gnon pa'i sgra sgrog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: all opponents such as demons and tīrthikas are frightened and intimidated by merely hearing the speech of the Bhagavat.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo 'jig rten na dge sbyong 'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo 'jig rten na dge sbyong 'am /
translated: The wheel of Brahmā is that which cannot be turned in the world by any ascetic,

original: bram ze'am lha'am bdud dam tshangs pa'am gzhan su yang rung ste /
analyzed: bram ze'am lha'am bdud dam tshangs pa'am gzhan su yang rung ste /
translated: brāhmaṇa, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else, but which I will turn.

original: chos dang ldan par bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang ldan par bskor bar mi nus pa bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa thob pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the result of attaining fearlessness.

original: thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pas bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo sus kyang @207b bskor bar mi nus pa bskor ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pas bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo sus kyang @207b bskor bar mi nus pa bskor ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the wheel of the unsurpassed Dharma that no one can turn” is that the wheel of the Dharma is turned by the purity of the deeds of his mind.

original: bdag zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas na zhes bya ba nas tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bdag zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas na zhes bya ba nas tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bdag gis rab tu bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase “I declare that my defilements have been destroyed” up to “I will turn the wheel of the Dharma of the pure life” teaches the fearlessness of the Tathāgata in regard to the destruction of the defilements.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i zag pa rnams bag chags yan chad ma lus par spangs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i zag pa rnams bag chags yan chad ma lus par spangs te /
translated: The Tathāgata has abandoned all the defilements of passion and so on, along with their traces.

original: zag par byas pa la dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pas zag pa rnams zad par ma gyur to zhes rgol du dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: zag par byas pa la dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pas zag pa rnams zad par ma gyur to zhes rgol du dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: He is fearless in regard to the claim that “the śramaṇas and brahmans have not destroyed the defilements,” because he does not fear that any opponent will arise.

original: rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The other meanings of the terms “does not see a cause” and so on are the same as before.

original: gang yang bdag gis bar chad kyi chos su bstan pa de dag la brten na /
analyzed: gang yang bdag gis bar chad kyi chos su bstan pa de dag la brten na /
translated: Whatever is taught as an obstacle, if you rely on it,🔽

original: bar chad kyi chos su mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas med de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos su mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas med de zhes bya ba nas /
translated: There is no way that those things I have taught as obstacles will not become obstacles if one relies on them.🔽Up to: I will turn the wheel of Brahmā.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the fearlessness of being certain that the things that are obstacles will not become anything else.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du gcod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du gcod par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa la /
translated: It is explained that the afflictions such as attachment become obstacles to nirvāṇa.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa phas rgol ba rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i chos la brten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa phas rgol ba rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i chos la brten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: But since there is no fear of opponents such as brahmins and śramaṇas arguing that even if one relies on the afflictions such as attachment, they will not become obstacles,

original: tshig gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: the other words are the same as before.

original: gang yang bdag gis 'phags pa'i lam 'byung ba rtogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang yang bdag gis 'phags pa'i lam 'byung ba rtogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Whatever is the noble path that will lead to the realization of the cessation of suffering,🔽up to “Subhūti, this is also the bodhisattva great being’s fearlessness with respect to that by way of not apprehending anything.”

original: rab 'byor 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di yang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa bstan pa ste
translated: This teaches the fearlessness with respect to the path that will definitely lead to the attainment of all perfections.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i lam rnams bstan pa de dag la nan tan byas na /
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pas 'phags pa'i lam rnams bstan pa de dag la nan tan byas na /
translated: “If one practices those noble paths taught by the Tathāgata,

original: sdug bsngal zad par gyur nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad par gyur nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa la /
translated: one will put an end to suffering and attain nirvāṇa.”

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze la sogs pa phas rgol ba rnams 'phags pa'i lam de la nan tan byas kyang sdug bsngal zad cing mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes @208a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze la sogs pa phas rgol ba rnams 'phags pa'i lam de la nan tan byas kyang sdug bsngal zad cing mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes @208a * //
translated: “Even if śramaṇas, brahmans, and so on practice the noble path, they will not put an end to suffering and attain nirvāṇa.”

original: rgol bar dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rgol bar dogs pa mi 'byung zhing bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: He is fearless, because he is not afraid of the challenges of others.

original: 'phags pa'i lam 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa de 'khor ba las thar zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa de 'khor ba las thar zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The noble path is called “emergence” because it emerges from cyclic existence and leads to nirvana.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam de bsgoms na chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam de bsgoms na /
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam de bsgoms na chos kyi dbyings rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam de bsgoms na /
translated: It is called “realization” because it leads to the realization of the reality-limit.🔽It is called “the complete destruction of suffering” because it leads to the complete destruction of the suffering of those who cultivate the noble path.

original: lam sgom par byed pa'i mi'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'byung ba'i phyir tshig gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lam sgom par byed pa'i mi'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'byung ba'i phyir tshig gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The other phrases are the same as before.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa🔽ste ; de la don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i don byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpas sgrub cing thob par bya
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste ; de la don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i don byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpas sgrub cing thob par bya
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Great Vehicle of the Bodhisattva, the great being, is as follows: the four analytical knowledges.

original: ba'i don rnam pa sna tshogs rnams phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i don rnam pa sna tshogs rnams phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Here, the analytical knowledge of meaning is the unmistaken knowledge of the various meanings to be accomplished by the Bodhisattva, such as the perfections, which are taught by the twelve branches of the Tathagata's scriptures.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni lung gi chos su gtogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o //🔽nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi so so'i skad rnam pa sna tshogs rnams phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni lung gi chos su gtogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o // nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi so so'i skad rnam pa sna tshogs rnams phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the teaching is the unerring knowledge of the teachings of the scriptures, the discourses, the melodious teachings, and so forth.🔽The knowledge of languages is the unerring knowledge of the various languages of all sentient beings, such as gods, humans, demigods, yakshas, gandharvas, and so forth.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs mkhyen pa de nyid kyis sems can rnams so so'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / mthun par skad sna tshogs kyis tshig dang don du ldan par chos ston pa la thogs pa med cing spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad la /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs mkhyen pa de nyid kyis sems can rnams so so'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / mthun par skad sna tshogs kyis tshig dang don du ldan par chos ston pa la thogs pa med cing spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad la /
translated: The knowledge of eloquence is the uninterrupted eloquence in teaching the Dharma with various languages that accords with the individual thoughts, dispositions, and inclinations of sentient beings, without impediment, through possessing the knowledge of various languages.

original: shes rab gsal ba gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non pa mkhyen pa la /
analyzed: shes rab gsal ba gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non pa mkhyen pa la /
translated: His clear wisdom is not outshone by others.🔽

original: @208b spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin par
analyzed: @208b spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad theg pa chen po yin par
translated: The knowledge that is clear and not overwhelmed by others is called the correct knowledge of eloquence.🔽Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is as follows: the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are the Great Vehicle.

original: gang gis nam la de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gis nam la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gang gis nam la de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / gang gis nam la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: By which the Tathāgata fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, and by which the world with its gods, Māra, and Brahmā,

original: dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis rjes su bstan te /🔽phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa de'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par sangs rgyas nas mtha' yongs
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis rjes su bstan te / phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa de'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par sangs rgyas nas mtha' yongs
translated: He taught the path for the complete cessation of suffering for all beings, including gods, humans, asuras, brahmins, and ascetics.🔽Until he passed into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder, the Tathāgata was without error.

original: su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba la sogs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage teaches that from the time of his initial enlightenment until his final nirvāṇa, the Buddha was without error and so on.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las mdzad pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las mdzad pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is without error means that he is without error in his physical, verbal, and mental activity.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams sngon gyi bag chags ma byang ba'i dbang gis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa la 'khrul pa dang mi mdzes pa 'byung ba de lta bu mi 'byung ba la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams sngon gyi bag chags ma byang ba'i dbang gis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa la 'khrul pa dang mi mdzes pa 'byung ba de lta bu mi 'byung ba la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: As for the absence of error, it is the fact that the Tathagata does not have the kind of error that the noble disciples in quest of arhatship have, by virtue of their not having eliminated the instincts, and which consists of physical, verbal, and mental actions that are unseemly and mistaken.

original: ca co mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams nags dgon pa na lam stor nas sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis ku co'i sgra chen po 'byin cing gcig la gcig 'bod pa de lta bu'i ca co de bzhin🔽gshegs pa la mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: ca co mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams nags dgon pa na lam stor nas sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis ku co'i sgra chen po 'byin cing gcig la gcig 'bod pa de lta bu'i ca co de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: As for the absence of prattle, it is the fact that the Tathagata does not have the kind of prattle that the noble disciples in quest of arhatship have, by virtue of their not having eliminated the instincts, when they lose their way in the forest and cry out with loud wails, calling to one another.

original: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams ched du ma dgongs pa bsnyel zhing don bsgrub pa rnams lus te /
analyzed: dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams ched du ma dgongs pa bsnyel zhing don bsgrub pa rnams lus te /
translated: As for the absence of loss of attention, it is the fact that the Tathagata does not have the kind of loss of attention that the noble disciples in quest of arhatship have, by virtue of their not having eliminated the instincts, when they forget something that they were not paying attention to and have to be reminded of it.

original: ma byas pa dang dus las yol ba la sogs pa 'byung ba de lta bu'i bsnyel ba de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang dus las yol ba la sogs pa 'byung ba de lta bu'i bsnyel ba de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not have such forgetfulness as not doing what should be done, or being untimely, and so on.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs @209a * //
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs @209a * //
translated: He does not have various discriminations.

original: mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rnams 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis tha dad par lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la phags pa la tha dad du lta zhing /
analyzed: mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rnams 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis tha dad par lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la phags pa la tha dad du lta zhing /
translated: This means that, unlike the noble arhats who see samsara and nirvana as two separate things, and who see the phenomena of afflictions and purification as separate from the noble ones,

original: 'du shes sna tshogs 'byung ba de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs 'byung ba de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: the Tathagata does not have various discriminations arising in that way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu sems can mnyam pa nyid dang / chos mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas sems can tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am /🔽tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu sems can mnyam pa nyid dang / chos mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas sems can tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am / tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa'am /
translated: The Tathagata is always in accord with the equality of sentient beings and the equality of phenomena, so he does not see sentient beings as having ethical discipline or not having ethical discipline,🔽as being harmful or🔽not being harmful,

original: gnod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'am /
translated: as being wise or🔽not being wise.

original: phan 'dogs pa la sogs la 'du shes sna tshogs mi 'byung ba dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la sogs la 'du shes sna tshogs mi 'byung ba dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: He is said to be without various discriminations because he does not have various discriminations of benefit, harm, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la sogs pa la tha dad du gzigs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la sogs pa la tha dad du gzigs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is said to be without various discriminations because he does not see phenomena such as samsara and nirvana, or affliction and purification, as different.🔽He is said to be without an undirected mind because he is always in equipoise.

original: thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa dag nam ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa de nyid kyi tshe sems mnyam par bzhag par 'gyur gyi snyoms par ma zhugs pa'i tshe sems mnyam par gzhag par mi 'gyur
analyzed: thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa dag nam ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa de nyid kyi tshe sems mnyam par bzhag par 'gyur gyi snyoms par ma zhugs pa'i tshe sems mnyam par gzhag par mi 'gyur
translated: Just as arhats are in equipoise when they enter meditative concentration, but their minds are not in equipoise when they do not enter meditative concentration,

original: ba de lta bu ni ma yin gyi /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni snyoms par zhugs kyang rung ma zhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: ba de lta bu ni ma yin gyi / de bzhin gshegs pa ni snyoms par zhugs kyang rung ma zhugs kyang rung /
translated: this is not so for the Tathāgata.

original: dus thams cad du mnyam par bzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mnyam par bzhag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is said to be without an undirected mind because he is always in equipoise, whether he is in meditative equipoise or not.

original: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams shes rab kyis so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ba de lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams shes rab kyis so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ba de lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not have the indifference of non-investigation, because unlike the noble disciples who, through wisdom, neglect the welfare of sentient beings by not investigating,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa la /
translated: the Tathāgata, in acting for the welfare of sentient beings,

original: sems can skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa dang / dus la 'bab pa dang / dus la mi 'bab pa so sor brtags nas skal pa med cing dus la mi 'bab na /
analyzed: sems can skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa dang / dus la 'bab pa dang / dus la mi 'bab pa so sor brtags nas skal pa med cing dus la mi 'bab na /
translated: investigates whether sentient beings are fortunate or unfortunate, whether the time is right or not, and if they are unfortunate and the time is not right,

original: gdod btang snyoms mdzad cing yal bar 'dor gyi skal ba yod cing dus la ba bab na btang snyoms su mi 'jog pa la ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdod btang snyoms mdzad cing yal bar 'dor gyi skal ba yod cing dus la ba bab na btang snyoms su mi 'jog pa la ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' zhes bya'o //
translated: he is indifferent and neglects them. But if they are fortunate and the time is right, he is not indifferent. This is called the indifference of non-investigation.

original: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi @209b mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams rang gi sa thob pa las gong du sangs rgyas kyi sa dang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgya chen po la mos pa mi skye ba lta🔽bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi @209b mnga'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams rang gi sa thob pa las gong du sangs rgyas kyi sa dang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgya chen po la mos pa mi skye ba lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the case of the noble śrāvaka arhats, who, having attained their own level, do not generate the aspiration for the higher level of buddhahood and the vast deeds of a buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dus thams cad du sems can gyi don rgya chen po mdzad pa la sogs pa la mos shing 'dun pa rgyun mi 'chad par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ba la mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni dus thams cad du sems can gyi don rgya chen po mdzad pa la sogs pa la mos shing 'dun pa rgyun mi 'chad par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ba la mos pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The tathāgatas, however, always have the aspiration and the intention to perform the vast benefit of sentient beings and so on.🔽He never fails in his diligence is explained as follows.

original: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gyi don du sku dang / gsung dang ; thugs kyi phrin las mdzad pa la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gyi don du sku dang / gsung dang ; thugs kyi phrin las mdzad pa la /
translated: The tathāgatas, in performing deeds of body, speech, and mind for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: are without forgetfulness.

original: sems can gcig gi don du yang bskal pa du mar brtson 'grus mi gtong ba la /🔽brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gcig gi don du yang bskal pa du mar brtson 'grus mi gtong ba la / brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' zhes bya'o //
translated: He never abandons his efforts even for the sake of a single being over many eons.

original: dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He never loses his intention.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa'i dbang po yongs su dag pa'i mthus 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba la sogs pa gsal bar dgongs shing de dag dang mthun par don mdzad pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs la bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba la dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa'i dbang po yongs su dag pa'i mthus 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba la sogs pa gsal bar dgongs shing de dag dang mthun par don mdzad pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs la bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba la dgongs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata’s faculty of mindfulness is completely pure. By its power, he clearly intends the conduct, thoughts, latent tendencies, etc., of sentient beings in the past, future, and present. He never forgets the various means of accomplishing their welfare in accordance with their dispositions.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ste snyoms par zhugs kyang rung ma zhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ste snyoms par zhugs kyang rung ma zhugs kyang rung /
translated: He never loses his samādhi. The Tathāgata is always in equipoise. Whether he is in samādhi or not, he is never distracted.

original: de bzhin nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin las nyams par mi 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin las nyams par mi 'gyur ba la /
translated: And they do not lose the concentration in which their minds are onepointedly focused on thatness.🔽

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Not to lose the samadhi in which the mind is one-pointed with respect to suchness is called “not to lose samadhi.”

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po yongs su dag pas sems can gyi spyod pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la /🔽shas rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //🔽rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam @210a * //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po yongs su dag pas sems can gyi spyod pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa la / shas rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o // rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam @210a * //
translated: Not to lose wisdom is to have the wisdom faculty of the Tathagata, which is endowed with the inexhaustibility of knowledge of the conduct of sentient beings, the inexhaustibility of analytical knowledges, and so forth.

original: par grol ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: par grol ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Not to lose liberation is that the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas are merely liberated from the obscurations of affliction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ka bag chags yan chad byang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis ka bag chags yan chad byang ste /
translated: The Tathagata is completely purified of both the obscurations of affliction and of the knowable, including their traces.

original: sgrib pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' zhing rnam pa thams cad du rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' zhing rnam pa thams cad du rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that he is not in the slightest way obscured and is completely liberated, and that he is not subject to any degeneration of complete liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽de ltar nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa brnyes pa'i che rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las byung ba dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba ni / de ltar nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa brnyes pa'i che rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las byung ba dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: It is said that he is not subject to any degeneration of the knowledge and insight of complete liberation.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar mkhyen cing gzigs pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung zhing sgrib pa med pa la rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar mkhyen cing gzigs pa lhun gyis grub par 'byung zhing sgrib pa med pa la rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, having been completely liberated from the obscurations of the mental afflictions and the knowable, he has attained the nirvāṇa that is not a place of dwelling. With the knowledge and insight of the supramundane gnosis that arises from the absence of conceptualization, he knows and sees the complete liberation from the obscurations of the mental afflictions and the knowable. This knowledge and insight arises spontaneously and without any obscurations. It is said that he is not subject to any degeneration of the knowledge and insight of complete liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa gnyis rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig tu bgrang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa gnyis rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig tu bgrang ngo //
translated: The two, liberation and the vision of the wisdom of liberation, are counted as one because they are not different in being the nature of liberation.

original: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ste /
translated: All the activities of the Buddha’s body are preceded by wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa dag sngon gyi bag chags ma byang ba'i dbang gis sems dang mi ldan par ma tshor bzhin du bya ba dag byed pa de lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa dag sngon gyi bag chags ma byang ba'i dbang gis sems dang mi ldan par ma tshor bzhin du bya ba dag byed pa de lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: They are said to follow wisdom because unlike the activities of the arhats, who, due to their past latent tendencies, act without being aware of it, without their minds being involved,🔽the activities of the Tathāgata’s body are not carried out without his being aware of them or distracted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las thams cad la yengs pa dang / ma tshor bar mdzad pa mi 'byung gi / mkhyen bzhin du mdzad pa la ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las thams cad la yengs pa dang / ma tshor bar mdzad pa mi 'byung gi / mkhyen bzhin du mdzad pa la ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya ste /
translated: All his activities are said to be preceded by wisdom and to follow wisdom.

original: de la ye shes sngon du 'go zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa sngar gtang pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ye shes sngon du 'go zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa sngar gtang pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, preceded by knowledge means that it arises from the cause of previously generated knowledge.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ma bral te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ma bral te /
translated: It is said to follow knowledge because it is not divorced from knowledge.

original: mkhyen bzhin du mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkhyen bzhin du mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it is done while knowing.

original: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ste /
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ste /
translated: All the activities of speech are preceded by knowledge.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi phrin las kyang don med par mi gsung zhing /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi phrin las kyang don med par mi gsung zhing /
translated: It is said to follow knowledge because the activities of the speech of the Tathāgata also do not speak without meaning.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / rjes su mthun par chos ston pa dang / don sna tshogs sgrub @210b pa sha stag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / rjes su mthun par chos ston pa dang / don sna tshogs sgrub @210b pa sha stag 'byung ngo //
translated: It means that it is only the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with the thoughts, dispositions, and inclinations of sentient beings, and the accomplishment of various meanings.

original: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ste /
translated: All the activities of mind are preceded by knowledge.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las kyang sgrib pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral bas byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po'i ngang du gyur pa sems can gyi don sgrub pa 'ba' zhig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las kyang sgrib pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral bas byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po'i ngang du gyur pa sems can gyi don sgrub pa 'ba' zhig 'byung ngo //
translated: “It is followed by pristine awareness” means that the enlightened activity of the mind of the Tathāgata, being free from all habitual tendencies of obscurations, is exclusively the accomplishment of the welfare of sentient beings, in the state of great love and great compassion.

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “It is preceded by pristine awareness” and “it is followed by pristine awareness” are as above.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dus gsum la sgrib pa med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dus gsum la sgrib pa med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: “The vision of pristine awareness that is unimpeded and unobstructed with regard to the past” and so forth teach that the pristine awareness of the Tathāgata is unobstructed with regard to the three times.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa dag 'das pa'i dus yun ring po na sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po cir gyur pa rnams mi mkhyen pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus yun ring po na cir 'gyur ba rnams mi mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa dag 'das pa'i dus yun ring po na sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po cir gyur pa rnams mi mkhyen pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus yun ring po na cir 'gyur ba rnams mi mkhyen pa dang /
translated: The noble shravaka arhats do not know what sentient beings and non-sentient things were like in the past over long periods of time, nor do they know what they will be like in the future over long periods of time.

original: da lta'i dus na yang gang la dgongs shing dmigs pa nyi tshe mkhyen gyi ched du ma dgongs pa rnams la lhun gyis grub pa'i mkhyen pa mi 'byung ba lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: da lta'i dus na yang gang la dgongs shing dmigs pa nyi tshe mkhyen gyi ched du ma dgongs pa rnams la lhun gyis grub pa'i mkhyen pa mi 'byung ba lta bu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not have spontaneous knowledge of what is not the focus of their thoughts and what they do not intend to know even in the present.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus yun ring po dang / da ltar byung ba'i dngos po brtag dka' ba dang / yul thag ring po na gnas pa rnams la sgrib pa dang thogs pa med par mkhyen pa gsal zhing lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus yun ring po dang / da ltar byung ba'i dngos po brtag dka' ba dang / yul thag ring po na gnas pa rnams la sgrib pa dang thogs pa med par mkhyen pa gsal zhing lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ba la /
translated: The tathagatas, on the other hand, have knowledge that is clear and spontaneous with regard to the past and future over long periods of time, to things that are difficult to fathom in the present and to things that are far away in space, without any obscuration or obstruction.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ces bya'o //
translated: It is the vision of wisdom that is unobstructed and unattached with regard to the past, future, and present.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar gzungs kyi sgo rnams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste /🔽de la gzungs zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid kyi don dang / tshig phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mi brjed par 'dzin pa la gzungs zhes bya ste /🔽shes rab kyis yang dag pa'i don dang tshig phyin ci ma log par rtogs nas dran pas gzungs su gzung ste ma brjed par byed pa'i phyir dngos su @211a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'di ltar gzungs kyi sgo rnams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa ste / de la gzungs zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid kyi don dang / tshig phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mi brjed par 'dzin pa la gzungs zhes bya ste / shes rab kyis yang dag pa'i don dang tshig phyin ci ma log par rtogs nas dran pas gzungs su gzung ste ma brjed par byed pa'i phyir dngos su @211a * //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Mahāyāna of bodhisattva mahāsattvas is as follows: the dhāraṇī gateways.🔽Here, “dhāraṇī” means to understand the meaning of reality and the words without error and to hold them without forgetting.

original: na shes rab dang dran pa gnyis la gzungs shes bya'o //
analyzed: na shes rab dang dran pa gnyis la gzungs shes bya'o //
translated: In actuality, wisdom and mindfulness are called “dhāraṇī,” because through wisdom one understands the meaning of reality and the words without error, and through mindfulness one holds them as dhāraṇī and prevents forgetting.

original: shes rab dang dran pa gnyis kyis shes shing dran par bya ba'i dmigs pa'i yul sngags kyi tshig / aa ra pa tsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gzungs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa gnyis kyis shes shing dran par bya ba'i dmigs pa'i yul sngags kyi tshig / aa ra pa tsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gzungs zhes bya ste /
translated: The object of observation that is known and remembered by both wisdom and mindfulness is the mantra words, such as “arapaṭa,” which are also called “dhāraṇī.”

original: gzungs de dag gis gzungs 'di'i don ston pa'i gzhi'i yi ge aa la sogs pa la brten nas chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: gzungs de dag gis gzungs 'di'i don ston pa'i gzhi'i yi ge aa la sogs pa la brten nas chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs par byed cing /
translated: Those dhāraṇīs are called “dhāraṇī doors” because they cause one to realize the meaning of all phenomena, such as their nonarising, in dependence on the letters such as a that are the basis for teaching the meaning of this dhāraṇī.

original: shes rab dang dran pa skye bar byed pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir yi ge rnams la gzungs kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa skye bar byed pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir yi ge rnams la gzungs kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: They are also called “dhāraṇī doors” because they are the door for generating wisdom and mindfulness.

original: yi ge mnyam pa nyid dang brjod pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni yi ge aa la sogs pa la brten nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs par gyur pa'i tshe don ston par byed pa'i yi ge dang / brjod cing bstan par bya ba'i chos rnams ma skyes pa la sogs par rtogs te /
analyzed: yi ge mnyam pa nyid dang brjod pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni yi ge aa la sogs pa la brten nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs par gyur pa'i tshe don ston par byed pa'i yi ge dang / brjod cing bstan par bya ba'i chos rnams ma skyes pa la sogs par rtogs te /
translated: The equality of letters and the equality of expressions means that when one realizes the meaning of nonarising and so on in dependence on the letters a and so on, one realizes that the letters that teach the meaning and the phenomena that are expressed and taught are nonarising and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig cing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig cing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa la /
translated: They are of one taste in the nature of suchness, and they are the same.

original: yi ge mnyam pa nyid dang brjod pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge mnyam pa nyid dang brjod pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the sameness of syllables and the sameness of expressions.

original: yi ge'i sgo dang yi ge 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ye ge aa la sogs pa'i sgo nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa mnyam pa nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge'i sgo dang yi ge 'jug pa ste zhes bya ba ni ye ge aa la sogs pa'i sgo nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa mnyam pa nyid kyi don rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The door of syllables and the entry into syllables means that through the door of syllables such as A, one realizes the meaning of sameness such as non-arising.

original: de lta bu'i don la 'jug pa'i sgo yi ge rnams yin pa'i phyir yi ge'i sgo dang yi ge la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don la 'jug pa'i sgo yi ge rnams yin pa'i phyir yi ge'i sgo dang yi ge la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because syllables are the door for entering such a meaning, it is called the door of syllables and the entry into syllables.

original: de bas na don de gnyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na don de gnyis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to clarify those two meanings,

original: de la yi ge'i sgo dang / yi ge 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yi ge'i sgo dang / yi ge 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the door of syllables and the entry into syllables?

original: aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, A is the door of all dharmas because it is non-arisen, and so forth.

original: ma skyes ba la rgya gar gyi skad du aa nutpanna zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma skyes ba la rgya gar gyi skad du aa nutpanna zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language, non-arisen is anutpanna.

original: de ltar ma skyes pa'i don yi ge aa'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge aa ni chos thams cad ma skyes par ston pa'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa'i don yi ge aa'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge aa ni chos thams cad ma skyes par ston pa'i sgo yin no //
translated: Thus, the letter A is the door which shows that all dharmas are unborn, because the meaning of non-arising is realized by means of the letter A.🔽The letter Ra is the door of all dharmas because it is free from dust.

original: ra zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba la rgya gar gyi skad du ra dza aa pa ga ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ra zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni rdul dang bral ba la rgya gar gyi skad du ra dza aa pa ga ta zhes bya ste /
translated: The word free from dust is rajas in Sanskrit, which means free from dust.

original: yi ge ra'i sgo nas chos thams cad rdul dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ra ni chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba ston pa'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ra'i sgo nas chos thams cad rdul dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ra ni chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba ston pa'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter Ra is the door which shows that all dharmas are free from dust, because the freedom of all dharmas from dust is realized by means of the letter Ra.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ston pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ston pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la /
translated: The letter Pa is the door of all dharmas because it shows the ultimate.

original: rgya gar skad du pa ra m'artha zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du pa ra m'artha zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The ultimate is paramārtha in Sanskrit.

original: yi ge pa'i sgo nas don dam pa rtogs @211b par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge pa'i sgo nas don dam pa rtogs @211b par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The letter Pa is the door which shows the ultimate, because the ultimate is realized by means of the letter Pa.

original: yi ge pa ni don dam par chos thams cad ro gcig par rtogs par byed pa'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge pa ni don dam par chos thams cad ro gcig par rtogs par byed pa'i sgo yin no //
translated: The scribe is the gateway to the realization that ultimately all phenomena are of one taste.

original: tsa zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tsa zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: “ Ca” is the gateway to all phenomena because all phenomena are free from death and rebirth.🔽“ Ca” is the gateway to all phenomena because all phenomena are free from death and rebirth.

original: chos thams cad 'chi 'pho dang skye ba med pas chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni che 'pho ba dang skye ba la rgya gar gyi skad du tsya pa no pa patti zhes bya ste /🔽yi ge tsa'i sgo nas chos thams cad tshe 'pho ba dang / skye ba med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad tshe 'pho ba dang / skye ba med par ston pa'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'chi 'pho dang skye ba med pas chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni che 'pho ba dang skye ba la rgya gar gyi skad du tsya pa no pa patti zhes bya ste / yi ge tsa'i sgo nas chos thams cad tshe 'pho ba dang / skye ba med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad tshe 'pho ba dang / skye ba med par ston pa'i sgo yin no //
translated: The Indian language term for death and rebirth is “cyavanapāta.”🔽The letter “ca” is the gateway that reveals that all phenomena are free from death and rebirth.🔽“ Ṇa” is the gateway to all phenomena because all phenomena are free from names and are neither obtained nor lost.

original: na zhes bya ba ni ming dang bral zhing ming gi rang bzhin ma thob ma stor bas chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni ming dang bral ba la rgya gar gyi skad du n'a ma aa pa ga ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni ming dang bral zhing ming gi rang bzhin ma thob ma stor bas chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni ming dang bral ba la rgya gar gyi skad du n'a ma aa pa ga ta zhes bya ste /
translated: “ Ṇa” is the gateway to all phenomena because all phenomena are free from names.

original: chos thams cad ming dang bral zhing ming gi rang bzhin med par yi ge na'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad ming dang bral zhing ming gi rang bzhin med par yi ge na'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because one realizes through the syllable na that all phenomena are free from names and do not have the nature of names.

original: yi ge na ni don dam par chos thams cad ming dang bral ba ston pa'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge na ni don dam par chos thams cad ming dang bral ba ston pa'i sgo yin no //
translated: The syllable na is the door that teaches that ultimately all phenomena are free from names.

original: ming gi rang bzhin ma thos ma stor zhes bya ba ni ming du gdags par bya ba'i chos dang / ming nyid kyang don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste /
analyzed: ming gi rang bzhin ma thos ma stor zhes bya ba ni ming du gdags par bya ba'i chos dang / ming nyid kyang don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste /
translated: “Not heard, not lost” means that the phenomena that are to be designated by names and the names themselves are not ultimately established as existent things.

original: ming du gdags su yang med pas ma thob ces bya'o //
analyzed: ming du gdags su yang med pas ma thob ces bya'o //
translated: Since they are not even designated as names, they are said to be “not heard.”

original: ming dor du yang med pas ma stor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming dor du yang med pas ma stor zhes bya'o //
translated: Since names are not discarded, they are said to be “not lost.”

original: de ltar sngags kyi tshig yi ge 'bru lnga'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi tshig yi ge 'bru lnga'o //
translated: Thus, the mantra words are the five seed syllables.

original: aa ra pa tsa na zhes bya ba yi ge 'bru re re'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i shes rab dang ngan pa'i gzungs skye bar 'gyur ba'i sgo yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: aa ra pa tsa na zhes bya ba yi ge 'bru re re'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i shes rab dang ngan pa'i gzungs skye bar 'gyur ba'i sgo yin par bstan nas /
translated: “Arapacana” is taught to be the door that gives rise to the wisdom and the dhāraṇī of the bad that realizes through the door of each syllable that ultimately all phenomena are non-arisen, and so on.

original: de bzhin du gzungs sngags kyi tshig gzhan rnams kyang yi ge re re'i sgo nas chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par ston pa'i sgo yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzungs sngags kyi tshig gzhan rnams kyang yi ge re re'i sgo nas chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par ston pa'i sgo yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, the other mantra syllables are taught to be the doors for showing that all phenomena are ultimately devoid of entities.

original: la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das shing sred pa'i 'khri shing rgyu dang rkyen yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das shing sred pa'i 'khri shing rgyu dang rkyen yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The syllable la is the door of all phenomena because it is supramundane and it completely destroys the vines of craving and causes and conditions.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la /
translated: Supramundane.

original: rgya gar gyi skad du lo kotta ra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi skad du lo kotta ra zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language, it is called lokotara.

original: don dam par rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ni yongs su dag pa yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par yi ge la'i sgo nas rtogs @212a * //🔽bar 'gyur ba dang sred pa'i 'khri shing zhes bya ba la rgya gar gyi skad du /
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ni yongs su dag pa yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par yi ge la'i sgo nas rtogs @212a * // bar 'gyur ba dang sred pa'i 'khri shing zhes bya ba la rgya gar gyi skad du /
translated: Since the ultimate nature, suchness, is completely pure, it is supramundane. It is realized through the door of the syllable la.

original: trishna la ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: trishna la ta zhes bya ste /
translated: The vines of craving. In the Indian language, it is called trishna-lata.

original: yi ge la'i sgo nas chos thams cad don dam par sred pa'i 'ching ba dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge la ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin no ;
analyzed: yi ge la'i sgo nas chos thams cad don dam par sred pa'i 'ching ba dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge la ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin no ;
translated: Because, through the letter la, one realizes that all phenomena are ultimately free from the bondage of craving, the letter la is the door of all phenomena.🔽The letter da is the door of all phenomena because it is the complete determination of taming and the state of being tamed.

original: / da ces bya ba ni dul ba dang dul ba'i gnas su yongs su nges pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni dul ba la rgya gar gyi skad du d'an ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / da ces bya ba ni dul ba dang dul ba'i gnas su yongs su nges pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni dul ba la rgya gar gyi skad du d'an ta zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language, taming is called dānta.

original: ma dul bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las rnams don dam par dngos po med par yi ge da'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma dul bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las rnams don dam par dngos po med par yi ge da'i sgo nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Through the letter da, one realizes that the afflictions and karma that cause untaming ultimately do not exist.

original: de ltar ma dul ba dngos po med par rtogs na dul ba dang dul ba'i gnas su yongs su nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ma dul ba dngos po med par rtogs na dul ba dang dul ba'i gnas su yongs su nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If one realizes that untaming does not exist, then one will be completely determined in taming and the state of being tamed.

original: yi ge de ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge de ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letter da is the door of all phenomena.

original: ba zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bcings pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ban dha na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bcings pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ban dha na zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language, bondage is called bandhana.

original: yi ge pa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad bcings pa dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge pa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad bcings pa dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Through the door of the letter ba, one will realize that ultimately all phenomena are free from bondage.

original: yi ge ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letter ba is the door of all phenomena.🔽The letter da is the door of all phenomena because it is free from disturbance.

original: da zhes bya ba ni dkrugs ma dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya ba ni dkrugs ma la rgya gar gyi skad du da ma zhes bya ste /🔽yi ge da'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dkrugs ma'am /
analyzed: da zhes bya ba ni dkrugs ma dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya ba ni dkrugs ma la rgya gar gyi skad du da ma zhes bya ste / yi ge da'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dkrugs ma'am /
translated: In the Indian language, disturbance is called dama.

original: 'khrug pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Through the door of the letter da, one will realize that ultimately all phenomena are undisturbed.

original: yi ge da ni chos thams cad dkrugs ma med par rtogs pa'i sgo yin no //🔽sa zhes bya ba ni chags pa mi dmigs par chags par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yi ge da ni chos thams cad dkrugs ma med par rtogs pa'i sgo yin no //🔽sa zhes bya ba ni chags pa mi dmigs par chags par mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the letter da is the door to the realization that all phenomena are undisturbed.🔽The letter sa is the door of all phenomena because attachment is not observed as attachment.

original: 'ching bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni chags pa la rgya gar gyi skad du sang ga zhes bya ste yi ge sa'i sgo nas chos thams cad chags pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te /🔽chags pa med na nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'ching bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni chags pa la rgya gar gyi skad du sang ga zhes bya ste yi ge sa'i sgo nas chos thams cad chags pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te / chags pa med na nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /

translated: The gateway of all phenomena is the letter sa, because it is unattached.🔽The gateway of all phenomena is the letter bha, because it is the cessation of the path of speech and sound.

analyzed: yi ge ba ni chos thams cad ngag ge lam dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //

analyzed: dag gi lam dang bral ba'i skabs su smos pa'i yi ge b'a  di ni yi ge ba'i ras  su gtogs pa'i yi ge pa yin pas lan gnyis su zlos par yang mi 'gyur la yi ge pa 'og ma ni yi ge wa'i yang sbyar ba'i phyir
translated: The letter ba mentioned in the context of being free from the path of the letter da belongs to the class of the letter pa, so it is not repeated twice. The lower letter ba is also connected with the letter va.

original: bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: There is a distinction.

original: ta zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rgya gar gyi skad du ta th'a ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ta zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rgya gar gyi skad du ta th'a ta zhes bya ste /
translated: The letter ta is the door of all phenomena because it does not move from suchness. In the Indian language, suchness is called tathata.

analyzed: yi ge ta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig cing /

original: de las mi 'gyur bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las mi 'gyur bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
