original: yi ge ta ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ta ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter ta is the door to realizing that all phenomena do not move from suchness.

original: ya zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin la rgya gar gyi skad du /
analyzed: ya zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin la rgya gar gyi skad du /
translated: Ya is the door of all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of the correct suchness.

original: ya th'a bad ces bya ste /🔽yi ge ya'i sgo nas chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig pas brtags shing gtan la phab na don dam par dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ya ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du
analyzed: ya th'a bad ces bya ste / yi ge ya'i sgo nas chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig pas brtags shing gtan la phab na don dam par dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ya ni chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du
translated: In the Indian language, it is called yathābhūta.🔽By investigating and determining all phenomena through the door of the letter ya, one realizes that ultimately they are non-apprehensible.

original: dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letter ya is the door to realizing that all phenomena are non-apprehensible in reality.

original: sta zhes bya ba ni khengs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni khengs pa la rgya gar gyi skad du stam bha zhes bya ste /🔽yi ge sta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la nga rgyal las gyur pa'i khengs pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sta zhes bya ba ni khengs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni khengs pa la rgya gar gyi skad du stam bha zhes bya ste / yi ge sta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la nga rgyal las gyur pa'i khengs pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The syllable ta is the door of all phenomena because arrogance is non-apprehensible.🔽The syllable ta is the door of all phenomena because arrogance is non-apprehensible.

original: yi ge sta ni chos thams cad khengs pa dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //🔽ka zhes bya ba ni byad pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge sta ni chos thams cad khengs pa dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no // ka zhes bya ba ni byad pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: The syllable ta is the door of all phenomena because arrogance is non-apprehensible.

original: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po la rgya gar gyi skad du ka ra ka zhes @213a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po la rgya gar gyi skad du ka ra ka zhes @213a * //
translated: The syllable ka is the door of all phenomena because an agent is non-apprehensible.🔽The syllable ka is the door of all phenomena because an agent is non-apprehensible.

original: bya ste / yi ge ka'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i byed pa po dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ka ni chos thams cad la byed pa po mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no🔽// sa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid me dmigs pas mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid la rgya gar gyi skad du sa ma ta zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: bya ste / yi ge ka'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i byed pa po dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ka ni chos thams cad la byed pa po mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no // sa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid me dmigs pas mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid la rgya gar gyi skad du sa ma ta zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The letter ka is the door to the realization that all phenomena are devoid of an agent, because, by means of the letter ka, one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are devoid of an agent imagined by the heterodox.🔽The letter sa is the door to all phenomena, because, by means of the letter sa, one realizes that all phenomena are devoid of an agent, and because one does not transgress equality by observing the non-apprehension of equality.

original: yi ge sa'i sgo nas mnyam pa nyid kyang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge sa'i sgo nas mnyam pa nyid kyang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The letter sa is the door to all phenomena, because, by means of the letter sa, one realizes that equality is also non-apprehensible.

original: de ltar mnyam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mnyam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the non-conceptualization of equality itself is said to be the non-transgression of equality.

original: de bas na yi ge sa ni chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge sa ni chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letter sa is the door to the realization that all phenomena are the same, that they are not apprehended, and that they do not go beyond sameness.🔽The letter ma is the door of all phenomena because the appropriation of an ‘I’ is not apprehended.

original: ma zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba la rgya gar gyi skad du ma ma ka ra zhes bya ste /🔽yi ge ma'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad bdag gir bya ba med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya ba la rgya gar gyi skad du ma ma ka ra zhes bya ste / yi ge ma'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad bdag gir bya ba med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The Indian word for ‘appropriation of an I’ is māmakāra.🔽Through the door of the letter ma, one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are without the appropriation of an ‘I.’

original: yi ge ma ni chos thams cad bdag gir bya ba mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ma ni chos thams cad bdag gir bya ba mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letter ma is the door to the realization that the appropriation of an ‘I’ is not apprehended in all phenomena.

original: ga zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la rgya gar gyi skad du ga ma ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ga zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la rgya gar gyi skad du ga ma ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The letter ga is the door of all phenomena because going is not apprehended.

original: yi ge ga'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos por ma grub par 'gro ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge ga'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos por ma grub par 'gro ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The letter ga is the door to the realization that ultimately all phenomena are not established as entities and are not observed.

original: yi ge ga ni chos thams cad 'gro ba mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //🔽tha zhes bya ba ni gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir /

translated: The letter ga is the door to the realization that all phenomena are not observed to go.🔽The letter tha is the door to all phenomena because of the non-observation of a basis.

analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni gnas la rgya gar gyi skad du tha na zhes bya ste /

original: yi ge tha'i sgo nas chos thams cad dngos po med pas gnas kyang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge tha'i sgo nas chos thams cad dngos po med pas gnas kyang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The letter tha is the door to the realization that all phenomena are without basis because of being without entity.

original: yi ge tha ni chos thams cad gnas mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge tha ni chos thams cad gnas mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter tha is the door to the realization that all phenomena are not observed as a basis.🔽The letter ja is the door to all phenomena because of the non-observation of arising.

original: dza zhes bya ba ni skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes @213b bya ba ni skye pa la rgya gar gyi skad du dza ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dza zhes bya ba ni skye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes @213b bya ba ni skye pa la rgya gar gyi skad du dza ti zhes bya ste /

translated: The letter ja is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are not observed to arise, because through the letter ja one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are unborn.

analyzed: sha zhes bya ba ni dbugs dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni dbugs la rgya gar gyi skad du shva sa zhes bya ste /

original: yi ge sha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la dbugs kyi rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge sha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la dbugs kyi rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The letter sha is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are not observed to have the nature of the breath, because ultimately all phenomena are unborn.

original: yi ge sha ni chos thams cad la dbugs dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no /
analyzed: yi ge sha ni chos thams cad la dbugs dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no /

original: dha zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la rgya gar gyi skad du dharma dha tu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dha zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la rgya gar gyi skad du dharma dha tu zhes bya ste /
translated: “ Dha” is the gateway to all phenomena, because the dharmadhātu is not observed.

analyzed: yi ge dha'i sgo nas don dam par chos kyi dbyings nyid kyang mtshan mar bzung zhing dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /

analyzed: yi ge dha ni chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter dha is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are not observed as the nature of the basic space of phenomena.

original: sha zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas la rgya gar gyi skad du sha ma tha zhes bya ste /

original: yi ge sha'i sgo nas don dam par zhi gnas zhes bya ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge sha'i sgo nas don dam par zhi gnas zhes bya ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The letter sha is the gateway to the realization that ultimately even what is called “shamatha” is not observed.

original: yi ge sha ni chos thams cad la zhi gnas dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge sha ni chos thams cad la zhi gnas dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //

original: kha zhes bya ba na nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa la rgya gar gyi skad du kha sa ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha zhes bya ba na nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa la rgya gar gyi skad du kha sa ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable kha is the door of all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of space-like equality.🔽In the Indian language, space-like equality is called khasama.

original: yi ge kha'i sgo nas don dam par nam mkha' dang mnyam mo zhes bya bar rtog cing /
analyzed: yi ge kha'i sgo nas don dam par nam mkha' dang mnyam mo zhes bya bar rtog cing /

original: mtshan mar bzung ba yang med bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan mar bzung ba yang med bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /

original: yi ge kha ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge kha ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the syllable kha is the door for realizing that all phenomena are the non-apprehension of space-like equality.🔽The syllable kṣha is the door of all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of exhaustion.

original: ksha zhes bya ba ni zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ksha ya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ksha zhes bya ba ni zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ksha ya zhes bya ste /

original: yi ge ksha'i sgo nas don dam par @214a * //
analyzed: yi ge ksha'i sgo nas don dam par @214a * //
translated: Through the door of the syllable kṣha, one should understand that ultimately

analyzed: chos thams cad la mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid zad ba zhes bya ba dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ksha ni chos thams cad la zad pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter KṢA is the door to the realization that all phenomena are the realization that the exhaustion of the characteristic of impermanence is not apprehended.🔽The letter STA is the door of all phenomena because praise is not apprehended.

original: sta zhes bya ba ni bstod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bstod pa la rgya gar gyi skad du sto ttra zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sta zhes bya ba ni bstod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bstod pa la rgya gar gyi skad du sto ttra zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Indian word for praise is stotra.

original: yi ge sta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la bstod pa mi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge sta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la bstod pa mi dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Through the letter STA, ultimately, praise is not apprehended in all phenomena.

original: yi ge sta ni chos thams cad la bstod pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge sta ni chos thams cad la bstod pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter STA is the door to the realization that praise is not apprehended in all phenomena.🔽The letter JÑÃ is the door of all phenomena because wisdom is not apprehended.

original: dzny'a zhes bya ba ni ye shes dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni ye shes la rgya gar gyi skad du dzny'a na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dzny'a zhes bya ba ni ye shes dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni ye shes la rgya gar gyi skad du dzny'a na zhes bya ste /

original: yi ge dzny'a'i sgo nas don dam par shes pa'i don chos dmigs su med par shes par byed ba'i ye shes kyang dmigs su med bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /

translated: The letter jña is the door to the realization that the wisdom that makes one understand that ultimately the object of cognition, the referent of phenomena, is unobservable is also unobservable.

analyzed: yi ge dzny'a ni chos thams cad la ye shes dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no // rta zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'am mi bde ba la rgya gar gyi skad du aa rti zhes bya ste /
translated: The letter jña is the door to the realization that wisdom is unobservable in all phenomena.🔽The word “horse” is the door to all phenomena because afflictions are unobservable.🔽The letter rta is the door to the realization that ultimately all phenomena are unobservable as things, and even afflictions or unhappiness are unobservable.

original: yi ge rta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par nyon mongs pa'am mi bde ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge rta ni chos thams cad nyon mongs ba la mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin
analyzed: yi ge rta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par nyon mongs pa'am mi bde ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge rta ni chos thams cad nyon mongs ba la mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin
translated: The letter rta is the door to the realization that afflictions are unobservable in all phenomena.

original: no // ha zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rgya gar gyi skad du he tu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: no // ha zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rgya gar gyi skad du he tu zhes bya ste /
translated: Ha is the door of all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of a cause. The Indian language word for cause is hetu.

original: yi ge ha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad rgyu dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ha ni chos thams cad la rgyu mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad rgyu dang bral bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ha ni chos thams cad la rgyu mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Because of the door of the letter ha, one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are free from a cause. Therefore, the letter ha is the door to the realization that all phenomena are free from the apprehension of a cause.

original: bha zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig ba la rgya gar gyi skad du bhang ga zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bha zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig ba la rgya gar gyi skad du bhang ga zhes bya ste /
translated: Bha is the door of all phenomena because of the non-existence of destruction. The Indian language word for destruction is bhanga.

original: yi ge bha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pas 'jig pa yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge bha @214b ni chos thams cad 'jig pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge bha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pas 'jig pa yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge bha @214b ni chos thams cad 'jig pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Because of the door of the letter bha, one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are free from destruction because they are unborn. Therefore, the letter bha is the door to the realization that all phenomena are free from destruction.

original: tsha zhes bya ba ni mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni mdog la rgya gar gyi skad du tsha bi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tsha zhes bya ba ni mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni mdog la rgya gar gyi skad du tsha bi zhes bya ste /
translated: The Indian word for color is tshavi.

original: yi ge tsha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas mdog bzang ngan yang dmigs su med par rtog par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge tsha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas mdog bzang ngan yang dmigs su med par rtog par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Through the syllable tsa, one will understand that ultimately all phenomena are unreal, and so one will not perceive good or bad colors.

original: yi ge tsha ni chos thams cad mdog mi dmigs par rtog par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge tsha ni chos thams cad mdog mi dmigs par rtog par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The syllable tsa is the door to the realization that all phenomena are not perceived as color.

original: sma zhes bya ba ni dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa la rgya gar gyi skad du sma ra na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sma zhes bya ba ni dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa la rgya gar gyi skad du sma ra na zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable sma is the door of all phenomena because recollection is not perceived.

original: yi ge sma'i sgo nas don dam bar chos thams cad dngos po med pas bran pa zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i tshor ba de yang mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge sma ni chos thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo
analyzed: yi ge sma'i sgo nas don dam bar chos thams cad dngos po med pas bran pa zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i tshor ba de yang mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge sma ni chos thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo
translated: The letter ma is the door to the realization that all phenomena are unapprehendable, because through the letter ma one realizes that the feeling that arises in the mind is unapprehendable, since ultimately all phenomena are insubstantial.🔽The letter ha is the door to all phenomena, because it is unapprehendable.

original: yin no // ha zhes bya ba ni bod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bod pa la rgya gar gyi skad du aa ba ha na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yin no // ha zhes bya ba ni bod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni bod pa la rgya gar gyi skad du aa ba ha na zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language, the word for “to destroy” is avahana.

original: yi ge ha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas med par bya ba'i dngos po dang bod pa'i ming yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge ha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas med par bya ba'i dngos po dang bod pa'i ming yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Through the letter ha, one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are unapprehendable, since they are insubstantial and have no name.

original: yi ge ha ni chos thams cad bod pa mi dmigs bar rtogs bar 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ha ni chos thams cad bod pa mi dmigs bar rtogs bar 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter ha is the door to the realization that all phenomena are unapprehendable.

original: tas zhes bya ba ni mos pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni mos pa'am spro ba la rgya gar gyi skad du /
analyzed: tas zhes bya ba ni mos pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni mos pa'am spro ba la rgya gar gyi skad du /
translated: The syllable ta is the gateway of all phenomena because interest is not observed.

original: au sa ta zhes bya ste /🔽yi ge ta dang sar sbyar ba'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas mos pa'am /
analyzed: au sa ta zhes bya ste / yi ge ta dang sar sbyar ba'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas mos pa'am /
translated: Interest or enthusiasm is called ustha in Sanskrit.🔽By combining the syllables ta and sa, one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are not things, and so one realizes that interest or enthusiasm is not observed.

original: sgro ba yang mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge tas ni chos thams cad mos pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: sgro ba yang mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge tas ni chos thams cad mos pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the syllable ta is the gateway for realizing that all phenomena are not observed as objects of interest.

original: gha zhes bya ba ni stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni stug po la rgya gar gyi skad du /
analyzed: gha zhes bya ba ni stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni stug po la rgya gar gyi skad du /
translated: The syllable gha is the gateway of all phenomena because density is not observed.

original: gha na zhes bya ste /🔽yi ge gha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la stug po'am /
analyzed: gha na zhes bya ste / yi ge gha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad la stug po'am /
translated: Density is called ghana in Sanskrit.

original: stug por rtog pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stug por rtog pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: By means of the syllable gha, one realizes that ultimately all phenomena are not dense or conceived of as dense.

original: yi ge gha ni chos thams cad stug po mi dmigs par rtogs par @215a * //🔽'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge gha ni chos thams cad stug po mi dmigs par rtogs par @215a * // 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter Gha is the door to the realization that all phenomena are dense and not apprehended.

original: tha zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa la rgya gar gyi skad du /
analyzed: tha zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa la rgya gar gyi skad du /
translated: The letter Tha is the door to all phenomena because of the non-apprehension of establishment.

original: pam tha pa na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pam tha pa na zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language, the word for establishment is pamthāna.

original: yi ge tha'i sgo nas don dam par bsgrubs bar bya ba'i chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge tha'i sgo nas don dam par bsgrubs bar bya ba'i chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Through the letter Tha, one realizes that all phenomena to be established ultimately are unreal.

original: yi ge tha ni chos thams cad sgrub pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge tha ni chos thams cad sgrub pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter Tha is the door to the realization that all phenomena are not apprehended as established.

original: na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pas gang 'gro ba med cing 'ong ba med de /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pas gang 'gro ba med cing 'ong ba med de /
translated: The letter Na is the door to the realization that all phenomena are not apprehended as going or coming.

original: gnas pa med cing 'dug pa med la /
analyzed: gnas pa med cing 'dug pa med la /
translated: It is the door to the realization that all phenomena are not apprehended as abiding or sitting.

original: nyal bar 'gyur ba med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ra na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyal bar 'gyur ba med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ra na zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it does not sleep, it is the door of all phenomena because it is nonconceptual.🔽

original: yi ge na'i sgo nas don dam par nyon mongs pa yang dngos po med pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis dngos po gang yang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar 'gyur ba yang med la rnam par rtog pa yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge na'i sgo nas don dam par nyon mongs pa yang dngos po med pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis dngos po gang yang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar 'gyur ba yang med la rnam par rtog pa yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The gateway of all phenomena is the syllable pa, because it is the gateway to the realization that, ultimately, there is no coming or going, no standing or sitting, no lying down or arising, and no conceptualization, due to the non-existence of afflictions.🔽The Indian word for affliction is “rana.”

original: yi ge na ni chos thams cad nyon mongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //🔽pha zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge na ni chos thams cad nyon mongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //🔽pha zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: The syllable na is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are free from afflictions, coming and going, standing and sitting, lying down and arising, and conceptualization.🔽The syllable pha is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are free from coming and going, standing and sitting, lying down and arising, and conceptualization, because the result is unobservable.

original: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la rgya gar gyi skad du /🔽pha la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la rgya gar gyi skad du / pha la zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language,

original: yi ge pha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa /
analyzed: yi ge pha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa /
translated: the letter pha is the gateway to the realization that ultimately all phenomena are unreal and

original: 'bras bu yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: that even the result is unobservable.

original: yi ge pha ni chos thams cad 'bras bu med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //🔽ska zhes bya ba ni phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge pha ni chos thams cad 'bras bu med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no // ska zhes bya ba ni phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the letter pha is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are without result.🔽The letter ka is the gateway to all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la rgya gar gyi skad du skan dha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la rgya gar gyi skad du skan dha zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Indian language,🔽the letter ka is the gateway to the realization that ultimately the aggregates are unobservable.

original: yi ge ska'i sgo nas don dam par phung po rnams dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir yi ge ska ni chos thams cad phung po dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ska'i sgo nas don dam par phung po rnams dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir yi ge ska ni chos thams cad phung po dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letter ka is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are unobservable aggregates.

original: yas zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o @215b zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba la rgya gar gyi skad du yas kar zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yas zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o @215b zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba la rgya gar gyi skad du yas kar zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable ya is the door of all phenomena because unpleasantness is not perceived.

original: yi ge ya dang sar sbyar ba'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas mi bde ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge ya dang sar sbyar ba'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas mi bde ba yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The ultimate non-existence of all phenomena is understood through the combination of the syllables ya and sa, and so unpleasantness is also understood to be unobservable.

original: yi ge yas ni chos thams cad mi bde ba mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge yas ni chos thams cad mi bde ba mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The syllable ya is the door through which one understands that all phenomena are unobservable as unpleasant.

original: tsa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni spyod pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ts'arya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tsa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni spyod pa la rgya gar gyi skad du ts'arya zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable tsa is the door of all phenomena because activity is not perceived.

original: yi ge tsa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad la spyod pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo
analyzed: yi ge tsa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad la spyod pa mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo
translated: The letter ca is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are not observed in terms of the conduct of body, speech, and mind, because, ultimately, all phenomena are unreal and therefore one realizes that the conduct of body, speech, and mind is unobservable.🔽The letter ta is the gateway to all phenomena, because suffering is unobservable.

original: yin no // ta zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rgya gar gyi skad du ta da ka ra zhes bya ste /🔽yi ge ta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas sdug bsngal ba'am gnod pa yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin no // ta zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rgya gar gyi skad du ta da ka ra zhes bya ste / yi ge ta'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas sdug bsngal ba'am gnod pa yang dmigs su med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The Indian word for suffering is tādaka.🔽The letter ta is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are not observed as suffering or harm, because, ultimately, all phenomena are unreal and therefore one realizes that suffering or harm is unobservable.

original: yi ge ta ni chos thams cad sdug bsngal ba'am gnod ba mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ta ni chos thams cad sdug bsngal ba'am gnod ba mi dmigs par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no //
translated: The letter ta is the gateway to the realization that all phenomena are not observed as suffering or harm.

original: dha zhes bya ba ni g-yogs pa mi dmigs pas mthar thug par gnas par 'chi 'pho med cing skye ba med pa'i phyir //🔽chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni g-yogs pa la rgya gar gyi skad du dh'a ka na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dha zhes bya ba ni g-yogs pa mi dmigs pas mthar thug par gnas par 'chi 'pho med cing skye ba med pa'i phyir // chos thams cad kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba ni g-yogs pa la rgya gar gyi skad du dh'a ka na zhes bya ste /
translated: The syllable dha is the gateway to all phenomena because, by not observing the covering, one realizes that there is no death or rebirth at the limit of the ultimate.

original: yi ge dha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas g-yogs shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i mtha' la thug gi bar du /🔽tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge dha'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas g-yogs shing nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i mtha' la thug gi bar du / tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba med par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The syllable dha is the gateway to the realization that ultimately all phenomena are unreal, and that due to the afflictive obscurations, one is covered by the afflictions, and that due to the power of the afflictions, one is reborn in cyclic existence until the end of time.

original: yi ge dha ni chos thams cad g-yogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge dha ni chos thams cad g-yogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The syllable dha is the gateway to the realization that there is no death or rebirth by not observing the covering of all phenomena.

original: yi ge'i 'bru 'di rnams ka la sogs pa'i go rims bzhin du ma smos pa ni /
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru 'di rnams ka la sogs pa'i go rims bzhin du ma smos pa ni /
translated: The reason that these syllables are not mentioned in the order of the alphabet, beginning with ka, is as follows.

original: gzungs sngags rnams las go rims med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar gzungs sngags kyi tshig rnams las @216a * //
analyzed: gzungs sngags rnams las go rims med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de ltar gzungs sngags kyi tshig rnams las @216a * //
translated: because the dhāraṇī-mantras are recited in a random order.

original: 'byung ba'i yi ge'i 'bru re re'i tshig gi don la brtags shing /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i yi ge'i 'bru re re'i tshig gi don la brtags shing /
translated: Thus, if one examines the meaning of each syllable of the dhāraṇī-mantra words

original: bsgoms na chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gzungs zhes bya ba shes rab dang dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgoms na chos thams cad ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gzungs zhes bya ba shes rab dang dran pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i sgo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and meditates on them, the dhāraṇī called “the door of the arising of wisdom and memory” will arise.

original: yi ge de dag  la gzungs kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge de dag  la gzungs kyi sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those syllables are called “the door of dhāraṇī.”🔽Beyond that, there are no syllables.

original: de yan chad ni yi ge'i tha snyad med do zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i sgo nas don rtogs par bya ba'i yi ge rnams ni der zad do //
analyzed: de yan chad ni yi ge'i tha snyad med do zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i sgo nas don rtogs par bya ba'i yi ge rnams ni der zad do //
translated: This means that the syllables for understanding the meaning through syllables end there.

original: de las lhag pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las lhag pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is nothing else beyond that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang la yang gang gi tha snyad du bya ba dang / gang gis brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yi ge'i tha snyad du bya ba de las lhag pa gzhan med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang la yang gang gi tha snyad du bya ba dang / gang gis brjod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yi ge'i tha snyad du bya ba de las lhag pa gzhan med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase “there is nothing other than that” indicates the reason that there is nothing other than the conventional expressions of syllables.

original: tshig dang yi ger brjod pa'i sgo nas tha snyad du bya ba dang / brjod pa dang / gzhan la bstan pa dang / yi ger bri ba dang / snang zhing gsal bar bya ba dang / bklag par bya ba thams cad ni /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ger brjod pa'i sgo nas tha snyad du bya ba dang / brjod pa dang / gzhan la bstan pa dang / yi ger bri ba dang / snang zhing gsal bar bya ba dang / bklag par bya ba thams cad ni /
translated: All conventional expressions, descriptions, teachings to others, written letters, appearances, clarifications, and readings through the medium of words and syllables

original: de dag tu zad do //
analyzed: de dag tu zad do //
translated: are exhausted in those.

original: de lta bu'i ming du bya ba thams cad 'di'i khongs su 'dus te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ming du bya ba thams cad 'di'i khongs su 'dus te /
translated: All such expressions in names are included in this.

original: de las lhag pa gzhan gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las lhag pa gzhan gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is nothing other than that.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' bzhin du chos thams cad khong du chud bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi yi ge de rnams kun rdzob tu sgra dang tha snyad du brjod pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad la khyab pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' bzhin du chos thams cad khong du chud bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi yi ge de rnams kun rdzob tu sgra dang tha snyad du brjod pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad la khyab pa dang /
translated: This teaches the example of how, on the conventional level, those syllables of the dhāraṇī pervade all dharmas through being expressed as sounds and terms,

original: don dam par mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: and on the ultimate level, they are of one taste in sameness.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la mkhas par bya ba 'di yongs su shes na /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la mkhas par bya ba 'di yongs su shes na /
translated: Subhuti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who understands this skill in the letters such as A

original: de ni sgra la yang chags par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi sgo 'di la mkhas pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni sgra la yang chags par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi sgo 'di la mkhas pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: will not be attached to sounds and so on. This teaches the qualities of being skilled in this dhāraṇī gateway.

original: sgra gang la yang chags par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yi ge brjod cing bstan pa'i don rnams ma skyes pa la sogs par khong du chud pas dngos po de dag la chags par mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra gang la yang chags par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yi ge brjod cing bstan pa'i don rnams ma skyes pa la sogs par khong du chud pas dngos po de dag la chags par mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: One does not become attached to any sound means that by understanding the meanings expressed and indicated by the syllables as unborn, etc., one does not become attached to those things.

original: de bas na don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to clearly demonstrate that meaning, it says:

original: thams cad chos @216b nyid kyis yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad chos @216b nyid kyis yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: All dharmas are truly established by their intrinsic nature.

original: tshig dang yi ges brjod do cog thams cad yi ge aa la sogs pa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa la sogs par rtogs nas stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid du sgom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ges brjod do cog thams cad yi ge aa la sogs pa'i sgo nas don dam par chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa la sogs par rtogs nas stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid du sgom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all dharmas expressed by words and syllables, by means of the syllables such as A, are ultimately realized as primordially unborn, etc., and are cultivated as the intrinsic nature of emptiness.

original: sgra shes par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yi ges tshig tu brjod pa'i sgra thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du mkhas par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra shes par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yi ges tshig tu brjod pa'i sgra thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul du mkhas par 'gyur bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase he will attain skill in understanding sounds indicates that he will become skilled in all sounds that express words with letters, in terms of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' gang gis aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi sgo 'di dag thos pa dang / nyams su len pa dang / gzhan la yang ston pa'i phan yon rnam pa nyi shu yod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' gang gis aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzungs kyi sgo 'di dag thos pa dang / nyams su len pa dang / gzhan la yang ston pa'i phan yon rnam pa nyi shu yod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, any bodhisattva who hears this seal of entry into the letters such as A and so on, and practices it and teaches it to others will have twenty kinds of benefits.

original: phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni aa la sogs pa yi ge'i 'bru re re yang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don ston pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni aa la sogs pa yi ge'i 'bru re re yang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don ston pa'i rtags dang mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term seal means that each letter such as A and so on is a sign and symbol that teaches the meaning of non-arising and so on.

original: phyag rgya'i tshig ces bya ba ni yi ge mang po bsdoms pa las sngags kyi tshig tu brjod du rung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i tshig ces bya ba ni yi ge mang po bsdoms pa las sngags kyi tshig tu brjod du rung ba la bya'o //
translated: The term seal-word refers to the combination of many letters that can be expressed as a mantra word.

original: phan yon nyi shu ni dran pa dang blo gros nas spobs pa dang ldan pa'i bar du phan yon gcig tu bgrang ngo //
analyzed: phan yon nyi shu ni dran pa dang blo gros nas spobs pa dang ldan pa'i bar du phan yon gcig tu bgrang ngo //
translated: The twenty benefits are counted as one benefit, from mindfulness and understanding up to eloquence.

original: gzungs kyi sgo 'di yang nyon mongs pa med par thob cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo 'di yang nyon mongs pa med par thob cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This dhāraṇī gateway is attained without affliction, up to

original: tshul bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba'i bar du yang phan yon gcig tu bgrang ngo //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba'i bar du yang phan yon gcig tu bgrang ngo //
translated: dwelling in accordance with reality is also counted as one benefit.

original: sgra la mkhas pa la sogs pa man chad ni re rer bgrangs na phan yon nyi shur 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: sgra la mkhas pa la sogs pa man chad ni re rer bgrangs na phan yon nyi shur 'gyur ro ;
translated: From skill in sound and below, if counted individually, there are twenty benefits.

original: / theg pa chen po'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: / theg pa chen po'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the Mahāyāna is as explained before.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
translated: In the Extensive Explanation of the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines,

original: le'u bcu pa'o /🔽// / de ltar theg pa chen po gang lags zhes bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: le'u bcu pa'o / // / de ltar theg pa chen po gang lags zhes bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: this is chapter ten.

original: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan /
translated: Thus, what is the Mahāyāna? The Blessed One was asked by Subhūti.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig bstan nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig bstan nas /
translated: In response, the Blessed One taught the twenty-one aspects of the Mahāyāna.

original: de'i 'og tu ji ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa lags zhes zhus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ji ltar na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa lags zhes zhus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach the meaning of the question, “How is it that they have set out in the Great Vehicle?”

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod 'di skad du ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la yang @217a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod 'di skad du ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po la yang @217a * //
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, you have asked, ‘How is it that they have set out in the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattvas?’”

original: dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.🔽Subhūti, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, practicing the six perfections, progress from ground to ground.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar te zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu re re la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing sa nas sar 'phar te zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu re re la yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed
translated: This teaches that they progress from one to the next of the ten bodhisattva grounds, and that they complete the six perfections on each of the ten bodhisattva grounds.

original: cing sa gong nas gong du 'phar ba ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: cing sa gong nas gong du 'phar ba ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is said, “They progress from ground to ground,” and this is how they set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di lta ste chos thams cad 'pho ba med pas chos gang yang 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos thams cad 'pho ba med pas chos gang yang 'ong ba med cing 'gro ba med de /
translated: It is said, “For example, because all phenomena are without transference, no phenomena come or go.”

original: 'pho ba'am nye bar 'pho ba med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar sa nas sar 'phar ba yang kun rdzob tu bstan par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'pho ba'am nye bar 'pho ba med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar sa nas sar 'phar ba yang kun rdzob tu bstan par zad kyi /
translated: “There is no transference or relocation” means that such advancement from level to level is merely taught in terms of the relative.

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pas byang chub sems dpa' sa dang 'phar bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir sa nas sar 'phar zhing 'gro ba dang 'pho ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pas byang chub sems dpa' sa dang 'phar bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir sa nas sar 'phar zhing 'gro ba dang 'pho ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate truth, all phenomena are of one taste in their equalness. Therefore, since the bodhisattva who advances from level to level is not observed, it is taught that there is no advancement from level to level, no going, and no transference.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang 'pho ba dang / nye bar 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni 'phar zhing 'gro ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang 'pho ba dang / nye bar 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni 'phar zhing 'gro ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “Coming, going, transference, and relocation” are synonyms for advancement and going.

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyis gang yin pa de la rlom sems su byed pa'am sems pa med de zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad kyis gang yin pa de la rlom sems su byed pa'am sems pa med de zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: “However, there is no conceiving or thinking in that which is the case with all phenomena” means that in the ultimate truth, all phenomena are of one taste in their equalness.

original: 'pho ba med pas 'phar zhing 'pho bar bya ba'i gnas kyis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'am mtshan mar 'dzin pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pas 'phar zhing 'pho bar bya ba'i gnas kyis rlom sems su 'gyur ba'am mtshan mar 'dzin pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since there is no transference, there is no conceit or grasping at signs of a place to leap over and transfer to.

original: sa yongs su sbyong ba yang mi byed pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'i yon tan rnams thob par mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: sa yongs su sbyong ba yang mi byed pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'i yon tan rnams thob par mi byed pa'am /
translated: It is not the case that he does not purify the grounds, means that he does not fail to attain the qualities of the ten bodhisattva grounds conventionally,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi skyon rnams mi sel ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi skyon rnams mi sel ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or that he does not eliminate the faults that are their antidotes.

original: sa de yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sa yongs su sbyong yang don dam par sa de la dngos por mi lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa de yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar thabs mkhas pas kun rdzob tu sa yongs su sbyong yang don dam par sa de la dngos por mi lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And he does not see that ground, means that, in that way, he does not view that ground as a thing ultimately, even though he purifies the grounds conventionally through his skill in means.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the grounds?

original: rab 'byor sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa yongs su sbyang ba bcu po @217b 'di dag bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas sems yongs
analyzed: rab 'byor sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa yongs su sbyang ba bcu po @217b 'di dag bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas sems yongs
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva abiding on the first ground should accomplish these ten thorough purifications of the ground.

original: su sbyang ba bcu dang ldan na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: su sbyang ba bcu dang ldan na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so on teaches that if the bodhisattva mahāsattva abiding on the first ground possesses the ten thorough purifications of the mind, he has entered the Great Vehicle.🔽What are the ten? The thorough purification of superior intention and so on by way of not apprehending them.

original: bcu gang zhe na de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas thog mar bsam pa yongs su dag par bya ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas thog mar bsam pa yongs su dag par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva abiding on the first ground should first purify his intention.

original: bsam pa yongs su dag pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bsags shing sems yod sa su sbyong ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su🔽sbyang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su dag pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bsags shing sems yod sa su sbyong ba ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The purification of superior intention is the accumulation of many roots of virtue that become the accumulations of merit and wisdom through generating the mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sogs pa'i tshig gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'i yon tan thob par bya ba dang / skyon rnams spong pa'i phyir sems sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i tshig gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'i yon tan thob par bya ba dang / skyon rnams spong pa'i phyir sems sbyong ba'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to the purification of the mind in order to attain the qualities of the ten bodhisattva stages and to abandon their faults.

original: mtshan mi dmigs pa'i phyir phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyong zhing sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams thams cad la nye rid dang / byams sdang med par sems mnyam par byas nas /
analyzed: mtshan mi dmigs pa'i phyir phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyong zhing sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams thams cad la nye rid dang / byams sdang med par sems mnyam par byas nas /
translated: The purification of the attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings is the purification of the attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings, which is the attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings without discrimination, without partiality, and without attachment.

original: bsdu ba rnam bzhi'i dngos pos phan 'dogs shing byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa bzhi sgrub cing phan gdags pa'i mtshan ma dang / sems can du dmigs pa yang med par sems can yongs su sbyong ba ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba zhes bya'o //🔽sbyin pa dang gtong ba dang len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu thabs la mkhas pas sbyin pa yongs su btang yang don dam par sbyin pa'i dngos po dang / gtong ba po dang /
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam bzhi'i dngos pos phan 'dogs shing byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa bzhi sgrub cing phan gdags pa'i mtshan ma dang / sems can du dmigs pa yang med par sems can yongs su sbyong ba ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba zhes bya'o // sbyin pa dang gtong ba dang len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu thabs la mkhas pas sbyin pa yongs su btang yang don dam par sbyin pa'i dngos po dang / gtong ba po dang /
translated: The purification of the equality of the mind towards all beings is the benefit through the four means of unification, and the practice of the four immeasurables, love, compassion, joy, and equanimity, and the sign of benefit, and the purification of beings without objectifying them.🔽The purification of giving is the purification of giving, taking, and the giver, because of the non-apprehension of giving, taking, and the giver.

original: len pa po gsum la dngos por mi lta zhing mchan mar mi 'dzin pa ni sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: len pa po gsum la dngos por mi lta zhing mchan mar mi 'dzin pa ni sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: The purification of giving is the purification of giving, taking, and the giver, because of the non-apprehension of giving, taking, and the giver.

original: des rlom sems su mi bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba dang @218a * //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba dang @218a * //
translated: In order not to be proud of that, there is the thorough preparation of attending to the spiritual master.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This means that in order to attain the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dge ba la yang dag par bskul ba dang / dge ba la 'jog pa dang / bzhag nas kyang dge ba las nyams par mi byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir byas shing bla mar bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba la yang dag par bskul ba dang / dge ba la 'jog pa dang / bzhag nas kyang dge ba las nyams par mi byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir byas shing bla mar bya ste /
translated: one should serve, honor, respect, and venerate such a spiritual master who encourages virtue, establishes virtue, and does not let virtue decline,

original: bsten kyang des rlom sems su mi byed cing mi bsnyems pa ni /
analyzed: bsten kyang des rlom sems su mi byed cing mi bsnyems pa ni /
translated: and even while attending to him, one should not be proud or arrogant.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the thorough preparation of attending to the spiritual master.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i gshes gnyen de las theg pa chen po'i chos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i gshes gnyen de las theg pa chen po'i chos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang /
translated: “Purifying the search for the Dharma” means that, in order to attain omniscience, one listens to the Mahāyāna Dharma from a spiritual master, and one applies oneself to reflection and meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i lud nod cing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bar byed la /🔽don dam par chos de dag mi dmigs pa ni /🔽chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lud nod cing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung bar byed la / don dam par chos de dag mi dmigs pa ni / chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: One does not fall into the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: khyim mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi 'du 'dzi spangs te /
analyzed: khyim mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi 'du 'dzi spangs te /
translated: “Purifying the arising of the household” means that one abandons the distractions of the household and,

original: tshe rabs thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung zhing de la bar chad med par yang byed la ;
analyzed: tshe rabs thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung zhing de la bar chad med par yang byed la ;
translated: in all one’s lives, one goes forth into the teachings of the Tathāgatas. One also ensures that there are no obstacles to that.

original: don dam par 'du 'dzi'i gnas spang bar bya ba'i khyim nyid kyang mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: don dam par 'du 'dzi'i gnas spang bar bya ba'i khyim nyid kyang mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The fact that one does not apprehend even the household which is to be abandoned as a place of distraction in the ultimate sense is

original: yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //🔽mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa mthong nas nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob
analyzed: yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba'o // mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa mthong nas nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob
translated: the purification of the repeated occurrence.🔽The purification of the aspiration for the Buddha's body is due to the non-apprehension of the signs of the major and minor characteristics.

original: kyi bar du sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral bar byed kyang /
analyzed: kyi bar du sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral bar byed kyang /
translated: Even though one sees the Buddha's body adorned with the major and minor characteristics and, until one attains the knowledge of all aspects, one never loses sight of the Buddha,

original: don dam par mtshan dang dpe byad kyi mtshan ma mi dmigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang  ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par mtshan dang dpe byad kyi mtshan ma mi dmigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang  ba'o //
translated: in the ultimate sense one does not apprehend the signs of the major and minor characteristics.

original: chos kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos rnam par 'byed pa yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos rnam par 'byed pa yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The purification of the discernment of the teaching is due to the non-apprehension of the aspects of the teaching.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnams kun rdzob tu rnam par phye zhing ston la /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnams kun rdzob tu rnam par phye zhing ston la /
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings, the twelve branches of the Tathagata's excellent speech are distinguished and taught conventionally.

original: don dam par chos de dag @218b kyang mi dmigs pa ni chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //🔽chos kyi yang dag pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang khengs pa skye ba'i rgyu dbang phyug dang / mang du thos pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin par shes nas nga rgyal dang khengs pa spangs pas nam yang rigs dma' bar mi skye bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: don dam par chos de dag @218b kyang mi dmigs pa ni chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba'o // chos kyi yang dag pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang khengs pa skye ba'i rgyu dbang phyug dang / mang du thos pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin par shes nas nga rgyal dang khengs pa spangs pas nam yang rigs dma' bar mi skye bar byed pa ni /
translated: The purification of the differentiation of phenomena is the non-apprehension of those phenomena ultimately.🔽The purification of the removal of pride and arrogance is the removal of pride and arrogance by knowing that the phenomena which are the causes for the arising of pride and arrogance, such as being a lord or being very learned, do not truly exist. By abandoning pride and arrogance, one causes oneself to never be born into a low caste.

original: nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: The purification of the removal of pride and arrogance is the removal of pride and arrogance by knowing that the phenomena which are the causes for the arising of pride and arrogance, such as being a lord or being very learned, do not truly exist. By abandoning pride and arrogance, one causes oneself to never be born into a low caste.

original: tshig mi dmigs pa'i phyir bden ba'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba ste zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed de /
analyzed: tshig mi dmigs pa'i phyir bden ba'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba ste zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed de /
translated: The purification of true speech is because of the non-apprehension of speech.

original: brdzun du mi smra zhing sems can mi slu ba dang / don dam par tshig mi dmigs pa ni bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun du mi smra zhing sems can mi slu ba dang / don dam par tshig mi dmigs pa ni bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This means that he acts in accordance with whatever he says conventionally, and does not speak falsely or deceive sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la gnas pas yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag
analyzed: rab 'byor yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la gnas pas yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag
translated: Subhuti, these ten purifications are what the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should do while on the first ground.

original: yongs su sbyong na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If he purifies these ten, he is truly practicing the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas chos brgyad po 'di dag yang dang yang du yid la bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas chos brgyad po 'di dag yang dang yang du yid la bya ste /
translated: Subhuti, furthermore, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva on the second ground should repeatedly bring to mind these eight dharmas:🔽 1. The Bodhisattva should be skilled in the aggregates, skilled in the elements, skilled in the sense bases, skilled in dependent origination, and skilled in the distinctions of the various vehicles.

original: de la nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos brgyad yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing nan tan du bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos brgyad yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing nan tan du bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with one should be diligent in that teaches that the bodhisattva who is on the second ground should repeatedly keep in mind and be diligent in eight dharmas.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa la gnas pas /
translated: The purity of morality. The bodhisattva who is on the second ground

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yangs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims yongs su dag par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yangs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims yongs su dag par bya ste /
translated: should purify his morality in order to complete the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa de yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la mi byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la bar chad du 'gyur ba 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi chos rnams yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa de yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la mi byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la bar chad du 'gyur ba 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi chos rnams yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that purity of morality is not keeping in mind the thought of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha, and not keeping in mind the dharmas of immorality that are an obstacle to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la byams @219a * //
analyzed: byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la byams @219a * //
translated: Knowing what has been done and being grateful means to be loving to all sentient beings.

original: pa spel pa'i phyir phan pa cung zad cig byas kyang 'khor pa'i mtha' la thug gi bar du dran zhing byas pa chud mi gson na phan pa chen po byas pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: pa spel pa'i phyir phan pa cung zad cig byas kyang 'khor pa'i mtha' la thug gi bar du dran zhing byas pa chud mi gson na phan pa chen po byas pa lta ci smos te /
translated: Knowing what has been done and being grateful means that even if one has done a small favor for all sentient beings, one does not forget it and one does not let it be wasted until the end of cyclic existence, let alone a great favor.

original: drin du gze zhing phan pa'i lan ldon pa'o //
analyzed: drin du gze zhing phan pa'i lan ldon pa'o //
translated: One is grateful and repays the favor.

original: bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi nyes pa la mi lta ba dang / sems can rnams la gnod sems med cing 'tshe ba med pa'o //🔽rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad theg pa gsum la btsud de yongs su smin par byas na /
analyzed: bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi nyes pa la mi lta ba dang / sems can rnams la gnod sems med cing 'tshe ba med pa'o // rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad theg pa gsum la btsud de yongs su smin par byas na /
translated: Abiding in the power of patience means not looking at the faults of sentient beings and being free of malice and harm toward sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can rab tu dga' zhing spro ba tshim par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rab tu dga' zhing spro ba tshim par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Experiencing great joy and delight means that when one has caused all sentient beings to enter the three vehicles and has brought them to full maturity, one thinks, I have satisfied all sentient beings with great joy and delight.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Never abandoning any sentient being refers to the bodhisattva's accomplishment of the aims of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs shing yongs su skyob ba mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs shing yongs su skyob ba mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Not abandoning any sentient beings means that the bodhisattva, in order to accomplish the aims of sentient beings, does not abandon helping and protecting all sentient beings.

original: snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag bde ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas kyang sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong na snying rje chen pos gdung ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag bde ba phun sum tshogs pa la gnas kyang sems can sdug bsngal ba mthong na snying rje chen pos gdung ste /
translated: Realizing great compassion means that the bodhisattva, even though he is himself established in the perfection of happiness, when he sees suffering sentient beings, he is tormented by great compassion.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba 'di dag sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba 'di dag sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to liberate these suffering sentient beings from suffering,

original: bdag bskal pa du mar sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang bzod par bya ste /🔽sems can de dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ma thob kyi bar du snying rje chen po mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: bdag bskal pa du mar sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal yang bzod par bya ste / sems can de dag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ma thob kyi bar du snying rje chen po mngon du byas nas /
translated: I will endure the sufferings of the hells for many eons.🔽Until those sentient beings attain the wisdom of the Buddha,

original: sems can gyi don la spro zhing skyo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la spro zhing skyo ba med pa'o //
translated: I will realize great compassion and be enthusiastic about the aims of sentient beings without getting discouraged.

original: bla ma bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos ston pa'i mkhan po dang / slob dpon la dad pa dang gus pa bskyed de bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos ston pa'i mkhan po dang / slob dpon la dad pa dang gus pa bskyed de bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
translated: “Honoring and revering the gurus with faith and devotion” means generating faith and devotion toward the preceptors and masters who teach the true Dharma and honoring them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing tshol ba ste zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la brtson zhing don sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing tshol ba ste zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la brtson zhing don sgrub pa'o //
translated: “Striving and seeking the perfections” means striving to practice the six perfections and accomplishing their aims in order to ripen sentient beings and complete the factors of awakening.

original: rab 'byor chos brgyad po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni chos brgyad po de dag yang dang
analyzed: rab 'byor chos brgyad po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni chos brgyad po de dag yang dang
translated: Subhūti, these eight dharmas are those that the bodhisattva mahāsattva should repeatedly keep in mind and practice on the second ground.

original: yang du yid la byed cing de dag la nan tan @219b du byed na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang du yid la byed cing de dag la nan tan @219b du byed na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If they attend to them again and again and practice them, they are practicing the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas dwelling on the third ground🔽should abide in five dharmas.

original: chos lnga la gnas par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa gsum pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnas par bya ba'i chos lnga bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos lnga la gnas par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa gsum pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnas par bya ba'i chos lnga bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the five dharmas to be practiced by bodhisattvas dwelling on the third ground.

original: mang du thos pas mi ngoms shing de la yang yi ge la mngon par ma zhen pa dang zhes  bya ba ni /
analyzed: mang du thos pas mi ngoms shing de la yang yi ge la mngon par ma zhen pa dang zhes  bya ba ni /
translated: Not being satisfied with much listening, and not being attached to the letters.
