original: byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum pa rang bzhin gyis mang du thos pa tshol te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum pa rang bzhin gyis mang du thos pa tshol te /
translated: Bodhisattvas on the third ground naturally seek much listening.

original: dam pa'i chos tshigs su bcad pa gcig mnyan pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos tshigs su bcad pa gcig mnyan pa'i phyir yang /
translated: For the sake of listening to a single verse of the sublime Dharma,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis gang ba yang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis gang ba yang /
translated: they would cross a great trichiliocosm filled with fire.

original: brgal zhing 'gro ba lta bur kun rdzob tu mang du thos pas chog mi shes par byed kyang /
analyzed: brgal zhing 'gro ba lta bur kun rdzob tu mang du thos pas chog mi shes par byed kyang /
translated: Although they are like someone who has crossed over and gone to the other side, they are not satisfied with their extensive learning in the conventional sense.

original: don dam par tshig dang yi ge la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing chags par yang mi  byed pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par tshig dang yi ge la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing chags par yang mi  byed pa'o //
translated: But ultimately, they do not grasp at words and letters as having any characteristics, nor do they become attached to them.

original: zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par byed cing /
analyzed: zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par byed cing /
translated: They make the gift of Dharma without any material reward.

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And they do not become conceited about it.

original: de ltar mang du thos pa bstsags nas gzhan la chos ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar mang du thos pa bstsags nas gzhan la chos ston pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when they have accumulated extensive learning and are teaching the Dharma to others,

original: chos bstan pa de'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya bar yang mi sems na 'jig rten gyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob par bya bar sems pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: chos bstan pa de'i 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya bar yang mi sems na 'jig rten gyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob par bya bar sems pa lta ci smos te /
translated: they do not even think about attaining the result of their teaching of the Dharma, namely, unsurpassable enlightenment, let alone about obtaining mundane gain and honor.

original: de ltar chos kyi sbyin pa byas pa'i 'bras bu la re ba med cing /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi sbyin pa byas pa'i 'bras bu la re ba med cing /
translated: Thus, they have no hope for the result of their gift of the Dharma,

original: chos kyi sbyin pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed pa ni zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed pa ni zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa byed pa'o //
translated: and they do not become conceited about their gift of the Dharma. This is the gift of the Dharma without any material reward.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo yang des rlom sems mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed pa'i tshe /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nam bdag sangs rgyas su gyur pa'i tshe bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo zhing des kyang rlom sems su mi byed cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo yang des rlom sems mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed pa'i tshe / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nam bdag sangs rgyas su gyur pa'i tshe bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo zhing des kyang rlom sems su mi byed cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and they generate the wholesome roots for purifying a buddhafield and dedicate them, but they do not become conceited because of that.🔽When they generate the wholesome roots that lead to a pure buddhafield, they dedicate them with the thought, “By these wholesome roots, when I have become a Buddha, may my buddhafield be pure!” But they do not become conceited because of that, and do not grasp it as a sign.

original: dpag tu med pa'i 'khor bas yongs su skyo ba med cing des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis sems @220a * //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i 'khor bas yongs su skyo ba med cing des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis sems @220a * //
translated: They are not discouraged by the immensity of cyclic existence, and they do not become conceited because of that.

original: can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu bskyed pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du 'khor ba la gnas shing /
analyzed: can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu bskyed pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur gyi bar du 'khor ba la gnas shing /
translated: They will remain in cyclic existence until they have completed the perfection of omniscience, and they will not be discouraged by the long duration of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba yun ring pos mi skyo bar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed kyang des rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba yun ring pos mi skyo bar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed kyang des rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even though they will generate roots of virtue, they will not be proud of that.🔽They will abide in a sense of shame and a sense of decency, but they will not be proud of that.

original: ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas kyang des rlom sems su mi 'gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas bya ba mi rigs pa rnams byas na ngo tsha zhing khrel gyis dogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas kyang des rlom sems su mi 'gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas bya ba mi rigs pa rnams byas na ngo tsha zhing khrel gyis dogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas will feel ashamed and embarrassed if they do things that are not right.

original: byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
translated: Bodhisattvas will generate the intention to achieve unsurpassed awakening.

original: de'i 'og tu nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed na byang chub sems dpa' la khrel ba dang ngo tsha bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed na byang chub sems dpa' la khrel ba dang ngo tsha bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he generates the thought of the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha after that, he would be ashamed and embarrassed before the bodhisattva.

original: de bas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems mi bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas pa'o //🔽rab 'byor chos lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gsum pa la gnas par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni chos lnga po de dag la gnas na /
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems mi bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas pa'o // rab 'byor chos lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gsum pa la gnas par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni chos lnga po de dag la gnas na /
translated: Therefore, not generating the thought of the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha is the bodhisattva’s abiding in shame and embarrassment.🔽Subhūti, these five dharmas are those in which the bodhisattva mahāsattva should abide on the third ground.”

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if one abides in these five dharmas, one is correctly engaged in the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas chos bcu po 'di dag yongs su blangs shing gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas chos bcu po 'di dag yongs su blangs shing gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva on the fourth ground should take up and abide in ten dharmas.

original: de la yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bzhi pa la gnas pas spyad par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bzhi pa la gnas pas spyad par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: One should not give away and so on indicates what should be practiced by the bodhisattva abiding on the fourth ground.

original: dgon pa la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni nags tshogs dgon pa na gnas pa 'ba' zhig la mi bya'i /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni nags tshogs dgon pa na gnas pa 'ba' zhig la mi bya'i /
translated: Abiding in the forest does not refer only to dwelling in a forest, a remote place.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dman pa dang ma 'dres par gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs shing chos gang la yang dngos por mi 'dzin pa nyid sems dben pa la gnas pas dgon pa la gnas pa yin
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la bya ba dman pa dang ma 'dres par gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs shing chos gang la yang dngos por mi 'dzin pa nyid sems dben pa la gnas pas dgon pa la gnas pa yin
translated: Abiding in the forest is to dwell in the solitude of mind, which is to be free of the inferior, unmixed attitudes of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, to realize the selflessness of both persons and phenomena and not to apprehend any phenomenon as a thing.

original: no // 'dod pa chung ba rnams dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang chags pa dang @220b 'dod pa mi skyed na /
analyzed: no // 'dod pa chung ba rnams dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang chags pa dang @220b 'dod pa mi skyed na /
translated: Having few desires means that if the bodhisattva does not generate attachment and desire even for unsurpassed, complete, perfect enlightenment,

original: 'jig rten gyi lus dang longs spyod la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lus dang longs spyod la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: what need is there to mention worldly bodies and resources?

original: de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lus dang longs spyod la ma chags shing 'dod pa mi skye ba ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lus dang longs spyod la ma chags shing 'dod pa mi skye ba ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: Thus, not being attached to the mundane and supramundane body and possessions, and not giving rise to desire, is having few desires.

original: chog shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyas kyang de la dngos por mi 'dzin cing des rlom sems su mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: chog shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyas kyang de la dngos por mi 'dzin cing des rlom sems su mi 'gyur na /
translated: Contentment means that even if a bodhisattva is despised for his omniscience, he does not grasp at it as real and does not become conceited by it.

original: 'jig rten gyi lus dang longs spyod pa chags shing de bas lhag pa gzhan tshol ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lus dang longs spyod pa chags shing de bas lhag pa gzhan tshol ba lta ci smos te /
translated: How much less would he be attached to mundane bodies and possessions and seek something higher?

original: de ltar snga ma rnyed pa tsam gyis chog gis gzhan lhag pa mi tshol ba la chog shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar snga ma rnyed pa tsam gyis chog gis gzhan lhag pa mi tshol ba la chog shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, being content with just what one has obtained in the past, not seeking anything higher, is called contentment.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi sdom pa mi gtong ba dang zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo rtogs nas chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung bar sdom pa mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi sdom pa mi gtong ba dang zhes bya ba ni chos zab mo rtogs nas chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung bar sdom pa mi gtong ba ste /
translated: Not abandoning the vows of ascetic practices means that, having realized the profound Dharma, one does not abandon the vows that prevent the arising of conceptual grasping at signs in phenomena.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa la sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi sdom pa yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya'i phyag dar khrod pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa la sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi sdom pa yongs su mi gtong ba zhes bya'i phyag dar khrod pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la ni mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, the one who has the good qualities of purification should not be called a “wearer of cast-off rags” and so on, unless he has completely given up the vow of the good qualities of purification.

original: bslab pa yongs su mi gtang ba dang zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpas bslab pa don du sgrub pa ni rnam par mi rtog par bslab pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa yongs su mi gtang ba dang zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpas bslab pa don du sgrub pa ni rnam par mi rtog par bslab pa ste /
translated: “Not giving up the training” means that the bodhisattva’s practice of the training is the non-conceptual training.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i bslab pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i bslab pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnams yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: He does not pay attention to the conceptual trainings of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la smad pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la skyon du mthong zhing chags pha'i sems mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la smad pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la skyon du mthong zhing chags pha'i sems mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Contempt for the sense pleasures” means that he sees the five sense pleasures as faults and does not arouse a desirous mind.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la mngon par 'du mi byed cing rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la mngon par 'du mi byed cing rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The generation of the thought endowed with the transcendence of suffering is the non-performance and non-conception of the dharmas which become the cause of cyclic life.

original: rdzas thams cad yongs su gtang ba dang zhes bya ba ni phyi nang dngos po thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dngos por mi lta ba nyid du yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas thams cad yongs su gtang ba dang zhes bya ba ni phyi nang dngos po thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dngos por mi lta ba nyid du yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: The total relinquishment of all possessions is the relinquishment of all internal and external things, without apprehending them as signs and without viewing them as things.

original: sems zhum pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul la sems mi 'brang zhing ma chags pa la sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya'o //🔽dngos po thams cad la ltos pa @221a * //
analyzed: sems zhum pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul la sems mi 'brang zhing ma chags pa la sems zhum pa med pa zhes bya'o // dngos po thams cad la ltos pa @221a * //
translated: The non-dejection of mind is the non-dejection of mind which is not attached to the objects of consciousness.

original: med pa ste zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad dngos por mi lta zhing yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ste zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad dngos por mi lta zhing yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: The non-regard for all things is the non-regard and non-attention to all internal and external things as things.

original: rab 'byor chos bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas yongs su gtong bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas yongs su gtong bar mi bya zhing /
translated: Subhūti, these ten dharmas are not to be relinquished by the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is on the fourth ground,🔽and having taken them up, he should abide in them.

original: yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni sa bzhi pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos bcu po de dag la gnas shing yongs su ma btang na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes🔽bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa lnga pa la gnas pas chos drug po 'di dag yongs su spang bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ba dag go zhes bya ba ni sa bzhi pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos bcu po de dag la gnas shing yongs su ma btang na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa lnga pa la gnas pas chos drug po 'di dag yongs su spang bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la sogs pas /
translated: This teaches that if the bodhisattva who is on the fourth ground abides in and does not relinquish these ten dharmas, he is one who has correctly entered the Great Vehicle.🔽Subhūti, moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is on the fifth ground should completely abandon these six dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yongs su spang bar bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yongs su spang bar bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the bodhisattva who is on the fifth ground and so forth should completely abandon the dharmas that are faults of a bodhisattva.

original: khyim pa dang bsten pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir khyim pa dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa spang bar bya ba 'ba' zhigs la ni mi bya'o /
analyzed: khyim pa dang bsten pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir khyim pa dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa spang bar bya ba 'ba' zhigs la ni mi bya'o /
translated: “Abandoning reliance on householders” means that one should not rely on householders in this context, but not that one should not rely on them at all.

original: khyim gyi gnas 'du 'dzi can spangs te /
analyzed: khyim gyi gnas 'du 'dzi can spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned the household life with its distractions,

original: rab tu byung nas skra dang kha spu bregs shing gos ngur smrig bgos te /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas skra dang kha spu bregs shing gos ngur smrig bgos te /
translated: having gone forth, having shaved off one’s hair and beard, and having put on saffron robes,

original: sems can gyi don spyad par bya ba'i khyim gyi gnas bsten par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don spyad par bya ba'i khyim gyi gnas bsten par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: one should not rely on the household life, which is the basis for engaging in benefiting sentient beings.

original: dge slong ma dang bsten pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la chags pa dang / gos la sogs pa zang zing la chags pa'i sems kyis dge slong ma dang se gol gtogs pa tsam yang lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang bsten pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la chags pa dang / gos la sogs pa zang zing la chags pa'i sems kyis dge slong ma dang se gol gtogs pa tsam yang lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: “Abandoning reliance on nuns” means that one should not stay together with a nun, even for the time it takes to snap one’s fingers, with a mind attached to the desire for sexual intercourse or attached to material things such as clothing.

original: rigs la ser sna med pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi rigs gang gi khyim du chud cing rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byas pa'i khyim der gzhan dag chud cing rnyed pa dang /
analyzed: rigs la ser sna med pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid rgyal rigs dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag gi rigs gang gi khyim du chud cing rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byas pa'i khyim der gzhan dag chud cing rnyed pa dang /
translated: Not being stingy with one's family means that when a bodhisattva has entered a family of the royal class, the priestly class, or the business class, and is being honored and respected in that family, he or she does not prevent others from entering that family and being honored and respected.

original: bkur sti byas na 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: bkur sti byas na 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: “Not being stingy about one’s family” means that when a bodhisattva has entered the families of the kṣatriyas, the brahmins, and the householders, and is honored and respected in those families, he or she should think,

original: sems can 'di dag bdag gis bde ba'i yo byad thams cad sbyar ba'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag bdag gis bde ba'i yo byad thams cad sbyar ba'i rigs pa las /
translated: “It is right for me to provide all the necessities for the happiness of these beings.

original: sems can de dag bdag cag rang rang gi bsod nams kyis bde bar 'gyur na de la bdag gis ser sna dang phrag dog mi bya'o snyam du sems shing phrag @221b dog mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag bdag cag rang rang gi bsod nams kyis bde bar 'gyur na de la bdag gis ser sna dang phrag dog mi bya'o snyam du sems shing phrag @221b dog mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: If those beings become happy through their own merit, I should not be jealous of that.”

original: 'du 'dzi'i gnas dang zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir mi mang po'i 'du 'dzi spang pa 'ba' zhig la mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i gnas dang zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir mi mang po'i 'du 'dzi spang pa 'ba' zhig la mi bya'i /
translated: “Not being in a place of confusion” means that in this context, one should not just avoid the confusion of a crowd of people.

original: gang na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yod pa'am /
analyzed: gang na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas yod pa'am /
translated: One should also avoid being in a place where there are śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam zer ba yod pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos sam rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam zer ba yod pa'am /
translated: Or, the discourse of the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i gnas de lta bur byang chub sems dpa' gnas par bya ba la 'du 'dzi'i gnas yongs su spang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i sems bskyed par 'gyur ba'i gnas de lta bur byang chub sems dpa' gnas par bya ba la 'du 'dzi'i gnas yongs su spang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's dwelling in a place where there is no opportunity to generate the thought of the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is called the avoidance of places of distraction.

original: gnod sems dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams la gnod pa dang 'tshe bar 'gyur ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: gnod sems dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams la gnod pa dang 'tshe bar 'gyur ba'i sems sam /
translated: The avoidance of malice means that the bodhisattva does not generate a thought of harm or injury toward sentient beings,

original: thab mo dang rtsod par 'gyur ba'i sems mi bskyed pa la gnod sems yongs su spang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thab mo dang rtsod par 'gyur ba'i sems mi bskyed pa la gnod sems yongs su spang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: or a thought of contention or dispute. It is called the avoidance of malice.

original: bdag pa stod cing gzhan smod pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan du bye brag tu mi 'byed cing tha dad du mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag pa stod cing gzhan smod pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas bdag dang gzhan du bye brag tu mi 'byed cing tha dad du mi lta ba'o //
translated: The avoidance of self-praise and disparagement of others means that, because of the realization of the ultimate equality of all things, one does not distinguish self and other, nor view them as different.

original: chos drug po de dag ni yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa lnga pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos drug po de dag yongs su spangs na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos drug po de dag ni yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa lnga pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos drug po de dag yongs su spangs na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: These six dharmas are to be completely abandoned. This teaches that if the bodhisattva who is in the fifth stage completely abandons these six dharmas, he is truly engaged in the Great Vehicle.

original: yang chos bco brgyad yongs su spang bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni sa lnga pa la gnas pas spang bar bya ba'i chos drug po de dag tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang chos bco brgyad yongs su spang bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni sa lnga pa la gnas pas spang bar bya ba'i chos drug po de dag tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Again, the eighteen dharmas are to be completely abandoned. This teaches that not only are the six dharmas to be abandoned by one who is in the fifth stage,

original: gzhan yang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal la sogs pa chos bco brgyad kyang yongs su spong bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal la sogs pa chos bco brgyad kyang yongs su spong bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: but also the eighteen dharmas such as the ten unwholesome courses of action and the excessive pride are to be completely abandoned.

original: 'di ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / ngag gis brdzun du smra ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / ngag gis brdzun du smra ba dang /
translated: These are taking life, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct with the body;🔽lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle talk with the voice;

original: phra ma zer ba dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig khyal  pa zer ba dang / yid kyis log par lta ba dang / gnod sems dang / chags sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: phra ma zer ba dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / tshig khyal  pa zer ba dang / yid kyis log par lta ba dang / gnod sems dang / chags sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: and covetousness, ill will, and wrong view with the mind.

original: chos bcu po 'di dag spyad na bde 'gro thob par bya ba la yang bar du gcod par 'gyur na /🔽'phags pa'i lam dang / bla na med pa yang dag par @222a * //
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag spyad na bde 'gro thob par bya ba la yang bar du gcod par 'gyur na / 'phags pa'i lam dang / bla na med pa yang dag par @222a * //
translated: If engaging in these ten dharmas obstructs even attaining a happy rebirth,🔽what need is there to mention attaining the noble path and unsurpassed,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam nas /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam nas /
translated: perfect, complete awakening?”

original: mi dge bcu'i las kyi bag chags yan chad kyang yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge bcu'i las kyi bag chags yan chad kyang yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: Thus, one completely abandons even the latent tendencies for the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang zhes bya ba ni rigs btsun pa dang / mang du thos pa la sogs pa yon tan gang gis nga rgyal skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu don dam par gang yang dngos po yod par mi lta bas de'i phyir bdag yon tan 'di lta bus gzhan las lhag go snyam pa'i nga rgyal skye ba🔽med pa la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang zhes bya ba ni rigs btsun pa dang / mang du thos pa la sogs pa yon tan gang gis nga rgyal skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu don dam par gang yang dngos po yod par mi lta bas de'i phyir bdag yon tan 'di lta bus gzhan las lhag go snyam pa'i nga rgyal skye ba med pa la /
translated: Therefore, one does not give rise to the pride of thinking, “I am superior to others in terms of such and such qualities.”

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal yongs su spang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal yongs su spang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “abandoning excessive pride.”

original: khengs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la brnyas pa'i sems kyis khengs pa skyes te /
analyzed: khengs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la brnyas pa'i sems kyis khengs pa skyes te /
translated: “Arrogance” means that one gives rise to arrogance with a mind that despises other sentient beings.

original: de ltar brnyas par bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu don dam par mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar brnyas par bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu don dam par mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since such a thing to be despised is not observed ultimately,

original: khengs pa yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: khengs pa yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: one abandons arrogance.

original: phyin ci log rnams dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las dngos po yod par lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log rnams dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pa las dngos po yod par lta ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i phyin ci log yin te /
translated: “Distortions” are the bodhisattva’s distortions from the emptiness nature of all things, such as the view that things exist.

original: chos thams cad la dngos po yod par mi lta ba ni phyin ci log yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dngos po yod par mi lta ba ni phyin ci log yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of distortions is the bodhisattva’s non-view of the existence of all things.

original: the tshom dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yid gnyis mi za ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yid gnyis mi za ba'o //
translated: “Doubt” is the bodhisattva’s non-doubt about suchness and unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyams rangs su mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po gang la chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug par 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyams rangs su mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po gang la chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug par 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang ;
translated: “Not indulging in desire, hatred, and ignorance” means that the bodhisattva does not see any thing as a basis for desire, hatred, or ignorance, and does not see desire, hatred, or ignorance themselves.

original: tig mug nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas de dag nyams rangs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: tig mug nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas de dag nyams rangs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Thus, he or she does not indulge in them.

original: chos bco brgyad po dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos bco brgyad po dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eighteen dharmas are to be abandoned by the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dwelling on the fifth ground.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la gnas pas skyon du 'gyur ba'i chos bco brgyad po 'di rnams yongs su spangs na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la gnas pas skyon du 'gyur ba'i chos bco brgyad po 'di rnams yongs su spangs na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if the bodhisattva dwelling on the fifth ground abandons these eighteen dharmas that are faults, he is one who has correctly entered the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos drug pa la gnas pas chos drug @222b yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la stogs  pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos drug pa la gnas pas chos drug @222b yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la stogs  pa ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dwelling on the sixth ground should complete six dharmas.

original: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the bodhisattva dwelling on the sixth ground should complete the six perfections and abandon six dharmas.

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas na /
translated: Thus, one should complete the six perfections.

original: shes par bya ba thams cad kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba thams cad kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: One should complete the six perfections because one will reach the culmination of all that is to be known.🔽Moreover, one should abandon six dharmas.

original: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: This shows that the bodhisattva who is in the sixth stage not only completes the six perfections,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i chos drug kyang yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i chos drug kyang yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: but also abandons six dharmas that are faults for the bodhisattva.

original: de dag kyang rang log tu zad do //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang log tu zad do //
translated: And these are just the opposite of those.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu mi bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa la gnas pas bya ba ma yin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu mi bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa la gnas pas bya ba ma yin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa ste /
translated: Here, the twenty dharmas that should not be done and the twenty dharmas that should be completed by the Bodhisattva who stands on the seventh stage are taught.

original: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa bzhi mi bya'o zhes smos pa ni mu stegs can gyi bdag tu lta ba rnams ni sa dang po la spangs zin pas skabs 'dir de dag spong ba la ni mi bya'i /🔽sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa bzhi mi bya'o zhes smos pa ni mu stegs can gyi bdag tu lta ba rnams ni sa dang po la spangs zin pas skabs 'dir de dag spong ba la ni mi bya'i / sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: There, the four should not dos beginning with should not grasp at a self, should not grasp at a living being are not to be done in order to abandon the views of the tirthikas' self, which were already abandoned on the first stage.🔽Here, the Bodhisattva who stands on the seventh stage should not grasp at the signs of a self, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du yang bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mar bzung bar mi bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du yang bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i mtshan mar bzung bar mi bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: because he is established in the signless.

original: chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin par mi bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gag pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin par mi bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gag pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not hold to annihilation or to permanence, because all dharmas are understood to be without origination and without cessation.

original: mtshan ma'i 'du shes su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yin pas mtshan ma'i 'du shes byung na byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'du shes su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa yin pas mtshan ma'i 'du shes byung na byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not form the notion of a sign, because the bodhisattva who is in the seventh stage is situated in the signless, and the occurrence of the notion of a sign would be a defilement for the bodhisattva.

original: rgyur lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bar lta ba'i mtshan ma dang yang bral pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyur lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bar lta ba'i mtshan ma dang yang bral pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not hold to the view of causality, because one is also free from the sign of the view that the effect arises from a cause.

original: ming dang / gzugs @223a * //
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs @223a * //
translated: One should not settle down in name-and-form,

original: dang ; phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / khams gsum la mngon par chags par mi bya ba ni don dam par de dag dngos po yod par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ; phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / khams gsum la mngon par chags par mi bya ba ni don dam par de dag dngos po yod par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, or the three worlds, because ultimately they are not established as existent things.

original: khams gsum la mngon par chags pa dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / brten pa dang / gnas pa ni mngon par chags pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: khams gsum la mngon par chags pa dang / mngon par zhen pa dang / brten pa dang / gnas pa ni mngon par chags pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
translated: Attachment, clinging, reliance, and abiding in the three realms are synonyms for attachment.

original: sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa la dngos por lta ba la brten pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa la dngos por lta ba la brten pas /
translated: Attachment to views based on the Buddha means that one does not see the Buddha because one relies on viewing the Buddha’s form body endowed with the major and minor marks as a thing.

original: sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas ni chos nyid du blta'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas ni chos nyid du blta'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that the Buddha should be seen as reality dharmata.

original: chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya ba ni lung gi chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang thob par bya ba'i chos stobs dang / mi 'jigs ba la sogs pa la dngos por lta bas chos kyi chos nyid mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya ba ni lung gi chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang thob par bya ba'i chos stobs dang / mi 'jigs ba la sogs pa la dngos por lta bas chos kyi chos nyid mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: One should not be attached to views based on the Dharma because one does not see the reality of the Dharma through viewing the scriptural Dharma of the twelve branches of excellent speech and the Dharma to be obtained, such as the powers and fearlessnesses, as things.

original: de bas na chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not be attached to views based on the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / so so'i skye bo'i dge 'dun la dngos por lta ba la chags na mtshan mar 'dzin pa la chags pas yang dag par dge 'dun mthong bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun dang / so so'i skye bo'i dge 'dun la dngos por lta ba la chags na mtshan mar 'dzin pa la chags pas yang dag par dge 'dun mthong bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: “ Attachment to views based on the Saṅgha” means that if one is attached to the view that the Saṅgha of Noble Ones and the Saṅgha of ordinary beings are real entities, then one is attached to grasping at signs, and one will not see the Saṅgha correctly.

original: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma tsam du bltas la don dam par de la yang dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma tsam du bltas la don dam par de la yang dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that one should view them as mere illusions on the conventional level, and ultimately one should not grasp at them as real entities or have signs about them.

original: tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / nyan thos kyi sdom pa rnams la dngos por lta zhing mtshan mar 'dzin na tshul khrims rnam par dag par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang / nyan thos kyi sdom pa rnams la dngos por lta zhing mtshan mar 'dzin na tshul khrims rnam par dag par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: “ Attachment to views based on morality” means that if one views the bodhisattva vows and the śrāvaka vows as real entities and grasps at signs, then one’s morality will not be pure.

original: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma tsam du bltas la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgyu ma tsam du bltas la /
translated: One should view them as mere illusions on the conventional level,🔽and ultimately one should not grasp at them as real entities or have signs about them.

original: don dam par de la yang dngos por mi lta zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin na tshul khrims rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don dam par de la yang dngos por mi lta zhing mtshan mar mi 'dzin na tshul khrims rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: If, ultimately, one does not see it as a thing and does not grasp it as a sign, then morality becomes pure.

original: de bas tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not become attached to the view that is based on morality.

original: chos thams cad stong ngo zhes zhum par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med de stong yang las legs nyes kyi 'bras bu skyid sdug kyang med do snyam nas stong pas @223b skrag cing sems zhum par mi bya ste
analyzed: chos thams cad stong ngo zhes zhum par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med de stong yang las legs nyes kyi 'bras bu skyid sdug kyang med do snyam nas stong pas @223b skrag cing sems zhum par mi bya ste
translated: “ One should not become frightened and discouraged by the thought that all phenomena are empty” means that, ultimately, all phenomena are not things and are empty, but one should not become frightened and discouraged by emptiness, thinking that there is no happiness or suffering, no effect of good or bad actions.

original: / kun rdzob tu sgyu ma tsam du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos shig gud na yod na ni //
analyzed: / kun rdzob tu sgyu ma tsam du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos shig gud na yod na ni //
translated: This is because, on the conventional level, they are not merely nonexistent, like an illusion.🔽“ Contradictory to emptiness” means that if there were some phenomenon called “emptiness” that existed separately,

original: chos thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba de stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa ma yin pas 'gal bar yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba de stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa ma yin pas 'gal bar yang 'gyur na /
translated: then it would be contradictory to say that all phenomena are empty, because emptiness would not be empty by nature.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i nang du stong pa nyid kyang med par 'dus pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i nang du stong pa nyid kyang med par 'dus pas /
translated: In the emptiness of all dharmas even emptiness is included as nonexistent.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba la 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid dang 'gal bar mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, one should not contradict emptiness.

original: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po de dag ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po de dag ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhuti, these twenty dharmas are not to be done means

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos nyi shu po de dag ma byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos nyi shu po de dag ma byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: that if the bodhisattva abiding on the seventh ground does not do these twenty dharmas, he is said to have truly entered the Great Vehicle.

original: des chos nyi shu po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: des chos nyi shu po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with He should complete these twenty dharmas teaches that the bodhisattva abiding on the seventh ground should complete twenty dharmas.

original: stong pa nyid rdzogs par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang yod par mi lta'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rdzogs par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang yod par mi lta'o //
translated: “The perfection of emptiness” means that one does not even consider the own-mark of emptiness to exist.

original: mtshan ma med pas mngon du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas mtshan ma gang yang yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas mngon du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas mtshan ma gang yang yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: “The realization of the signless” means that, since all dharmas are empty of own-marks in this way, one does not pay attention to any sign.

original: smon pa med pa zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi chos thams cad la ma chags shing mi smon pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi chos thams cad la ma chags shing mi smon pa'o //
translated: “The wishless” means that one is not attached to, and does not wish for, any dharma in the three worlds.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The purification of the three spheres” means

original: skabs 'dir lus dang / ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas nyes pa dang / skyon mi 'byung bar dge ba bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir lus dang / ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas nyes pa dang / skyon mi 'byung bar dge ba bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: that, in this context, one does not allow faults and downfalls to occur through body, speech, or mind, and that one perfects the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Compassion and pity for all beings” means that one has the great compassion of a bodhisattva.

original: sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa chen po dang ldan pas sems can thams cad la brnyas shing smad par mi byed pa'o //🔽chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya @224a * //
analyzed: sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa chen po dang ldan pas sems can thams cad la brnyas shing smad par mi byed pa'o // chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya @224a * //
translated: “One should not despise those sentient beings” means that, endowed with the bodhisattvas’ great love, one should not despise or disparage any sentient being.

original: ngan las 'das pa gnyis bye brag tu mi 'byed cing blang dor med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: ngan las 'das pa gnyis bye brag tu mi 'byed cing blang dor med par lta ba'o //
translated: “One should view all phenomena as the same” means that one does not distinguish between the two, cyclic existence and nirvana, and one views them without accepting or rejecting.

original: yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs shing des rlom sems su mi byang dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med ba'i rang bzhin du tshul gcig tu rtogs shing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs shing des rlom sems su mi byang dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med ba'i rang bzhin du tshul gcig tu rtogs shing /
translated: “One should realize the correct way and not be conceited about it” means that one realizes that all phenomena are the same in being the nature of ultimate unreality.

original: de ltar rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa gnyis dmigs su med par rtogs pa med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa gnyis dmigs su med par rtogs pa med par shes pa'o //
translated: One should understand that the object of that realization and the one who realizes it are non-apprehensible.

original: mi skye ba la bzod pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par rtogs par nus shing skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pas mi skrag pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba la bzod pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par rtogs par nus shing skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pas mi skrag pa'o //
translated: Patience with unborn dharmas means being able to realize that all dharmas are unborn and unceasing, and not being afraid of the unborn and unceasing.

original: mi skye ba shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi skye bar bzod pa'i 'og tu chos thams cad mi skye bar shes ba'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi skye bar bzod pa'i 'og tu chos thams cad mi skye bar shes ba'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: Knowledge of the unborn means that after one has patiently accepted that all dharmas are unborn, the spontaneous wisdom of knowing that all dharmas are unborn arises.

original: chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tshul gcig ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du tshul gcig ste /
translated: Teaching all dharmas as having a single mode means that all dharmas have a single mode, the nature of suchness.

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa mtha' gnyis su mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa mtha' gnyis su mi ston pa'o //
translated: It does not teach the two extremes of existence and nonexistence, permanence and impermanence, and so on.

original: rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Correct elimination of conceptualization means that conceptualization is a bodhisattva's affliction.

original: chos thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad la mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad la mtshan mar 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are also free from the apprehension of and conceptualization about any characteristics.

original: lta ba rnam par zlog pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba dman pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnam par zlog pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta ba dman pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: “Turning away from views” means turning away from the inferior views of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis 'khor bar skye ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis 'khor bar skye ba'i nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
translated: “Turning away from afflictions” means not linking up with birth in saṃsāra due to the power of the latent tendencies of the afflictions.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin las kyang ma nyams la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin las kyang ma nyams la /
translated: “The levels of śamatha and vipaśyanā” means that [bodhisattvas] do not fall from the samādhi of the wisdom of omniscience,

original: lhag mthong gis chos thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gis chos thams cad kyang rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa'o //
translated: and with vipaśyanā they know all phenomena in all their aspects.

original: dul ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la sems ma yengs shing ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: dul ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la sems ma yengs shing ma chags pa'o //
translated: “A disciplined mind” means that the mind is undistracted and unattached to the things of the three realms.

original: zhi ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug yul drug la ma 'phros shing ma yengs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po drug yul drug la ma 'phros shing ma yengs pa'o //
translated: The line with a peaceful mind means that the six senses are not scattered to the six objects, and are not distracted.

original: thogs @224b pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la thags thogs med par mkhyen pa'o //🔽byams pa'i skabs shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i byams pa ltar phyogs gcig la byams la phyogs gcig la sdang pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thogs @224b pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la thags thogs med par mkhyen pa'o // byams pa'i skabs shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i byams pa ltar phyogs gcig la byams la phyogs gcig la sdang pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The line without obstruction means that with the eye of a buddha, one knows all mundane and supramundane phenomena without obstruction.

original: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms shing btang snyoms su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms shing btang snyoms su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The line with an understanding of the occasion of love means that, unlike the love of ordinary beings, which is loving toward one side and hostile toward another, one is impartial and neutral toward all sentient beings.

original: gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa yod ba de dag gis lus ston cing 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa yod ba de dag gis lus ston cing 'gro ba'o //
translated: The line going wherever one wishes to go means that one goes to the buddhafields, displaying one's body in the pure circles of the retinue of the tathagatas in whatever buddhafields one wishes.

original: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdun pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdun pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa la gnas pas /
translated: Subhuti, these twenty dharmas are to be completed by the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva dwelling on the seventh stage.

original: chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if the Bodhisattva dwelling on the seventh stage completes these dharmas, he is truly engaged in the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Subhuti, furthermore, the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva dwelling on the eighth stage should complete these four dharmas... and so on.

original: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the dharmas to be completed by the Bodhisattva dwelling on the eighth stage.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems khong du chud pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig thang cig la dus gcig tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems khong du chud pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig thang cig la dus gcig tu shes pa'o //
translated: The line penetrating the minds of all sentient beings means that a single thought of a bodhisattva knows the minds and mental factors of all sentient beings in a single instant.

original: mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba dang zhes bya ba ni mngon bar shes pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rdzu 'phrul gyis rgyu zhing sangs rgyas rnams lta ba'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba dang zhes bya ba ni mngon bar shes pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rdzu 'phrul gyis rgyu zhing sangs rgyas rnams lta ba'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: The line playing with the superknowledges means that by the power of the superknowledges, one travels by means of magical emanations from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to see the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag yongs su sgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag yongs su sgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line seeing the buddhafields and accomplishing those buddhafields as they are seen means that

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gcig na 'dug cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gcig na 'dug cing /
translated: a bodhisattva, while remaining in one buddhafield, sees the buddhafields of other buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa rnams mthong bar byas nas ji ltar mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi @225a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa rnams mthong bar byas nas ji ltar mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi @225a * //
translated: Having seen the immeasurable buddha-fields,

original: zhing de dag sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhing de dag sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to achieve those buddha-fields as they have been seen,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyal srid kyang yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyal srid kyang yongs su btang nas /
translated: they give up even the sovereignty of a trichiliocosm,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: and they dwell in those buddha-fields.🔽They serve the buddhas and investigate the body of the buddhas as it truly is.

original: sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur zhing sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur zhing sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to benefit all beings,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: they ripen the true Dharma and

original: chos kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: they realize the body of the Dharma as it truly is.

original: rab 'byor bzhi po de dag ni yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i chos so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos de bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes🔽bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor bzhi po de dag ni yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i chos so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos de bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pas /
translated: This teaches that if the bodhisattva abiding on the eighth ground perfects these four dharmas, he is one who has truly entered the Great Vehicle.🔽Subhuti, furthermore, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva abiding on the eighth ground should perfect four dharmas.

original: gzhan yang chos rnam pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos rnam pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that the bodhisattva abiding on the eighth ground should perfect four dharmas.

original: dbang po rab dang tha ma shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas shing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dbang po rab dang tha ma shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas shing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: Knowing the superior and inferior faculties means that while abiding in the perfection of the ten powers of the Tathāgata, when ripening sentient beings,

original: sems can chos zab mo'i snod du gyur tam /
analyzed: sems can chos zab mo'i snod du gyur tam /
translated: Are sentient beings fit vessels for the profound Dharma?🔽

original: ma gyur pa'i dbang po rab dang tha ma rab tu rtog pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: ma gyur pa'i dbang po rab dang tha ma rab tu rtog pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in discerning the faculties of sentient beings, whether they are vessels for the profound Dharma or not, whether they are of highest or lowest capacity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i gzhi'am rgyu yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi sems yongs su dag par byed pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i gzhi'am rgyu yin pa'i phyir sems can gyi sems yongs su dag par byed pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Purifying the buddhaverse means that because sentient beings are the basis or cause for all beings becoming buddhas, purifying the mind of sentient beings is called purifying the buddhaverse.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dang yang du mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dang yang du mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Repeatedly entering into the meditative absorption of illusion-like means

original: byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur thugs su chud pas phyi rol gyi dngos po mi brtsan par ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa tsam gyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur thugs su chud pas phyi rol gyi dngos po mi brtsan par ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa tsam gyis /
translated: that because bodhisattvas have realized all phenomena to be like illusions, without considering external things, by merely entering into meditative absorption,

original: sems kyi dbang du gyur pas bya ba thams cad byed nus pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang du gyur pas bya ba thams cad byed nus pa'o //
translated: they are able to perform all activities under the power of the mind.

original: sems can rnams @225b kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar lus yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir ched du bsams shing srid pa nye bar lan pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' lha dang mi dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams @225b kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar lus yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir ched du bsams shing srid pa nye bar lan pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' lha dang mi dang /
translated: As much as sentient beings' roots of virtue are accomplished, to that extent they are intentionally reborn in existence in order to accomplish a body.
